Everywhere there is a GMO lobbyist or interest at stake, I want to be there, defending and progressing community demands for safe, non-toxic environments. Funding for Legislative Session Expenses The $15,000 goal will cover all salary and organizational expenses for full-time support during the 2014 statewide Legislative Session from January through May 2014. During this time I will be focused on:Delivering our powerful, statistic-based in-person testimony at all hearings state-wide related to pesticides and GMOs, including the upcoming Maui County legislation for pesticide and GMO disclosure, buffer zones and impact studies
Tracking, reporting on, and promoting all related legislative topics and proceedings for public knowledge and awarenessOrganizing local communities to take constitutional and democratic actions that support positive legislation and prevent the government from stripping the people’s rights to a clean environment, health and choiceBuilding global awareness of Hawaii’s GMO and pesticide issues by continually growing our 22,500 subscribers, 13,000 members, and over 22,000 social media followers with a weekly reach of over 700,000 on Facebook aloneGrowing outreach and educational event participation, with a focus on expanding our presence on Oahu and MauiCompleting a comprehensive Hawaii Voting Guide based on all elected officials’ voting records, campaign finance records and legislator surveys to drive votes to quality candidates and to reject candidates who do the chemical industry's bidding and fail to protect us – putting immense pressure on our public officials to act in the best interests of their peopleI am up against a multibillion-dollar global industry with full staffs and millionaire lobbyists that have directed over $515,000 to our elected officials with all the chemical company funding they need to launch massive PR campaigns. I have to budget for everything and have grown our organization tremendously on a very tight budget, and will continue to make strategic use of every dollar.Our ImpactIn the past two years, with no salary funding, I’ve become known as one of the GMO/chemical industries' most public opponents in Hawaii, which is GMO Ground Zero worldwide. I am nearly everywhere they appear regarding policy, opposing their consistent perpetuation of misinformation about the risks of their products, and drawing attention to the amount of money they have given our elected officials and their undue influence. I have done this without any salary and now I am requesting back up. Some highlights of my past work include:Policy History: I have delivered strong testimony on every measure, assisted in directing policy and attended almost every hearing on GMOs and pesticides in the Hawaiian islands since January of 2012. In 2013, I was in the Hawaii Capitol almost every day of session testifying for pesticide regulation, GMO labeling, the right to regulate GMOs and pesticide abuse, pesticide disclosure and public notification, the right for Counties to protect citizen life and health, school edible gardens and locally grown, non-toxic food for our kids and community members. Last year we saw the most progress on this issue in Hawaii ever. Together, we:
Nearly passed GMO labeling for the State of Hawaii
Defeated SB727, the chemical industry’s attempt to remove County rights to protect life and health
Defeated SB590, their attempt to legally shield themselves from pesticide drift and genetic contamination nuisance lawsuits
Passed HB-673, making progress in our pesticide disclosure policy with more public pressure than ever before
Enacted Senate Rule 23, to force a GMO labeling hearing in the Senate after I gathered other groups and Senator signatures
Blocked Monsanto from diverting 2.6 million gallons of water per day in Honolulu through the Water Commission
Passed Resolution 12-57 for GMO labeling in the City & County of Honolulu alongside now Congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard and Councilman Tom Berg
Passed GMO labeling measures in Maui, Kauai and Hawaii Counties for the 2012 Hawaii State Association of Counties legislative package
Passed Kauai County Bill 2491 for GMO and pesticide disclosure, spraying buffer zones and impact studies
Passed Hawaii Island Bill 113 for GMO prohibition
First Amendment Protections: I have been highly involved in, organized, supported, and promoted various community collaboration efforts across the Hawaiian islands, including:
Education at over three dozen outreach events across Hawaii in 2013
2012 March on Monsanto, March on Monsanto II, and March on Syngenta, alongside James W. Macey and Hawaiian sovereignty leader Uncle Walter Ritte
2012 GMO Free Oahu’s Aina Fest
2013 We the People Rally & Heleku March on Hawaii Capitol Legislative Opening Day, under Uncle Walter Ritte's leadership with Dr. Vandana Shiva
2013 Holomua for the Right to Know at the Capitol for GMO labeling

2013 Marches in March; a session of marches on all islands, with Hawaii GMO Justice Coalition and pro-surfer Dustin Barca with over 6,000 participants statewide

2013 Waikiki March Against Monsanto, with the support of over 2,500 people and dozens of our non-profit and supporting groups
2013 Mana March on Kaua`i for Bill 2491 with Ohana O Kauai and Hawaii SEED with over 4,000 in attendance
2013 Haleiwa Aloha Aina March of over a thousand people, with Ohana O Kauai, Dustin Barca, and numerous world famous surfers despite the storm and rain
In 2013, over 17,000 Hawaii residents in total have marched to remove these hazardous companies from Hawaii with our organization, support and/or promotion
Media Appearances: Featured in Business Week, The Huffington Post, The New York Times, Associated Press, Hawaii News Now, KITV, KGMB, KHON, Fox News Radio, Sustainable Pulse, The Garden Island, Civil Beat, Honolulu Weekly, Honolulu Star-Advertiser, The West Australian, Canberra News, David Cain Has Issues, The Seed Story, Hawaii Tribune Herald, For Ewa Today, The Rick Hamada Show, Health Talk Hawaii, Hawaii's Tomorrow, Soap Box Live, Songs of Sovereignty, 102.7 Da Bomb, Star 101, Hawaii Public Radio and numerous other publications and community shows. Inducted into the Hall of Fame by the Every Day Hero Project in 2013. Background: I have had tens of thousands of dollars of leadership development and public speaking training and am the former United States Director of Sales for an electrophysiology technology company with products based on Nobel prize winning research and created by the co-inventor of the Pacemaker. I was mentored by my international CEO, the former Director of  Estée Lauder and a highly decorated Counterintelligence Instructor in the United States Army. I was a child theater actress and professional dancer in my teens and am a graduate of LACHSA. 
As an adult, I shifted my focus from the entertainment industry towards 
gait analysis and muscular sports therapy with a focus on improving 
athletic performance, completing an internship with a chiropractic upper
 cervical specialist. After leaving the sales Director position to free 
more time for Hawaiian
 cultural studies, I worked for combined years in recruiting rare 
technical talent for venture capitalist funded start-ups,
training, natural food distribution and Community Supported Agriculture.
 In addition, I held a Director position for a sustainability based 
curriculum pilot project in West Oahu and I am the former Executive 
Secretary for the Honolulu City Council, District One, Waianae Coast. I was raised in an internationally politically active family, I have to give credit. My Father was an anti-Batista rebel leader in Cuba turned USC graduated 
history professor who engaged in international relations and founded several 
global alliances which negotiated for peace in war zones. I traveled to 16 countries with my parents and observed diplomacy between dozens of countries as a kid but they were extremely busy so we had an unconventional democratic method of governing the household. We had a constitution and statutes which were formed through annual mock legislative sessions around the kitchen table. Everything was approved through negotiation and contractual agreements I had to write, even my ballet lessons. These days, we laugh about how ridiculously serious it was for kids and my Mom just says, "Yeah, but, look at you now!" Other Ways You Can HelpI completely understand if you cannot give financially right now and there are many other ways you can help me accomplish these goals:Share this site with your friends who care about the environment, pesticide abuse and the risks of unregulated genetic engineering and ask them to support. What happens in Hawaii affects the entire world since the bulk of GMO testing and GMO seed industry is occurring here.Volunteer for BAB or collaborate! We need everyone's support on this issue, no matter how small. You can reach me at nomi@babesagainstbiotech.org.Mahalo!

story:
Who is Global Forces?

Founded in 2011 by Kerstin Recker Alexandre, Bonnie Hu, and Rob Frank, Global Forces is a non-profit organization fighting energy poverty by providing sustainable, renewable energy solutions to local communities in developing countries.

Global Forces’ mission is to generate sustainable opportunities through energy investments to help reduce energy poverty in developing countries through solar donations and micro lending programs for aspiring women business owners. Harnessing the power of an advocacy network to promote change allows Global Forces to work with partners across the globe to reach the Millennium Development Goals (MGD’s) and beyond.

For more information, please visit globalforces.org.

What Are We Doing?

In July, Pat Recker, (59), a resident of Iowa, and father of Global Forces co-founder Kerstin Recker, biked in RAGBRAI, the Iowa register’s annual bicycle tour covering 480 miles!!!

This October, members of the Global Forces team will complete the Miami Beach Halloween half marathon. Combined, their efforts will raise money and awareness for renewable energy solutions in developing countries.

Global Forces' first initiative, Solar for Students, seeks to provide solar lanterns and school supplies to thirty elementary and middle school-aged students in the poorest neighborhoods of Arusha, Tanzania.

Meet the Team Running 13.1 miles in Miami!

The following Global Forces Team members have started training and are proud to support Solar for Students. Click on the links to learn more about them, why they support Global Forces and how they are meeting the challenges of training for a half marathon.

  • Kerstin Recker Alexandre, Co-Founder of Global Forces
  • Alia Vajrabukka, Analyst, Information and Research at Global Forces
  • Kimberly Hatton, Director of Fundraising and Partnerships at Global Forces

About 'Solar for Students'

Global Forces will partner with two non-profit organizations to support Solar for Students. The first,  a local non-profit school in Arusha, will provide education to some of Arusha’s poorest students. The second non-profit will provide tuition assistance and education support for the same student body.

Impact

  • 30 students will have increased access to clean energy, mitigating the risks that traditional lighting fuels bring
  • Improve literacy opportunities by providing safe solar lighting for 30 children in Arusha
  • Break the energy poverty cycle starting with 30 families
  • Initiate the building blocks for 30 children and their families to pull themselves out of poverty

Making Your Contributions Count!

Global Forces is a unique organization that directs 100 percent of its funding towards its programs. It is able to operate with zero administrative expenses by leveraging the intellectual capital, dedicaiton and 'know-how' of its board and team members, all of whom have the desire to contribute to the social sector without need for renumeration.(1)

Next Steps: 

  • Fund Solar for Students,  and tell others
  • Tweet us @Globalforces1
  • 'Follow Us' on globalforces.org
  • Like our FB page

All information has been posted on Globalforces.org, Global Forces facebook, and twitter accounts!!!

 

(1) The Indiegogo host site may charge a fee between 0 to 12 percent of total contributions donated.

story:
​ *No 'wild caught' fish are sold, only those bred & acclimated at Biota's Marine Life Center in Florida

RESERVE TO ENSURE NOVEMBER DELIVERY

CLICK HERE to select your package

 

DESIGNED FOR EVERYONE.

It's the easiest & most sustainable tank ever.

 

BIOTA SALTWATER AQUARIUM.

An intelligently engineered 13.5-gallon Saltwater Ecosystem with all required equipment built internally into the tank's design, complete with beautiful sustainably bred fish and coral.

 

 

 

 

BIOTA AQUARIUMS AT A GLANCE

Our mission is to change the home aquarium experience for you and your marine life.

 

​

Each Biota Aquarium minimally (upgrades available) comes complete with guided step by step instructions and support through our (4) Four-Step Setup and everything you need: 

Lights, filtration, cleaners, water conditioners, food supply, sand, coral, clownfish & more... (see Tech Specs below for full list)

 

 

ALL-IN-ONE INTERNAL DESIGN

A carefully designed system with all equipment included, leaving nothing else to buy.

Engineered by experts to avoid common DIY setup problems and give confidence to beginners and novice to own an aquarium, knowing an expert has taken the guesswork and risk out of setting up and maintaining.

 

 

EXPERTLY SELECTED HEALTHY ECOSYSTEM

Livestock, Equipment & Supply combinations have been extensively researched and tested.

 

 

Instead of buying your tank, fish & accessories separately, Biota avoids the problems associated with most DIY systems where people choose the wrong fish, resulting in early failure or loss of life.

At Biota, we created a high quality, low cost solution that foster happy fish and healthy aquariums, changing the home aquarium experience for you and your marine life.

 

 

STANDARD & DELUXE AQUARIUM SOLUTIONS

Both tanks come complete, it just depends on how much marine life you want inside.

 

​

**Both packages include same tank, equipment and supplies, see Tech Specs below for a full listing**

 

STANDARD COMPLETE AQUARIUM

☆★★★★  | $399 - Save 50% Off Retail

The Biota Standard Complete Aquarium comes with everything needed to create a healthy, amazing looking aquarium, including: tank, lights, filtration, cleaners, live rock, fish, sand, step by step guides and a lot more.

 

 

MARINE LIFE INCLUDED:  

  • (2) Orange Clownfish  +  (1) Rainford Goby  +  (1) Live Rock  +  (1) Live Sand Supply + (1) Month Supply of Food

CLICK HERE TO ORDER THE BIOTA STARTER TANK

 

 

DELUXE COMPLETE AQUARIUM [FEATURED]

★★★★★ | $529 - Save 50% Off Retail

The Deluxe Biota Aquarium is complete with everything included with the Standard Aquarium but adds +6 month supply of food & your choice of +4 Cultured Corals at a value better than individually upgrading your tank.

Pick (4) corals of your choice in any combination:

?

 

MARINE LIFE INCLUDED:

  • (4) Live Cultured Corals of choice  +  (6) Month Supply of Food  +  (2) Orange Clownfish  +  (1) Rainford Goby  +  (1) Live Rock  +  (1) Live Sand Supply

CLICK HERE TO ORDER THE BIOTA DELUXE TANK

 

 

 

BEYOND EASY SETUP

Complete setup consist of 4 Simple Steps and 10-14 days total to ensure a healthy aquarium ecosystem.

WATCH THE SETUP TUTORIAL

With the Biota process, we give the fish, live rock, and corals the very best chance to thrive in your Biota Aquarium.

 

 

 

Instead of purchasing "wild caught" fish, taken from the ocean, Biota supplies sustainably aquacultured fish from reputable sources including its own marine life nursery. Fish are acclimated at Biota's Marine Life Center in Florida which means customers receive healthy, disease free fish. Often aquarium fish are exposed to many different holding tanks with different fish which can be breeding grounds for disease and other problems. The Biota Aquarium avoids these problems by sourcing fish that are sustainably bred. Best of all? This means we can ensure our backers that nothing is taken from the ocean. 

 

1st Stretch Goal Reached at $75K! 

We're happy to announce that we will be offering a new coral option! 

This cultured soft coral with eight tentacles has a special pumping action that is mesmerizing! It's one of the few corals that continuously creates motion, it is pinkish tan in color and grows by encrusting over rocks or even the aquarium glass. Pom-Pom Xenia should be placed in the sand under direct light away from other corals due to their prolific growth.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

As a third generation Floridian, Kevin witnessed the decline of Florida's coral reefs first-hand. An avid saltwater aquarist for over 40 years, Kevin began his career by earning his Microbiology and Cell Science degree from the University of Florida. He began breeding fish and corals in 1991, and started a commercial coral farm in 1995.

Kevin was one of the founding members and CEO of the world's most successful marine ornamental fish, coral, and giant clam farm. He was a sustainable marine life collector in the Florida Keys and worked for one of the largest marine wholesalers.

A passion for marine protection led him to the non-profit, Coral Restoration Foundation, where he now serves on the Board of Directors.
Biota Aquariums is a business born from a dream, and Kevin is excited to inspire others to become future marine enthusiasts.

 

Tom Bowling has been fascinated by marine life since he worked in the aquarium trade in Australia as a teen. After working in the industry, he witnessed seemingly unnecessary wild fish deaths and has dedicated his work to breeding fish more suited to aquarium life.

Along with his marine science degree, Tom is also a qualified commercial diver. After a period breeding seahorses (and discovering several new species) while running an aquaculture farm in the Marshall Islands, Tom and his family moved to the remote pacific islands of Palau.

As a Director of Biota Palau, Tom breeds Biota's specialized fish suited to aquarium life. To date, Tom has bred the colorful Clown Triggerfish, Pajama Cardinals, and Mandarinfish among others through sustainable aquaculture practices. Tom's dream is to help share with others a deep appreciation for our ocean and ocean life.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Biota has partnered with premier home aquatics brand, Fluval, to bring you the most compact tank on the market. With its small size of only 22"L x 11.5"W x 15"H, the 13.5 gallon tank fits almost anywhere. Because it doesn't require the bulky cabinetry so many home aquariums do, you can conveniently place your Biota Aquarium on a counter top, dresser, or media stand. And unlike a plastic aquarium, the clear glass is very durable and has a unique, modern floating base design, making it the perfect addition to any room in your home or office.  

Additionally, the touch feature LED light has been engineered to promote coral growth while creating a glowing effect highlighting the beautiful colors of the fish and corals - but it looks beautiful too. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Biota Aquariums was founded to help inspire the next generation of marine enthusiasts. By keeping a saltwater aquarium, one can truly begin to appreciate its beauty, as well as, better understand the delicate balance of our oceans.

You can use the aquarium to teach your friends, loved ones, and even yourself about the wonders of the marine environment. Biota Aquariums is an environmentally responsible company that offers only sustainably bred fish and takes nothing from the ocean, teaching humanity to respect the ocean and inspiring them to learn about ocean conservation.

As a company, we aid in ocean conservation by raising our marine life in captivity. To do this sustainably and humanely, Biota has its own beautiful marine life nursery on the Pacific island of Palau, one of the world's largest marine reserves. Biota's Rainford's Goby comes from this nursery! The clownfish are sourced from a local facility and are conditioned at Biota's Marine Life Center in Florida along with the live rock and corals.

 

 

 

 

 

It's Biota's  mission to conserve our oceans for the generations to come. Aside from marine life education and appreciation, we want to directly give back to our ocean's delicate ecosystem.  

With every Biota purchase, we promise that for every fish bought another fish will be released into the protected waters of Palau. Donations will also go to ocean conversation via the 1% for the Planet™. 

 

 

 

 

1. Biota Aquarium Tank | 2. Heater | 3. Salt Bags | 4. Light Timer | 5. Fish Food |   6. Water Conditioner | 7. Biological Enhancer | 8. Hydrometer | 9. Thermometer | 10. Cleaning Magnets

 

 

After the tank has been setup, you are now ready to redeem your live rock online. Once the rock arrives you will be ready to introduce it to your tank!

 

 

 

 

Your sustainably bred fish & corals can be redeemed online at our website and will be shipped overnight via FedEx right to your door!

 

 

Biota Aquariums is committed to providing the highest quality, sustainably cultured animals that have been thoroughly conditioned for their upcoming journey to you. We treat our fish and corals with the utmost care and meet or exceed industry standards for animal care.

If for any reason our step by step setup instructions and acclimation guide is not successful in the first 15 days, Biota will replace the wildlife and will work with each customer to ensure a healthy re-introduction of the fish and coral. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Aquarium: clear glass
22" L x 11.5" W x 15" H
2-year manufacturer's warranty

Pump: submersible 120V/ uses 7.2 watts
Flow rate = 132 gallons per hour
UL Listed
2-year manufacturer's warranty

Light: Touch LED 16w
Color spectrum 14000 Kelvin
31 LEDs- 50,000 hour life
2-year manufacturer's warranty

Light Timer: Controls photoperiod to keep fish and corals happy.

Sea Salt Mix: (2) packs to make seawater to start the tank. Scientifically formulated for aquariums to match natural seawater.

Hydrometer: Measures salinity or specific gravity to set up and maintain proper salt levels.

Thermometer: Provides visual reading of aquarium temperature.

Heater: 100 watt heater maintains optimal water temperatures.

Cleaning magnets: Specifically designed for glass aquariums to help remove algae from inside the tank without getting your hands wet.

Biological Enhancer (4 oz): Inoculates the aquarium with powerful bacteria to assist with biological filtration.

Live Sand (6.6 Lbs): Live Aragonite Special Coarse Reef Sand. Beautifully white with pink highlights. Packaged in seawater with BioPronto, a culture of naturally occurring beneficial microorganisms that help to purify water in marine aquariums by establishing the biological filtration process.

Water Conditioner (1 oz): Instantly makes tap water safe for making seawater by removing chlorine/chloramines when filtered water is unavailable.

Starter Food (.5 oz): Specially formulated, sustainably sourced marine food helps to maintain color and vitality of the Biota Aquarium fish.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

You say you are a 'sustainable' company. What makes you different from other fish suppliers?

We only sell captive-raised or tank-raised fish. Most other companies sell wild-caught animals. This is not to say that ALL wild caught animals are not sustainably harvested but it almost impossible to know which ones are and which ones are not. The future of the marine hobby is in aquaculture and Biota Aquariums is proud to offer the first-ever commercially available aquarium that includes only cultured animals.

Where do the fish come from?

Our two clownfish come from an aquaculture farm in Florida, USA, and the Rainford's Goby comes from our Biota Marine Life Nursery in Palau. We carefully acclimate the fish at our marine life center in Florida with the aim that you receive healthy, disease-free fish.

Can you ship Biota internationally?

Due to International Agriculture Laws we are only able to ship Biota and our living organisms to the contiguous US (48 contiguous states & Washington DC only).

Why did you pick Clownfish and Goby?

Clownfish and Gobies were chosen because they are captive-raised, beautiful, hardy and they get along great together. They also can live their complete life span in the Biota Aquarium since they do not grow larger than 3".

What is live rock?

Live rock is a calcium-based rock that provides both important habitat for your fish as well as bacteria that aid in maintaining your water quality. It is carefully conditioned in seawater for 4-6 months before being shipped. The live rock included with your Biota Aquarium is man-made in California.

How many corals can I have to my tank?

To ensure a responsibility sustained aquarium, we are limiting each Biota Aquarium order to a maximum of 4 corals. Biota Aquariums offers several hardy soft corals that are appropriate for the tank. These were chosen because of their ease of care, lighting and water flow requirements. 

How long do Clownfish/Goby live for?

Since your fish are captive-raised, their birthdates are known! Clownfish have been documented to reach 30 years or more in captivity. Rainford Gobies have only recently been cultured are believed to live 6 or more years with the proper diet.

How do you ship the items to me?

Biota Aquariums uses courier company FedEx for all US shipments that include tracking numbers. The fish and coral are shipped overnight ensuring safe and healthy wildlife. Please see our section entitled "What's Included" for more details about what si included in each of our 3 shipments. 

What is Biota's 15 Day Guarantee?

Biota Aquariums is committed to providing the highest quality, sustainably cultured animals that have been thoroughly conditioned for their upcoming journey to you.If for any reason our step by step setup instructions and acclimation guide is not successful in the first 15 days, Biota will replace the wildlife and will work with each customer to ensure a healthy re-introduction of the fish and coral. 

How much do I feed my fish?

One of the most important factors in maintaining your new aquatic habitat successfully is following the feeding instructions. DO NOT OVER FEED! The Biota Aquarium comes with a food packet and a measuring spoon. The fish should get one spoonful 2X per day. The best time to feed is after the light has been on for at least 30 minutes and again before the light goes out. Feeding should be at least 4 hours apart. Your fish "sleep" too and eat best during the times when the light is on.

Can I add more fish, live rock, or corals to the tank?
The Biota Aquarium has been specifically designed to house the 3 fish, live rock and a maximum of 4 Biota sourced corals. It is highly recommended that you enjoy your ecosystem and that you DO NOT introduce any other fish to the aquarium as this could comprise the health of your tank and cause biological instability. Once outside fish or corals are introduced to your tank, Biota cannot guarantee the success or livelihood of the ecosystem. 

Can I add plants to the tank?
The Biota Aquarium is a marine ecosystem that will not support freshwater plants. We recommend that you do not add anything to the tank other than the animals, live rock and optional corals offered by us.

What happens if I am going out of town?

Your fish need to be fed daily so proper arrangements should be made to have someone monitor the tank and feed the fish in your absence. There are also fish feeders you can purchase that can feed your fish while you're away.

What is the wattage of Biota's LED light? 

Biota's LED light is a 16-watt output, 1383 lumens. 

What type of pump does Biota use? 

Biota uses a submersible pump with a flow rate of 500 gallons per hour (GPH). 

What does the carbon filter and Biomax Media do for the tank?

Biota's carbon filter removes organics and tannins that make the water yellow. It ultimately maintains crystal clear water. Biomax Media serves as a biological filter to keep water safe by removing ammonia and nitrite created from fish waste. 

Do backers need replacement filters? 

Yes. Biota's carbon filters should be replaced monthly and the Biomax Media and Foam Cartridge needs to be changed annually. A 6 month supply of these supplies can be purchased through our "6 month of Supplies" on Indiegogo or individual replacement items can be purchased through our website after the campaign. 

Why do I need a hydrometer?

Here's a few reasons you need a hydrometer: 

1. To measure the salinity or specific gravity of the water. 

2. To make weekly replacement seawater 

3. To monitor the aquarium water 

Sometimes water in the aquarium slowly evaporates leaving salt behind, gradually increasing the salinity of the aquarium. You'll need to use the hydrometer to monitor this activity so that filtered freshwater can be added to keep salinity constant. Please note salinity should be kept constant at 26 parts per thousand (PPT), 1.019 Specific Gravity for fish only, or 32 PPT/1.023 for fish and corals.

Why do I need a thermometer? Is there an ideal temperature the tank should stay at? 

Because the fish corals come from tropical regions where coral reefs are found, water should ideally be maintained between 74-78 degrees Fahrenheit to maintain healthy, happy marine life. This is vital to the health and longevity of marine life. 

What is the Bio Starter? 

The Bio Starter adds beneficial bacteria to the aquarium during the start-up process and the first month of 'cycling.' This helps establish necessary biological filtering bacteria to maintain proper water quality. 

What type of fish food comes with my Biota Aquarium and where can I buy more when I run out? 

The fish food we provide is sustainably sourced mysis shrimp pellet food. You will be provided with 60 days of fish food in your starter kit. When you run out, you can simply purchase more fish food from our website or by purchasing the "6 Months Supply" Perk on this IGG campaign. 

What color is the live sand substrate, how much is included, how long will it last, and where can I buy replacements?

The live sand substrate is white coral sand and 6.6 pounds will be included in your starter package. Luckily it lasts years and there I no need to replace it. 

How much aquarium sea salt is included, how long will this last, and where can I buy replacements?

Biota comes with two packs of aquarium salt, which provides enough salt to set up your Biota aquarium at the proper salinity. You will need more aquarium salt one week after set up, as you need to change the water of your Biota weekly. You can also buy extra salt from here on the Indiegogo page or your local fish store. We also have a pre-mixed seawater perk that delivers 5 gallons of seawater directly to your door. This makes it so you don't have to mix your own seawater! 

Do the fish have to be removed in order to clean the tank?
No. You can safely clean the glass, pump sponge and filter area without removing any animals. For water exchanges, the water can be carefully siphoned out with a small hose into a bucket. Use care not to siphon up your fish or corals!

What sort of fish do you release back into the ocean for the fish I buy?

At our Biota Marine Life Nursery in Palau, we release rabbitfish into the protected waters to help restock the oceans. They are hardy fish whose stocks are depleted because they are popular fish to eat. You can read more about the work of Biota Palau at www.biotapalau.com
story_txt:
​  *No 'wild caught' fish are sold, only those bred & acclimated at Biota's Marine Life Center in FloridaRESERVE TO ENSURE NOVEMBER DELIVERYCLICK HERE to select your package DESIGNED FOR EVERYONE.It's the easiest & most sustainable tank ever. BIOTA SALTWATER AQUARIUM.An intelligently engineered 13.5-gallon Saltwater Ecosystem with all required equipment built internally into the tank's design, complete with beautiful sustainably bred fish and coral.    BIOTA AQUARIUMS AT A GLANCEOur mission is to change the home aquarium experience for you and your marine life. ​Each Biota Aquarium minimally (upgrades available) comes complete with guided step by step instructions and support through our (4) Four-Step Setup and everything you need: Lights, filtration, cleaners, water conditioners, food supply, sand, coral, clownfish & more... (see Tech Specs below for full list)  ALL-IN-ONE INTERNAL DESIGNA carefully designed system with all equipment included, leaving nothing else to buy.Engineered by experts to avoid common DIY setup problems and give confidence to beginners and novice to own an aquarium, knowing an expert has taken the guesswork and risk out of setting up and maintaining.  EXPERTLY SELECTED HEALTHY ECOSYSTEMLivestock, Equipment & Supply combinations have been extensively researched and tested.  Instead of buying your tank, fish & accessories separately, Biota avoids the problems associated with most DIY systems where people choose the wrong fish, resulting in early failure or loss of life.At Biota, we created a high quality, low cost solution that foster happy fish and healthy aquariums, changing the home aquarium experience for you and your marine life.  STANDARD & DELUXE AQUARIUM SOLUTIONSBoth tanks come complete, it just depends on how much marine life you want inside. ​**Both packages include same tank, equipment and supplies, see Tech Specs below for a full listing** STANDARD COMPLETE AQUARIUM☆★★★★  | $399 - Save 50% Off RetailThe Biota Standard Complete Aquarium comes with everything needed to create a healthy, amazing looking aquarium, including: tank, lights, filtration, cleaners, live rock, fish, sand, step by step guides and a lot more.  MARINE LIFE INCLUDED:  (2) Orange Clownfish  +  (1) Rainford Goby  +  (1) Live Rock  +  (1) Live Sand Supply + (1) Month Supply of FoodCLICK HERE TO ORDER THE BIOTA STARTER TANK  DELUXE COMPLETE AQUARIUM [FEATURED]★★★★★ | $529 - Save 50% Off Retail The Deluxe Biota Aquarium is complete with everything included with the Standard Aquarium but adds +6 month supply of food & your choice of +4 Cultured Corals at a value better than individually upgrading your tank.Pick (4) corals of your choice in any combination: ? MARINE LIFE INCLUDED:
(4) Live Cultured Corals of choice  +  (6) Month Supply of Food  +  (2) Orange Clownfish  +  (1) Rainford Goby  +  (1) Live Rock  +  (1) Live Sand Supply
CLICK HERE TO ORDER THE BIOTA DELUXE TANK   BEYOND EASY SETUPComplete setup consist of 4 Simple Steps and 10-14 days total to ensure a healthy aquarium ecosystem.WATCH THE SETUP TUTORIALWith the Biota process, we give the fish, live rock, and corals the very best chance to thrive in your Biota Aquarium.   Instead of purchasing "wild caught" fish, taken from the ocean, Biota supplies sustainably aquacultured fish from reputable sources including its own marine life nursery. Fish are acclimated at Biota's Marine Life Center in Florida which means customers receive healthy, disease free fish. Often aquarium fish are exposed to many different holding tanks with different fish which can be breeding grounds for disease and other problems. The Biota Aquarium avoids these problems by sourcing fish that are sustainably bred. Best of all? This means we can ensure our backers that nothing is taken from the ocean.  1st Stretch Goal Reached at $75K! We're happy to announce that we will be offering a new coral option! This cultured soft coral with eight tentacles has a special pumping action that is mesmerizing! It's one of the few corals that continuously creates motion, it is pinkish tan in color and grows by encrusting over rocks or even the aquarium glass. Pom-Pom Xenia should be placed in the sand under direct light away from other corals due to their prolific growth.       As a third generation Floridian, Kevin witnessed the decline of Florida's coral reefs first-hand. An avid saltwater aquarist for over 40 years, Kevin began his career by earning his Microbiology and Cell Science degree from the University of Florida. He began breeding fish and corals in 1991, and started a commercial coral farm in 1995.Kevin was one of the founding members and CEO of the world's most successful marine ornamental fish, coral, and giant clam farm. He was a sustainable marine life collector in the Florida Keys and worked for one of the largest marine wholesalers.A passion for marine protection led him to the non-profit, Coral Restoration Foundation, where he now serves on the Board of Directors.Biota Aquariums is a business born from a dream, and Kevin is excited to inspire others to become future marine enthusiasts. Tom Bowling has been fascinated by marine life since he worked in the aquarium trade in Australia as a teen. After working in the industry, he witnessed seemingly unnecessary wild fish deaths and has dedicated his work to breeding fish more suited to aquarium life.Along with his marine science degree, Tom is also a qualified commercial diver. After a period breeding seahorses (and discovering several new species) while running an aquaculture farm in the Marshall Islands, Tom and his family moved to the remote pacific islands of Palau.As a Director of Biota Palau, Tom breeds Biota's specialized fish suited to aquarium life. To date, Tom has bred the colorful Clown Triggerfish, Pajama Cardinals, and Mandarinfish among others through sustainable aquaculture practices. Tom's dream is to help share with others a deep appreciation for our ocean and ocean life.       Biota has partnered with premier home aquatics brand, Fluval, to bring you the most compact tank on the market. With its small size of only 22"L x 11.5"W x 15"H, the 13.5 gallon tank fits almost anywhere. Because it doesn't require the bulky cabinetry so many home aquariums do, you can conveniently place your Biota Aquarium on a counter top, dresser, or media stand. And unlike a plastic aquarium, the clear glass is very durable and has a unique, modern floating base design, making it the perfect addition to any room in your home or office.  Additionally, the touch feature LED light has been engineered to promote coral growth while creating a glowing effect highlighting the beautiful colors of the fish and corals - but it looks beautiful too.       Biota Aquariums was founded to help inspire the next generation of marine enthusiasts. By keeping a saltwater aquarium, one can truly begin to appreciate its beauty, as well as, better understand the delicate balance of our oceans.You can use the aquarium to teach your friends, loved ones, and even yourself about the wonders of the marine environment. Biota Aquariums is an environmentally responsible company that offers only sustainably bred fish and takes nothing from the ocean, teaching humanity to respect the ocean and inspiring them to learn about ocean conservation.As a company, we aid in ocean conservation by raising our marine life in captivity. To do this sustainably and humanely, Biota has its own beautiful marine life nursery on the Pacific island of Palau, one of the world's largest marine reserves. Biota's Rainford's Goby comes from this nursery! The clownfish are sourced from a local facility and are conditioned at Biota's Marine Life Center in Florida along with the live rock and corals.     It's Biota's  mission to conserve our oceans for the generations to come. Aside from marine life education and appreciation, we want to directly give back to our ocean's delicate ecosystem.  With every Biota purchase, we promise that for every fish bought another fish will be released into the protected waters of Palau. Donations will also go to ocean conversation via the 1% for the Planet™.     1. Biota Aquarium Tank | 2. Heater | 3. Salt Bags | 4. Light Timer | 5. Fish Food |   6. Water Conditioner | 7. Biological Enhancer | 8. Hydrometer | 9. Thermometer | 10. Cleaning Magnets  After the tank has been setup, you are now ready to redeem your live rock online. Once the rock arrives you will be ready to introduce it to your tank!    Your sustainably bred fish & corals can be redeemed online at our website and will be shipped overnight via FedEx right to your door!  Biota Aquariums is committed to providing the highest quality, sustainably cultured animals that have been thoroughly conditioned for their upcoming journey to you. We treat our fish and corals with the utmost care and meet or exceed industry standards for animal care.If for any reason our step by step setup instructions and acclimation guide is not successful in the first 15 days, Biota will replace the wildlife and will work with each customer to ensure a healthy re-introduction of the fish and coral.        Aquarium: clear glass22" L x 11.5" W x 15" H2-year manufacturer's warrantyPump: submersible 120V/ uses 7.2 wattsFlow rate = 132 gallons per hourUL Listed2-year manufacturer's warrantyLight: Touch LED 16wColor spectrum 14000 Kelvin31 LEDs- 50,000 hour life2-year manufacturer's warrantyLight Timer: Controls photoperiod to keep fish and corals happy.Sea Salt Mix: (2) packs to make seawater to start the tank. Scientifically formulated for aquariums to match natural seawater.Hydrometer: Measures salinity or specific gravity to set up and maintain proper salt levels.Thermometer: Provides visual reading of aquarium temperature.Heater: 100 watt heater maintains optimal water temperatures.Cleaning magnets: Specifically designed for glass aquariums to help remove algae from inside the tank without getting your hands wet.Biological Enhancer (4 oz): Inoculates the aquarium with powerful bacteria to assist with biological filtration.Live Sand (6.6 Lbs): Live Aragonite Special Coarse Reef Sand. Beautifully white with pink highlights. Packaged in seawater with BioPronto, a culture of naturally occurring beneficial microorganisms that help to purify water in marine aquariums by establishing the biological filtration process.Water Conditioner (1 oz): Instantly makes tap water safe for making seawater by removing chlorine/chloramines when filtered water is unavailable.Starter Food (.5 oz): Specially formulated, sustainably sourced marine food helps to maintain color and vitality of the Biota Aquarium fish.        You say you are a 'sustainable' company. What makes you different from other fish suppliers?We only sell captive-raised or tank-raised fish. Most other companies sell wild-caught animals. This is not to say that ALL wild caught animals are not sustainably harvested but it almost impossible to know which ones are and which ones are not. The future of the marine hobby is in aquaculture and Biota Aquariums is proud to offer the first-ever commercially available aquarium that includes only cultured animals.Where do the fish come from?Our two clownfish come from an aquaculture farm in Florida, USA, and the Rainford's Goby comes from our Biota Marine Life Nursery in Palau. We carefully acclimate the fish at our marine life center in Florida with the aim that you receive healthy, disease-free fish.Can you ship Biota internationally?Due to International Agriculture Laws we are only able to ship Biota and our living organisms to the contiguous US (48 contiguous states & Washington DC only).Why did you pick Clownfish and Goby?Clownfish and Gobies were chosen because they are captive-raised, beautiful, hardy and they get along great together. They also can live their complete life span in the Biota Aquarium since they do not grow larger than 3".What is live rock?Live rock is a calcium-based rock that provides both important habitat for your fish as well as bacteria that aid in maintaining your water quality. It is carefully conditioned in seawater for 4-6 months before being shipped. The live rock included with your Biota Aquarium is man-made in California.How many corals can I have to my tank?To ensure a responsibility sustained aquarium, we are limiting each Biota Aquarium order to a maximum of 4 corals. Biota Aquariums offers several hardy soft corals that are appropriate for the tank. These were chosen because of their ease of care, lighting and water flow requirements. How long do Clownfish/Goby live for?Since your fish are captive-raised, their birthdates are known! Clownfish have been documented to reach 30 years or more in captivity. Rainford Gobies have only recently been cultured are believed to live 6 or more years with the proper diet.How do you ship the items to me?Biota Aquariums uses courier company FedEx for all US shipments that include tracking numbers. The fish and coral are shipped overnight ensuring safe and healthy wildlife. Please see our section entitled "What's Included" for more details about what si included in each of our 3 shipments. What is Biota's 15 Day Guarantee?Biota Aquariums is committed to providing the highest quality, sustainably cultured animals that have been thoroughly conditioned for their upcoming journey to you.If for any reason our step by step setup instructions and acclimation guide is not successful in the first 15 days, Biota will replace the wildlife and will work with each customer to ensure a healthy re-introduction of the fish and coral. How much do I feed my fish?One of the most important factors in maintaining your new aquatic habitat successfully is following the feeding instructions. DO NOT OVER FEED! The Biota Aquarium comes with a food packet and a measuring spoon. The fish should get one spoonful 2X per day. The best time to feed is after the light has been on for at least 30 minutes and again before the light goes out. Feeding should be at least 4 hours apart. Your fish "sleep" too and eat best during the times when the light is on.Can I add more fish, live rock, or corals to the tank?The Biota Aquarium has been specifically designed to house the 3 fish, live rock and a maximum of 4 Biota sourced corals. It is highly recommended that you enjoy your ecosystem and that you DO NOT introduce any other fish to the aquarium as this could comprise the health of your tank and cause biological instability. Once outside fish or corals are introduced to your tank, Biota cannot guarantee the success or livelihood of the ecosystem. Can I add plants to the tank?The Biota Aquarium is a marine ecosystem that will not support freshwater plants. We recommend that you do not add anything to the tank other than the animals, live rock and optional corals offered by us.What happens if I am going out of town?Your fish need to be fed daily so proper arrangements should be made to have someone monitor the tank and feed the fish in your absence. There are also fish feeders you can purchase that can feed your fish while you're away.What is the wattage of Biota's LED light? Biota's LED light is a 16-watt output, 1383 lumens. What type of pump does Biota use? Biota uses a submersible pump with a flow rate of 500 gallons per hour (GPH). What does the carbon filter and Biomax Media do for the tank?Biota's carbon filter removes organics and tannins that make the water yellow. It ultimately maintains crystal clear water. Biomax Media serves as a biological filter to keep water safe by removing ammonia and nitrite created from fish waste. Do backers need replacement filters? Yes. Biota's carbon filters should be replaced monthly and the Biomax Media and Foam Cartridge needs to be changed annually. A 6 month supply of these supplies can be purchased through our "6 month of Supplies" on Indiegogo or individual replacement items can be purchased through our website after the campaign. Why do I need a hydrometer?Here's a few reasons you need a hydrometer: 1. To measure the salinity or specific gravity of the water. 2. To make weekly replacement seawater 3. To monitor the aquarium water Sometimes water in the aquarium slowly evaporates leaving salt behind, gradually increasing the salinity of the aquarium. You'll need to use the hydrometer to monitor this activity so that filtered freshwater can be added to keep salinity constant. Please note salinity should be kept constant at 26 parts per thousand (PPT), 1.019 Specific Gravity for fish only, or 32 PPT/1.023 for fish and corals.Why do I need a thermometer? Is there an ideal temperature the tank should stay at? Because the fish corals come from tropical regions where coral reefs are found, water should ideally be maintained between 74-78 degrees Fahrenheit to maintain healthy, happy marine life. This is vital to the health and longevity of marine life. What is the Bio Starter? The Bio Starter adds beneficial bacteria to the aquarium during the start-up process and the first month of 'cycling.' This helps establish necessary biological filtering bacteria to maintain proper water quality. What type of fish food comes with my Biota Aquarium and where can I buy more when I run out? The fish food we provide is sustainably sourced mysis shrimp pellet food. You will be provided with 60 days of fish food in your starter kit. When you run out, you can simply purchase more fish food from our website or by purchasing the "6 Months Supply" Perk on this IGG campaign. What color is the live sand substrate, how much is included, how long will it last, and where can I buy replacements?The live sand substrate is white coral sand and 6.6 pounds will be included in your starter package. Luckily it lasts years and there I no need to replace it. How much aquarium sea salt is included, how long will this last, and where can I buy replacements?Biota comes with two packs of aquarium salt, which provides enough salt to set up your Biota aquarium at the proper salinity. You will need more aquarium salt one week after set up, as you need to change the water of your Biota weekly. You can also buy extra salt from here on the Indiegogo page or your local fish store. We also have a pre-mixed seawater perk that delivers 5 gallons of seawater directly to your door. This makes it so you don't have to mix your own seawater! Do the fish have to be removed in order to clean the tank?No. You can safely clean the glass, pump sponge and filter area without removing any animals. For water exchanges, the water can be carefully siphoned out with a small hose into a bucket. Use care not to siphon up your fish or corals!What sort of fish do you release back into the ocean for the fish I buy?At our Biota Marine Life Nursery in Palau, we release rabbitfish into the protected waters to help restock the oceans. They are hardy fish whose stocks are depleted because they are popular fish to eat. You can read more about the work of Biota Palau at www.biotapalau.com

story:
Who We Are

Podcasts for Peace is a community-based organization in Acahualinca, Managua, Nicaragua.  We teach digital arts to children and youth to promote critical thinking and community leadership.  Our classes and projects equip participants to become agents of change by starting with their own lives and then looking out at the needs of their neighbors.

We are collaborating with the barrio soccer league on a project to eliminate illegal dumping and trash burning near our athletic field.  Our project includes several phases to achieve the goal of eliminating this persistent environmental hazard which contributes to asthma and lung disease (both prevalent in the neighborhood).  We will paint a community mural on the wall surrounding the field to promote environmental stewardship.  Youth will also document and reflect on this process through digital arts, learning the value and power of democratic, community-based media. 

By the end of our project we will have a green space for healthy recreation.  Youth in our program and the soccer league will have the opportunity to participate and take on leadership roles during every step of the process, from planting trees and shrubs to painting murals and installing a new playground. 

How You Will Help

Your donation will cover the cost of paint and materials for the mural designed by teams from the soccer league.

  •  We will spend $300 on paint and accessories for a  mural which will border our athletic field (approximately 8 x 25 feet in size). 

Your donations will also provide uniforms for the soccer teams that participate by cleaning litter, planting trees, painting murals, and work to keep the space beautiful.

  •  With $600 we can buy 144 uniforms, one for each player in the league.  The uniforms will include: jersey, shorts, and soccer socks for every child.

If we exceed our goal, we will take the teams on an outing to a special field and celebrate the end of the season with a big party!!

    

How We Will Say Thank You

Every donor will receive a personalized digital thank you letter from Podcasts for Peace and one of the barrio soccer teams. 

Donors who give more than $25 will receive a handmade bracelet from one of the students in Podcasts for Peace’s artisanship program. 

Donors who give more than $50 will receive a handmade bracelet and be honored in a special section of the environmental mural.

 

The Impact

Your donation promotes environmental stewardship through shared community art in the form of a mural designed by youth.    

Our soccer teams are organized by youth who do not have the resources at home to purchase matching uniforms.  At the completion of this project, each team will have matching uniforms to affirm their group identity already demonstrated through sportsmanship and friendship.

Your donation supports a piece of a larger project which includes planting trees, creating a garden and installing a playground for small children with the help of a community business and the mayor’s office. 

Podcasts for Peace led a community campaign to install speed bumps last year. Now there are 6 safer streets with a total of 13 speed bumps here in the barrio.  We had excellent support and participation from community members.  This year, with your support and collaboration, we will execute an equally successful project focusing on a major environmental issue that affects the health and wellbeing of youth and children. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot make a financial contribution there are other ways to support our project.

  • You can share a link for this site with friends who may want to contribute.
  • You can send us a letter of support to share with the kids who are working hard. 
  • You can also donate computers to Podcasts for Peace to support ongoing digital arts education in a neighborhood with limited resources.    

 

Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

I am a 46 year old single mother, (my husband passed away from cancer in September 2007), of three children. We live in a beautiful rural town in South Australia. I have an auto-immune liver disorder which has restricted much of what I have been able to do in my life, but one of the things I was told was that I probably would never have any children. Well, I was blessed with 3, however, it has not all been smooth sailing. My youngest two children are boys and both been diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder.

WHEN DID WE GET A DIAGNOSIS

My youngest son began exhibiting signs of something ‘not quite right’ before he was two. One day at a playgroup we attended, another mother asked me if I had considered having him tested for Autism. At first I was astounded. Autism! This was a disorder I had heard of but had no idea about. And had never associated it with regard to my son. I decided that maybe her suggestion had some merit so I thought I should follow up her comment. Eventually the testing led to the confirmed diagnosis of Classic non-verbal Autism.

I remember exactly how I felt when the diagnosis was delivered. It was as though I was inside a big bubble and although I could hear and understand everything I was being told, I just could not reconcile the diagnosis with my son. A million thoughts crowded my mind and although I felt the sadness of what the diagnosis would mean for my son, unlike some other families stories I have read, I did not feel a loss for the ‘little boy that could have been’. I did not have the feeling that I had lost my son, but I did almost immediately realize that this son was going to be lots of work and was going to require lots of my time.

I immediately started looking into “WHAT NEXT” and found a professor who specialised in ABA – Applied Behaviour Analysis. I enrolled myself and my son in this program in Adelaide, a 2 ½ hour drive from Port Pirie, secured a place to stay, a carer for my older son in Adelaide with us, a carer for my daughter here in Port Pirie and organized my husband’s meals etc for the entire time we would be away. The program required my son and myself to be at the university for entire days at a time whilst I learned the program and Tobias learned what was expected from common directions such as, “sit in this chair”, and “find the red spoon”. Each evening after collecting my other son, we returned to our cabin, extremely tired but still with the energy to go to the playground and play on the equipment and share many laughs and fun times. Once returning to Pirie at the conclusion of the program, it was my turn to “school” Tobias with the new lessons we had been taught.

Skip through a few years, and now I found myself having some severe difficulties with my elder son, Zakary. After several visits to specialists over many months we found ourselves at the same point as we had years earlier with Tobias.

Diagnosis – High functioning Asperger’s Syndrome. Oh My, that was kind of a big hit. Oh, well, not much to do but just keep on the best we could so, that’s exactly what happened. I continued to do therapy with Tobias, but now I started specific learning with Zakary to enable him to keep moving forward.

Life was never easy, it seemed that if I was not unwell and having tests, then one of the boys was having difficulties in one or another area. And all the time, we were attending speech sessions, occupational therapy sessions, meditation sessions, eating sessions (how to eat and what to eat) – “No, stones are not food, we do not eat them”, and play sessions so they could learn how to play. THEN……… just when it was time for Tobias to start school, my husband was diagnosed with cancer. Now not only did I have to help the boys get through each day, I also had to explain, somehow, that their daddy was sick and was not going to be with us always. After a very short illness of only 10 months, my beautiful husband eventually gave in and we were left alone.

Now, the fun began. I had to find work to pay the bills and somehow juggle my daughter’s high school years, all of my boy’s sessions and my health issues by myself. It has all been moving on as things are prone to do, but unfortunately being able to “keep up” is about all I have been able to do. 

We now find ourselves in a situation where Tobias is having extreme meltdowns both in and out of school. I have been required to leave my employment and have just recovered from the second cracked rib sustained from a kick whilst attempting to stop Tobias from banging his head on the ground.

Tobias is a loving, caring boy who is extremely sad after every incident, however his autism prevents him from being able to control the anxiety he feels and the way he expresses his frustration is with aggression.

I have the opportunity to receive an autism companion dog for Tobias, which would assist him with his aggression and would also allow Zakary and myself the ability to go out with Tobias, as at the present time, we are unable to go anywhere for fear of Tobias’ meltdowns.

In spite of all the dilemmas Tobias has faced in his life he is a happy boy who loves his family so very much. Although Tobias is classified non-verbal he does have a limited vocabulary and “I love you” is something he says frequently and from his heart.

What We Need & What You Get

What I am trying to achieve with this site is to be able to fund a therapy dog for Tobias, to allow him to have a friend who will love him no matter what and at the same time will be able to calm and settle him to enable better human connections to occur as well. 

What an autism dog will do for Tobias

Autism dogs are more than just a friend for the person they are bonded with. Some of the benefits of an autism dog are:

-  A reduction in anxiety and stress of both child and parents

-  Engagement of entire family

-  Improved sleeping patterns

-  Development of communication and social skills

-  The friendship and unconditional love that a pet provides

-  Assistance Dogs increase safety by preventing a child from wandering or running away in public places as they walk tethered next to a child while the parent controls the actions of the dog. Assistance Dogs are also trained to provide deep pressure by laying across a child’s lap to help calm them and to make contact with a child to help diffuse a meltdown. These dogs can also be trained to track their companion so if the child wanders, they can assist in locating them. 

-  These dogs help the child move through their day successfully and assist in calming and settling activities as required.

-  The purpose of an assistance dog is to assist the child to successfully move through their day with limited stress and aggression.

I have located an autism dog training program which will be able to supply us a dog and although these dogs can cost upward of $50,000.00 to purchase, house and train, for the trainers, the family of the recipient are only required to fund $25,000.00 of that figure. It is also a requirement that the property the dog will be residing at is suitable for living and playing.

In order to do this, I first need to “dog proof” our backyard. Because I have been working to just pay bills and cover therapy sessions up to this point, I have not been able to put any funds into the care and maintenance of our yard. This has unfortunately resulted in us not being able to walk past our back door. The yard is very overgrown, there are prickle bushes everywhere with all the grass that was there having long since died, leaving bare ground which has easily been covered by the ever encroaching prickle bushes, and to make it worse there is no cover over any part of our backyard meaning no shade in any area.

I have asked several contractors to give me prices to develop the backyard by clearing all weeds and prickle bushes, putting down some sort of base and laying some grass for the dog to be able to play and toilet on, and erecting fencing to keep the dog in a small area and therefore, safe. These prices have ranged from between $25,000 to $35,000.

So let’s break that down:

An Autism Assistance Dog:  $25,000.00

Yard clearing:  $35,000.00

So, although this cost of  $60,000.00 is my eventual goal, I am starting smaller to at least start  the process of having the yard cleared in preparation for the time, I am sure, we will be able to bring home a special friend for Tobias to love.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially with this project, that's ok, not every one can. If you are one of these people please help us by:

  • helping us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

And lastly, thank you so much for reading this campaign and stay safe.
story_txt:
Short Summary


I am a 46 year old single mother, (my husband
passed away from cancer in September 2007), of three children. We live in a beautiful rural town in South Australia. I have an
auto-immune liver disorder which has restricted much of what I have been able
to do in my life, but one of the things I was told was that I probably would
never have any children. Well, I was blessed with 3, however, it has not all
been smooth sailing. My youngest two children are boys and both been diagnosed
with Autism Spectrum Disorder.
WHEN
DID WE GET A DIAGNOSIS
My youngest son began exhibiting signs of
something ‘not quite right’ before he was two. One day at a playgroup we
attended, another mother asked me if I had considered having him tested for
Autism. At first I was astounded. Autism! This was a disorder I had heard of
but had no idea about. And had never associated it with regard to my son. I
decided that maybe her suggestion had some merit so I thought I should follow up
her comment. Eventually the testing led to the confirmed diagnosis of Classic non-verbal
Autism. 
I remember exactly how
I felt when the diagnosis was delivered. It was as though I was inside a big bubble and
although I could hear and understand everything I was being told, I just could not reconcile
the diagnosis with my son. A million thoughts crowded my mind and although I
felt the sadness of what the diagnosis would mean for my son, unlike some other
families stories I have read, I did not feel a loss for the ‘little boy that
could have been’. I did not have the
feeling that I had lost my son, but I did almost immediately realize that this
son was going to be lots of work and was going to require lots of my time.
I
immediately started looking into “WHAT NEXT” and found a professor who
specialised in ABA – Applied Behaviour Analysis. I enrolled myself and my son in
this program in Adelaide, a 2 ½ hour drive from Port Pirie, secured a place to
stay, a carer for my older son in Adelaide with us, a carer for my daughter
here in Port Pirie and organized my husband’s meals etc for the entire time we
would be away. The program required my son and myself to be at the university
for entire days at a time whilst I learned the program and Tobias learned what
was expected from common directions such as, “sit in this chair”, and “find the
red spoon”. Each evening after collecting my other son, we returned to our
cabin, extremely tired but still with the energy to go to the playground and
play on the equipment and share many laughs and fun times. Once returning to
Pirie at the conclusion of the program, it was my turn to “school” Tobias with
the new lessons we had been taught. 
Skip through a few
years, and now I found myself having some severe difficulties with my elder
son, Zakary. After several visits to specialists over many months we found
ourselves at the same point as we had years earlier with Tobias. 
Diagnosis – High functioning Asperger’s Syndrome. Oh
My, that was kind of a big hit. Oh, well, not much to do but just keep on the
best we could so, that’s exactly what happened. I continued to do therapy with
Tobias, but now I started specific learning with Zakary to enable him to keep
moving forward.
Life was never easy, it seemed that if I was not unwell
and having tests, then one of the boys was having difficulties in one or
another area. And all the time, we were attending speech sessions,
occupational therapy sessions, meditation sessions, eating sessions (how to eat
and what to eat) – “No, stones are not food, we do not eat them”, and play sessions
so they could learn how to play. THEN……… just when it was time for Tobias to
start school, my husband was diagnosed with cancer. Now not only did I have to
help the boys get through each day, I also had to explain, somehow, that their
daddy was sick and was not going to be with us always. After a very short
illness of only 10 months, my beautiful husband eventually gave in and we were
left alone. 
Now, the fun began. I had to find work to pay the bills and somehow
juggle my daughter’s high school years, all of my boy’s sessions and my health
issues by myself. It has all been moving on as things are prone to do, but
unfortunately being able to “keep up” is about all I have been able to do.  
We now find ourselves in a situation where Tobias is
having extreme meltdowns both in and out of school. I have been required to
leave my employment and have just recovered from the second cracked rib
sustained from a kick whilst attempting to stop Tobias from banging his head on
the ground. 
Tobias is a loving, caring boy who is extremely sad
after every incident, however his autism prevents him from being able to
control the anxiety he feels and the way he expresses his frustration is with aggression.

I have the opportunity to receive an autism companion
dog for Tobias, which would assist him with his aggression and would also allow
Zakary and myself the ability to go out with Tobias, as at the present time, we
are unable to go anywhere for fear of Tobias’ meltdowns. 
In spite of all the dilemmas Tobias has faced in his life
he is a happy boy who loves his family so very much. Although Tobias is classified
non-verbal he does have a limited vocabulary and “I love you” is something he
says frequently and from his heart. 
What We Need & What You Get


What I am trying to achieve with this site is to be
able to fund a therapy dog for Tobias, to allow him to have a friend who will
love him no matter what and at the same time will be able to calm and settle
him to enable better human connections to occur as well.  
What an
autism dog will do for Tobias
Autism dogs are more than just a friend for the person
they are bonded with. Some of the benefits of an autism dog are:
- 
A
reduction in anxiety and stress of both child and parents
- 
Engagement
of entire family
- 
Improved
sleeping patterns
- 
Development
of communication and social skills
- 
The
friendship and unconditional love that a pet provides
- 
Assistance Dogs increase safety by
preventing a child from wandering or running away in public places as they walk
tethered next to a child while the parent controls the actions of the dog.
Assistance Dogs are also trained to provide deep pressure by laying across a
child’s lap to help calm them and to make contact with a child to help diffuse
a meltdown. These dogs can also be trained
to track their companion so if the child wanders, they can assist in locating
them.  
- 
These dogs help the child move
through their day successfully and assist in calming and settling activities as
required.
- 
The purpose of an assistance dog is
to assist the child to successfully move through their day with limited stress
and aggression.
I have located an autism dog training program which
will be able to supply us a dog and although these dogs can cost upward of
$50,000.00 to purchase, house and train, for the trainers, the family of the
recipient are only required to fund $25,000.00 of that figure. It is also a
requirement that the property the dog will be residing at is suitable for
living and playing.
In order to do this, I first need to “dog proof” our
backyard. Because I have been working to just pay bills and cover therapy
sessions up to this point, I have not been able to put any funds into the care
and maintenance of our yard. This has unfortunately resulted in us not being
able to walk past our back door. The yard is very overgrown, there are prickle
bushes everywhere with all the grass that was there having long since died,
leaving bare ground which has easily been covered by the ever encroaching
prickle bushes, and to make it worse there is no cover over any part of our
backyard meaning no shade in any area. 
I
have asked several contractors to give me prices to develop the backyard by
clearing all weeds and prickle bushes, putting down some sort of base and
laying some grass for the dog to be able to play and toilet on, and erecting
fencing to keep the dog in a small area and therefore, safe. These prices have
ranged from between $25,000 to $35,000.
So
let’s break that down:
An
Autism Assistance Dog:  $25,000.00
Yard
clearing:  $35,000.00

So,
although this cost of  $60,000.00 is my
eventual goal, I am starting smaller to at least start  the process of having
the yard cleared in preparation for the time, I am sure, we will be able to
bring home a special friend for Tobias to love.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't help financially with this project, that's ok, not every one can. If you are one of these people please help us by:
helping us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
And lastly, thank you so much for reading this campaign and stay safe.

story:
What is Bamboo Lota?

Bamboo Lota is a social venture that aims to address deforestation and poverty in Malawi through the introduction of bamboo charcoal.

(Already know all about Bamboo Lota and the deforestation issue in Malawi? If so, please feel free to go straight to the perks on the right!)

The majority of households in Malawi use firewood or charcoal for cooking and heating, but current charcoal production is unsustainable and puts heavy strain on forest reserves in the country. By utilizing local, fast growing bamboo, the project aims to produce a more environmentally friendly alternative to current tree-originated charcoal while enabling reforestation efforts to take place in ecologically-strained areas, specifically targeting the Zomba region. Bamboo Lota envisions bringing environmental stewardship to the forefront of community practices while transitioning current charcoal producers into more sustainable bamboo charcoal briquette production. “Lota” means “to dream” in Chichewa and our dream is to bring an innovative model of charcoal production to communities in Malawi.

(Picture: Giant bamboo growing in Zomba)

The project was started by Kyson, Joanna, and Stephanie, classmates from a UC Berkeley course called Entrepreneurship to Address Global Poverty.

After receiving funding from two social venture competitions in 2010, the team traveled to Malawi to conduct a feasibility study and meet with local charcoal producing communities that could benefit from the new concept. The team received an overwhelmingly positive response to the project and discovered the abundance of locally growing bamboo throughout the southern region. The trip was an eye-opening experience to the highs and lows of tackling such a pervasive issue.

In 2011, the project became an official 501(c)3 nonprofit organization and has been conducting research on charcoal-based energy alternative technologies. The team is more dedicated than ever to making a difference in the Malawi and can’t wait to go back.

About Malawi

(Picture via Google)

The landlocked African country is one of the least developed countries in the world and boasts a population of over 15 million people. 85% of the population live in rural areas with low access to basic health and educational services. The majority are poor smallholder farmers who rely on subsistence agriculture to survive and are highly vulnerable to changing climate conditions—drought, flooding, erosion, etc. Despite the harsh realities of poverty, the country has remained largely a peaceful country and boasts a rich culture of kindness and friendliness. The country has been dubbed the “Warm Heart of Africa”.

Why Charcoal?

(Picture: Transporters taking charcoal to market)

Charcoal is often seen today as a backwards and obsolete fuel source. However, for the majority of both urban and rural households in Malawi, charcoal and firewood usage is a way of life and is the only option available. Only 5% of households in Malawi have access to electricity.

However, local dependency on this cheap fuel source is contributing to a dire deforestation problem.  In total, between 1990 and 2010, Malawi lost 16.9% of its forest cover, or around 659,000 hectares—one of the highest deforestation rates in Southeastern Africa.

(Picture: Illegal charcoal production in the hills of Zomba)

This has led to the criminalization of the trade and increased strain on the government to find a more lucrative business for illegal charcoal producers and traders. Currently, the informal charcoal trade employs an estimated 93,000 people—many of which are living below the poverty line. If regulated, it is a multi-million dollar industry that has the capability to become a top agricultural earner alongside tobacco and tea with an estimated worth of $41.3 million in Malawi’s four largest cities alone.

Learn more about the problem here: NY Times 

Why this campaign?

After much delay, the Bamboo Lota team is finally returning to Malawi this summer for two months to work with our partner organization, Emmanuel International, to further:

  • Conduct research on the charcoal value chain
  • Develop our business model
  • Establish partnerships with the government, environmental groups, and local communities to roll out a bamboo charcoal pilot project in the coming year

The trip marks a new stage for Bamboo Lota and hopes to take the idea from concept to reality. The team will be staying in Zomba and be traveling all throughout the southern region to meet with various stakeholders and communities.

(Picture: Bamboo Lota team meeting with a forestry protection community group)

Additionally, the team will be using its professional experience to provide free technology and capacity building trainings to local community-serving organizations in Zomba. These in-person trainings will help organizations address their current organizational issues and provide potential project solutions.

What we need

The funds raised from this campaign will go towards travel and project costs, including but not limited to:

  • Accommodations  
  • In-country travel expenses
  • Kiln prototype materials
  • Bamboo seedlings
  • Value chain analysis

How you can help!

We know not everyone can donate so help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Oh yeah, and donate to our cause! Your donation is tax-deductible AND eligible for a company match!

Let us know if you have any questions or comments. We would love to hear them! E-mail us at info_at_bamboolota_dot_org

story:
Short Summary

Soul Food Farming is a place where your soul and food can connect the way mother nature intended it to be. Come visit us and be apart of something special.

We are currently raising money to build a fully self-sustaining community/shelter running of renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, and wave energy…  we will provide shelter, food, and water to those who are willing to take on a roll in the community providing gardening, education, medicine, etc.

You see, every shelter or cause that has been started needs to be donated to consistently to keep it up and running!   This operation when it’s off the ground will be able to sustain itself, and then we can move to the next province or city and so on!

What We Need is Exposure.... Share our story/project

Again even if it’s just spreading the word about what we are doing, remember this “we miss 100% of the shots we don’t take” so I will keep shooting until I get this one right!

& What You Get

Besides the gifts we are offering for your gracious donations....  we invite you to come be a part of our family..  in construction, marketing, social media, or potential full time resident of our retreat/community.

The Impact

spirituality, ecology, sustainability, reinvention of work, and the arts as meditation

Nurturing the human spirit through advancing our understanding, appreciation and love for the living Earth.

Providing the community a space to help find, and celebrate our place within Nature.

Creating a common awareness of the environmental, social and spiritual benefits of sustainable living within Earth's means.

Having a minimal impact upon the environment.

Other Ways You Can Help or Contact us

http://soulfoodfarming.org 

FaceBook     (https://www.facebook.com/boothboss) - lets stasy in touch, add me to FB

Youtube       (http://www.youtube.com/user/boothboss) - watch my videos, updated daily

Linkedin       (http://ca.linkedin.com/in/soulfoodfarming)

Twitter          (https://twitter.com/Soulfoodfarmin)

Debt Issues (http://debtadvocateinstitute.com)

http://soulcialnetwork.org  - JOIN US & BE A PART OF SOMETHING SPECIAL

http://WheatgrassOrganics.com  - Buy premium fresh and frozen wheatgrass
