story:
Easiest Aquarium and Window Garden.

Taking care of a garden or an aquarium can be a lot of work. Now! Window Aquatica technology employs nature to do the work for you. Enjoy your aquarium and garden, without all the stress/labor. No need to clean your aquarium or fertilize your pots; this self-contained system makes growing herbs at home easier than ever before. The fish waste provides plants with the necessary nutrients to grow, and the plants clean the tank by absorbing the fish waste.

 

Grow fresh, organic herbs in any space!

Window Aquatica is holistic system designed to fit in any home and forever change the way we think about food production. Enjoy fresh, organic herbs any time of year,  grown right in your own home! Window Aquatica is a mini-ecosystem, where the fish waste feeds the plants and the plants clean the water. This is simply the easiest and most economical way to have fresh organic herbs all year round. 

 

Natural Materials

Add this naturally beautiful piece to any room, and watch nature work wonders! Most aquaponic systems are built with a heap of plastic, pumps and lights. The plastics leach into food, the lights waste energy, and eventually all of it ends up in a landfill. We are changing that. Only natural materials and natural light come in contact with your plants and fish. Enjoy the calming atmosphere of an aquarium paired with an urban garden. Cultivate great tasting herbs without the hassle. Easy-to-use and all natural, sustainable and recyclable.

What’s in the box?

Made for Your Window

Window Aquatica is the only aquaponic system that fits on your window sill. Your integrated aquarium and urban garden will add living vibrancy to any space.

Easy to Set Up, Just 5 minutes!

 
  1. Attach Water-Lift to Bamboo Growing Bed.
  2. Place Bamboo Growing Bed on top of Aquarium.  Add Plant Starts, then Clay Pebbles.
  3. Fill Aquarium half way with room temperature drinking water. Cannot be chlorinated water. When Aquarium water and fish water are both at room temperature, add fish to Aquarium.
  4. Move Aquarium to windowsill.  Fill Aquarium to top with room temperature drinking water.
  5. Plug Air pump in.  Done!

 

Features

 

Grow Your Own Herbs

No need to wait for Spring!  Enjoy fresh, organic homegrown herbs and small plants all year-round.

Easy to Use

Window Aquatica is designed for people with no experience with aquariums or gardening.  In fact 1st graders and up will have no problem maintaining it.

Eco-Friendly

This is the most eco-friendly aquaponics system on the market. All materials of the aquaponic ecosystem are natural and either recyclable or biodegradable.

Toxin Free

Most aquaponic systems are built with a heap of plastic, pumps and lights. The plastics leach into food, the lights waste energy, and eventually all of it ends up in a landfill. We are changing that. Non-toxic Natural Materials. Natural Light.

Organic Food

Grow your own organic herbs and small plants, free of toxins and chemicals. Yes, you can taste the difference!

Complete Ecosystem

The mini ecosystem means no mess! This aquarium is part of a self-cleaning system, aided directly by the plants.

Monolithic Glass 

The aquarium is designed as one continuous glass piece, eliminating joints and adhesives. It is non-toxic and recyclable.

Water Circulation System 

Our unique system pumps air to the bottom of the tank.  When the air bubbles rise, they bring the water with them, propelling water into the bamboo growing bed. 

 

The Bigger Picture

Nourish2Thrive Co-op is working hard to play our part in the revolution to make food production accessible to everyone. By growing your own food, you are becoming part of a major cultural shift toward healthier living and harmony with nature. We’re determined to help young people get away from their screens and learn the fundamentals of the circle of life on earth by connecting them directly with their food.

Team

Benjamin Thompson, Co-Founder

Orion Rodriguez

John Vallas

 

 

 

Timeline

Perks

***ALL campaign backers will be named as a "Founder" of Nourish2Thrive Cooperative on our website, forever!

 

Risks and Challenges

Currently, about 10% of the monolithic glass aquariums have been breaking during shipping. Benjamin, who has an MS in Structural Engineering, is in the process of engineering a more robust packaging setup and we plan to achieve less than 1% breaking rate by the time Window Aquatica ships to our backers.

Not many varieties of fish can live in a window where temperatures are more variable than the rest of the house. So far we've only verified two species that do really well in the window: Rosy Barbs and Mosquito Fish. We plan on expanding the list of viable fish, but we are worried that newbie aquarists will try to put other types of fish and the fish will die. To mitigate this problem, we will be developing a simple and obvious user guide to be shipped with the kit.

The plastics leach into food, the lights waste energy, and eventually all of it ends up in a landfill. We are changing that. Non-toxic Natural Materials. Natural Light.Organic FoodGrow your own organic herbs and small plants, free of toxins and chemicals. Yes, you can taste the difference!Complete EcosystemThe mini ecosystem means no mess! This aquarium is part of a self-cleaning system, aided directly by the plants.Monolithic Glass The aquarium is designed as one continuous glass piece, eliminating joints and adhesives. It is non-toxic and recyclable.Water Circulation System Our unique system pumps air to the bottom of the tank.  When the air bubbles rise, they bring the water with them, propelling water into the bamboo growing bed.  The Bigger PictureNourish2Thrive Co-op is working hard to play our part in the revolution to make food production accessible to everyone. By growing your own food, you are becoming part of a major cultural shift toward healthier living and harmony with nature. We’re determined to help young people get away from their screens and learn the fundamentals of the circle of life on earth by connecting them directly with their food.TeamBenjamin Thompson, Co-FounderOrion RodriguezJohn Vallas   TimelinePerks***ALL campaign backers will be named as a "Founder" of Nourish2Thrive Cooperative on our website, forever! Risks and ChallengesCurrently, about 10% of the monolithic glass aquariums have been breaking during shipping. Benjamin, who has an MS in Structural Engineering, is in the process of engineering a more robust packaging setup and we plan to achieve less than 1% breaking rate by the time Window Aquatica ships to our backers.Not many varieties of fish can live in a window where temperatures are more variable than the rest of the house. So far we've only verified two species that do really well in the window: Rosy Barbs and Mosquito Fish. We plan on expanding the list of viable fish, but we are worried that newbie aquarists will try to put other types of fish and the fish will die. To mitigate this problem, we will be developing a simple and obvious user guide to be shipped with the kit.

story:
Building Blocks 

I first saw JeanAnn's Pollard's work when we met four years ago to help lobby for a national price on carbon with Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL). We quickly realized our art could be a powerful advocacy tool in Maine and created our "Earth: Love it or Lose it” show calling people to action on climate change solutions. We have used our art as a catalyst at presentations and conversations about climate solutions with Senator King at UNE, CCL’s national policy director Danny Richter at Bates, the ‘Earth in Brackets’ student group from COA who participated in the Paris Talks, and much more.

 

We have found a need for art in helping build a bridge between what it takes to create climate policy, and what is in people’s hearts. As my friend Liz says, “Words communicate with your mind, art drills you to the core”.  We need that connection between the minds of the politicians and hearts of the people. 

 

With your help, our ‘Let’s put a price on carbon!’ campaign will build that bridge.

What we are doing:

Specifically, your money donated toward Maine CCL's advocacy will help:

1) Expand the variety of tabling and outreach visuals illustrating what pricing carbon is all about. We will pool other artists’ and volunteers' resources as well as expand our own, creating material presented in a range of forms from banners to info handouts, videos, music lists, computer graphics, call to action opportunities, and more. The increased variety of visuals will allow us to have a voice in more outreach venues and to a wider audience. We will be particularly focused on developing visuals that appeal to a bipartisan audience. 

2) Expand the number of visuals in ME/NH/VT to outfit 12 (and growing) CCL chapters. We will cover printing costs, purchase tabling materials, and generally outfit each chapter with basic outreach tools. 

3) Showcase this power of art in Washington, DC in June so we can expand the sphere of influence of this ‘Let’s Put a Price on Carbon!’ campaign. I was the art coordinator for CCL's North East Regional Conference in March where JeanAnn, myself, and many other artists and volunteers shared new outreach material. At CCL's National Conference & Lobby Day in June I will again show our work and coordinate volunteers from across the country in sharing effective outreach visuals and strategies. 

 

Your support will help cover a wide range of printing costs, professional help, travel expenses (I'll be taking public ground transportation to DC) and purchase of tabling material to be shared with volunteers across Maine. 

​

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

This campaign's longterm goals are to continue expanding visual resources to keep up with increasing numbers of advocacy volunteers.  There is increasing congressional conversation towards a national price on carbon and we will continue to use the power of art to connect people with a sense of optimism about climate solutions by communicating the viability of a price on carbon. 

Although donations to this campaign are not tax-deductible (sorry!), we are establishing as a non-profit for future fundraising through grants. 

​

I hope you can donate to help and own a piece of mine or JeanAnn's art, and hopefully your name will be drawn to receive one of my medium sized 'Sunflowers for Sustainability'! 

"The visuals focus Laurie and her team have been bringing to the advocacy efforts towards a price on carbon has been invaluable. I am happy to endorse it on behalf of MaineCCL" - Peter Garrett, CCL State Coordinator of Northern NewEngland

If you’re unable to contribute financially, please share this post far and wide with friends! 

Thank-you! 

For more info:

Conservative Carbon Dividends Plan - viable pricing proposal

Cracking National Gridlock, Jay Butera - success of CCL volunteer work

Laurie Sproul sculpture

JeanAnn Pollard painting

Citizens' Climate Lobby website

"If you want to join the fight to save the planet there is no more effective step you could take than become and active member [of Citizens' Climate Lobby]" - James Hansen.

story:
Puerto Rico is fertile ground for the implementation and nurturing of the biological energy industry. 

We will develop the working model of a self-sufficient, green bioenergy agricultural and manufacturing facility. 

Blueprints of the most efficient facility will be published along with blueprints of commercialization of resources produced by the facility.
story_txt: Puerto Rico is fertile ground for the implementation and nurturing of the biological energy industry. We will develop the working model of a self-sufficient, green bioenergy agricultural and manufacturing facility. Blueprints of the most efficient facility will be published along with blueprints of commercialization of resources produced by the facility.

story:
1. OUR GOALS

Our first goal is to create a dormitory space where local volunteers, international guests and workshop participants can stay and learn permaculture with us. Our dorm and site will also be ready to be used as an evacuation point, community kitchen and/or safe zone for any future natural disasters (since September last year, Emas Hitam has been involved in Agung Siaga’s relief efforts for Mt Agung’s eruptions, and recently the Lombok earthquakes through volunteering, donation sorting and logistics support).

The following are our funding milestones:

  • $5000: Dormitory Accommodation (foundation, structure, bunk beds, interior fittings, roofing, and balcony)
  • +$1000: Shared kitchen (foundation, structure, traditional Balinese kitchen, natural oven, rocket stove, greywater system, water filter, plumbing, sink, cooking supplies)
  • +$500: Rainwater storage system (platform, rainwater tank, bamboo casing, piping, taps, mesh filter)
  • +1000: Shared bathroom (foundation, roofing, structure, dry compost toilets, solar showers, greywater system)
  • +$2500: Family bungalow with separate bathroom (foundation, structure, beds, interior fittings, roofing, balcony, dry compost toilet, shower area)

If we achieve over $10,000, we will propose other facilities- voted on by our donor community, such as a shared living space or transportation to collect village waste!

Image: Dorm design

2.            OUR ‘WHY’

Why not?

Because we can, because we have to, because we want to! We understand that the old system is dying, as well as the old way of doing things. We know how to find regenerative solutions based on collaboration that are bound by the ethics and principles of permaculture. We want to design Ancut Garden Oasis (AGO) as a whole system, where each element and human being can achieve their highest purpose- trusting each other, and creating a community life that can be an example for others.

3. WHO WE ARE  

We are a group of friends who share a similar vision of how we want to live our lives. We all come from different backgrounds and have had successful lives so far, however each one of felt that there was something missing. We found it when we connected with the land. Working together, we realised the impact that we can have by teaching people how to grow their own food and regenerate their land. So together with the local community, we created Ancut Garden Oasis. We believe we can have a positive impact in our world, by caring for people, our Planet and with the fair redistribution of our surplus. We want to be a part of something bigger than ourselves, and we know that we cannot do it alone.

4.   OUR STORY

After Kadek graduated from Vandana Shiva’s Navdanya University in 2015, Kadek and Feny were inspired to co-found Emas Hitam Indonesia (EHI) with the support of other young Indonesians in December 2015.

Since this time, the team have been actively contributing to food sovereignty and sustainability movements in Bali and across Indonesia. Our trainings include:

  • Sekaroh, East Lombok (June-July 2016): EHI trained a group of 32 farmers struggling to grow a single crop of corn each year, teaching them how to regenerate their soil applying permaculture design principles.
  • Karangasem, East Bali (Nov 2017): The EHI team delivered a customized workshop for 3 villages on nitrogen-fixation, the use of vetiver grass as erosion prevention, and how to create a sustainable business growing moringa oleifera.
  • Malaka, Io Kufeu, West Timor (Aug 2017): EHI’s training introduced the concept of regenerative agriculture to 3 communities dealing with unsustainable farming practises. 

In November 2017, we co-created the JAGA Indonesia Festival: Celebrating Agroecology and Seed Freedom- a free event for over 250 Indonesian farmers, students, government representatives and activists in Bali and Java. Kadek’s Navdanya University teachers came especially from India to share their practical workshops on agroecology, food sovereignty, liquid compost, and seed-saving.

Additionally, we have been involved in training, consulting and speaking engagements including Ubud Food Festival, Slow Food Bali events, IDEP’s Introduction to Permaculture Course, and Udayana University’s Earth Day student workshop.

5.    OUR SITE

Since December 2017, we have been operating at Ancut Garden, our new site in Petulu, which is 100% pesticide free, chemical fertilizer-free and non-GMO. In Balinese, ‘ancut’ (pronounced ‘anchoot’), means the ‘border’ or ‘edge’. It is the place where two realities meet- life as we know it and the life that we want to live! Since moving here, we have built:

  • Our 2-storey timber AGO Eco-house with dry composting toilet (supported by Permafund Australia)
  • Seedling nursery and worm farm
  • Hot compost area (4x compost bays, biochar kiln, chipper and leaf cutter machines)
  • Garden design (3x ricefields, kitchen gardens, raised mandala beds, 3x banana circles, 2x ponds, 10x biopori)
  • Food forest (fruit trees and root crops including moringa, bananas, taro, sweet potato, cassava, jackfruit, durian, rambutan, snakefruit, white mango, papaya, sugarcane, coconuts, vanilla, pepper and many more!)
  • Waste management system
  • Access and parking
  • IN PROGRESS: community learning space, 2nd composting toilet, grocery space, AGO Bamboo house

Image: Before/After photos of 1) AGO Eco-house 2) Community Space 3) Compost Area

6.    OUR COMMUNITY PROJECTS

  • Compost the World: Supported by AVI and the Planet Wheeler Foundation’s Community Grants Scheme- we have created an on-site organic materials processing and recycling facility that recovers agricultural waste from our own garden and the community, and processes it into soil-building materials and compost products- including biochar, cocopeat, mulch, worm castings, worm tea, and hot compost! Together with the local farming community, we aim to transition Banjar Petulu Desa to organic rice production, using our compost facility to regenerate the soil.

  • Little Seeds Children’s Workshops: Education program for the local Petulu kindergarten and schools around Bali.

  • Petulu & Tabanan Subak Site Tour: Workshops for international tour groups about the Subak (UNESCO-listed Balinese rice irrigation system), permaculture, waste management, bamboo construction, and sustainable rice-planting in our own village and in Central-North Bali.

7.    YOUR REWARDS

Our unique rewards are designed to say a big THANK YOU to you- for supporting our project!

EVERY DONOR WILL RECEIVE:

1) Your name on our educational plant mural in our community space in 2019! The mural will feature botanical illustrations and names of tropical and native Indonesian plants at our site.

2) Free entry into a weekly raffle to WIN ACCOMMODATION at Ancut Garden Oasis from 2019. We want each person to have the opportunity to ‘win big’, no matter what they contribute to us! Raffle will be drawn LIVE on Saturday of each week, for the 5 weeks of the campaign.

DONOR REWARDS:

  • $5 - BE THE CHANGE: Name on our mural + raffle entry + Facebook thank you
  • $10 - SOW THE SEEDS: Mural + raffle entry + plant an edible flower seed in your name
  • $25 - HEALING HERBS: Mural + raffle entry + plant a local medicinal plant in your name
  • $50 - GROWING FORESTS: Mural + raffle entry + plant a fruit tree in your name
  • $75 - LITTLE GARDENERS: Mural + raffle entry + sponsor local children’s workshop and seedling for their home garden
  • $100 - WELCOME TO THE JUNGLE: Mural + raffle entry + 1 night dormitory stay at our site when you come to Bali + Balinese Language Workshop [3rd prize in the weekly raffle]
  • $200 - LIVIN’ ON THE EDGE: Mural + raffle entry + 1 night dormitory stay + Intro to Permaculture Workshop [2nd Prize in the weekly raffle]
  • $350 - TOMORROW COMES TODAY: Mural + raffle entry + 2 nights dormitory stay + Intro to Permaculture Workshop + Balinese Language Workshop [1st Prize in the weekly raffle]
  • $500 - BEAUTIFUL FUTURE: Mural + raffle entry + 2 nights in our beautiful AGO Bamboo House (2 pax) + Slow Food cooking class
  • $750 - RAY OF LIGHT: Mural + raffle entry + 3 night stay  in our timber AGO Eco-house (4 pax) + Intro to Permaculture Design Workshop
  • $1000 - HEAL THE WORLD: Mural + raffle entry + 1 week stay in AGO Eco-house (4 pax) or Bamboo House (2 pax) + Subak Site Tour
  • $2500 - WE CAN BE HEROES: Mural + raffle entry + 2 week stay in AGO Eco-house (4x pax) or Bamboo House (2 pax) + Customized Permaculture Experience (1-day Subak Site Tour, 1-day Permaculture Bali Tour, Slow Food cooking class, Balinese Language Worksop, etc…)

Please note: For the accommodation, you can come anytime in the future from 2019. If you cannot make it to our site, you may gift your stay to a friend, or to a local volunteer. If you live in a different part of the world- the workshop rewards can also be taken over Skype! The rewards above are our way of saying "thank you” for supporting our project, they are not representative of the actual item costs.

8.    YOUR IMPACT

Why do we do crowdfunding?

We want Ancut Garden Oasis to be a catalyst for change, not just for Bali, but for YOU- the people who share our vision. Although we will be the first recipients, everyone collaborating with us will know that they are part of the solution- it’s not just about us, its about ALL of us.

AGO provides an example of an integrated community life in which there is no competition (win/lose), only collaboration (win-win). Kadek is already being seen as a local ‘trailblazer’ in our community through alternative ways of rice farming and soil regeneration. We are living in a critical time- and supporting our locally-owned project is pledging your faith and belief that the world can be a better place.

9.    RISKS AND CHALLENGES

For almost 3 years, we have continued to find innovative solutions to the problems we have been faced with - one of Bill Mollison’s permaculture design principles is “the problem is the solution”.

Through limited resources, drought, Bali’s current water crisis, torrential rainy seasons, and language barriers, we continue to stay passionate and motivated. Our only challenge is to maintain the continuity of what we have already applied, which is why we have chosen crowdfunding to move our project forward at this time. We have come too far not to keep going. We are at the grassroots- for us, the only way is up!

10.    WHAT OUR SUPPORTERS SAY

Since 2016, we have been opening up our sites to the general public: here’s what they have said:

  • "Happy Permaculture Day! I came to learn about agriculture, but what I got was an introduction to a new philosophy! It's truly inspiring that the principles and the practise of permaculture can be applied in all walks of life. I'm hoping to come back to learn more about the agriculture part of it, and hoping to apply the philosophy in my personal and professional life. Thank you for organizing this! I'm grateful to have met this foundation" – Septira (Jakarta, Java, Indonesia)
  • "So this is the first time I come to this foundation, actually I don't know what will I do here, But I think the people here are very kind, so friendly, Before I knew that this foundation has a good program that to help the people who get suffered because of Agung erupting. So because of I am Balinese, I am so happy to know about that. There are so many people from abroad that really care with us here in Bali. Thank you! So my new friend show me your good activity and I think I will love it. Thank you." – Ari (Plaga, Bali, Indonesia)
  • "Les agradezco mucho por lo compartido, la experienca y el intercambio. Gracias por sequir trabajando y colaborando a favor de le tierra. Salud y buena vida" – Melisa (Argentina)
  • “I am now very interested in permaculture after seeing all the amazing things Emas Hitam is doing. I hope Emas Hitam continues to go from strength to strength! Thank you for showing me the power of passionate people through this garden" – Mel (Australia)
  •  “Vous faites un travail fantastique ici !!! Congratulations pour tout ce que vous apportez à la Terre, notre belle planète que nous partageons tous. Continuez, n’abandonnez jamais, et sachez qu’il y a beaucoup de personnes travaillant avec vous à travers le monde !!! " – Thomas (France)
  • "Thanks for letting me into your beautiful project and people. It is very inspiring to find people fighting for similar goals far away from home and under different environments” – Daniel (Denmark)
  • "Om Swastiyastu. Terima kasih untuk pagi yang sangat luar biasa. Hari ini kami belajar banyak hal dan mengingat masa kecil kami melihat Kakek dan Nenek kami bertani. Bless of live for Balinese Farmer" – Surya (Ubud, Bali, Indonesia)
  • "Saya sangat menyukai kegiatan membudidayakan tanaman organic yg alami. Sehat dan bebas kimia. Sehingga dapat dikonsumsi dengan aman dan membuat tubuh kita terbebas dari sat yang dapat membuat masalah dalam tubuh kita. Hendaknya kita terus kembangkan aktivitas dan budaya konsumsi makanan sehat. Thanks" - Amin (Denpasar, Bali, Indonesia)

11.    ADDITIONAL WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

  • SHARE our campaign with your friends!
  • COME and visit our site if you are in Bali!
  • SUPPORT local produce, farmers, and transition movements in your own community!
  • READ some of our favourite literature (and suggest your own to us): Who Really Feeds the World? (Vandana Shiva), Drawdown (Paul Hawken), One Straw Revolution (Masanobu Fukouka), The Value of Nothing (Raj Patel), Permaculture: Principles and Pathways Beyond Sustainability (David Holmgren), This Changes Everything (Naomi Klein), Dark Emu (Bruce Pascoe), Sacred Economics (Charles Eisenstein), The Tao of Physics (Fritjof Capra), The Art of Simple Food (Alice Waters).

If you can donate- THANK YOU! Your help is a giant step for us. Every single gesture matters- it is the accumulation of small actions which are the basis for changing the world.

THANKS FOR THE SUPPORT

 

 

 

---------------VERSION FRANÇAISE------------------

 

1.   NOS OBJECTIFS

Notre premier objectif est d’obtenir les fonds suffisants pour acheter les matériaux de construction d’un dortoir pour que les volontaires (locaux ou internationaux) que nous souhaitons héberger puissent participer à nos ateliers de permaculture. Autre avantage : notre site sera prêt à servir de point d'évacuation, de cuisine communautaire et de zone de sécurité en cas de catastrophe naturelle (depuis septembre dernier, suite aux éruptions du Mont Agung et, plus récemment, aux tremblements de terre sur Lombok, le groupement Emas Hitam coopère avec l'association Agung Siaga en apportant bénévolement son soutien sur la logistique et le tri des donations).

Voici les étapes de notre financement :

  • $5000 : Dortoir (fondation, structure, lits superposés, aménagement intérieur, toiture, et balcon)
  • +$1000 : Cuisine commune (fondation, structure, cuisine traditionnelle Balinaise, four naturel, rocket stove, système de traitement des eaux grises, filtre à eau, plomberie, évier, matériels de cuisine)
  • +$500 : Système de stockage d'eau de pluie (plateforme, réservoir d'eau de pluie, enveloppe en bambou, tuyauterie, robinets, filtre en maille)
  • +1000 : Salle de bain commune (fondation, toiture, structure, toilettes sèches, douche solaire, système de traitement des eaux grises )
  • +$2500 : Bungalow familial avec salle de bain privée (fondation, structure, lits, aménagement intérieur, toiture, balcon, toilettes sèches, douche)

Si nous dépassons 10,000 $, nous proposerons d'autres installations votées par notre communauté de donateurs, tels qu'un espace de vie partagé, un véhicule pour la collecte des déchets du villages, etc...

Image: Dormitory plans (10x10m octagonal design, pitched roof and balcony on terrace)

2. NOTRE “POURQUOI”

Pourquoi pas ?

Parce que nous pouvons, parce que nous devons, parce que nous voulons! Nous comprenons que l'ancien système est en train de mourir, tout comme l'ancienne façon de faire les choses. Nous savons comment trouver des solutions régénératrices basées sur la collaboration, et liées à l'éthique et aux principes de la permaculture. Nous voulons concevoir l'Oasis Ancut Garden comme un système complet, où chaque élément et chaque être humain peuvent atteindre leur objectif le plus élevé: se faire confiance et créer un lieu departage qui peut être un exemple pour les autres.

3. QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?

Nous sommes un groupe d'amis qui partagent les mêmes choix de vie. Nous provenons tous d'horizons différents et bien que nos parcours furent riches en expériences, chacun de nous avait l’intime conviction qu'il lui manquait quelque chose pour pleinement s’accomplir. Nous avons trouvé la solution lorsque nous nous sommes reconnectés avec la nature. En travaillant ensemble, nous avons réalisé l'impact que nous pouvions avoir en enseignant aux gens comment cultiver leur propre nourriture et régénérer leurs terres, en parfaite autonomie. C’est ainsi qu’avec la communauté locale, nous avons créé l'Oasis Ancut Garden. Nous sommes convaincus de l’influence positive de ce projet sur notre monde, en prenant soin de nous, de notre planète et de la redistribution équitable de nos excédents. Grâce à votre accompagnement, nous pourrons démontrer de façon factuelle qu’il est possible de faire partie de quelque chose de plus grand que nous, de proposer de nouvelles perspectives pour une vie plus saine et harmonieuse avec l'environnement.

4. NOTRE HISTOIRE

Après avoir obtenu son diplôme  à l’Université Navdanya de Vandana Shiva en 2015, Kadek et Feny ont été inspirés par la co-création d’Emas Hitam Indonesia (EHI) avec le soutien d’autres jeunes Indonésiens en décembre 2015.

Depuis ce temps, l’équipe a activement contribué aux mouvements de souveraineté alimentaire et de développement durable à Bali et en Indonésie. Nos formations comprennentnotamment :

  • Sekaroh, Est de Lombok (Juin-Juillet 2016) : EHI a formé un groupe de 32 agriculteurs qui luttaient chaque année pour cultiver une monoculture de maïs, en leur enseignant comment régénérer leur sol, en appliquant les principes de la conception en permaculture.
  • Karangasem, Est de Bali (Nov. 2017) : L'équipe EHI a organisé un atelier personnalisé pour 3 villages sur la fixation de l'azote, l'utilisation du vétiver comme moyen de prévention de l'érosion et la création d'une entreprise durable pour le moringa oleifera.
  • Malaka, Io Kufeu, Timor Occidental (Août 2017) : la formation EHI a introduit le concept d’agriculture régénérative dans 3 communautés qui s’occupent de pratiques agricoles non durables.

En Novembre 2017, nous avons co-créé le festival ”JAGA Indonesia: Celebrating Agroecology and Seed Freedom”, un événement gratuit pour plus de 250 agriculteurs, étudiants, représentants gouvernementaux et activistes indonésiens de Bali et Java. Les professeurs de l’Université Navdanya de Kadek sont venus spécialement d’Inde, pour partager leurs ateliers pratiques sur l’agroécologie, la souveraineté alimentaire, le compost liquide et la conservation des semences.

En outre, nous avons participé à des formations, consultations et conférences, notamment au ”Ubud Food Festival”, aux événements ”Slow Food Bali”, au cours ”Introduction à la permaculture” de l’organisation IDEP et à l’atelier des étudiants de l’Université Udayana ”Earth Day”.

5. NOTRE SITE

Depuis Décembre 2017, nous opérons à Ancut Garden, notre nouveau site à Petulu, 100% sans pesticides, sans engrais chimiques et sans OGM. En balinais, ”ancut” (prononcé anchout) signifie la ”frontière” ou ”bordure”. C'est le lieu où deux réalités se rencontrent, la vie que nous connaissons et la vie que nous voulons vivre! Depuis notre déménagement, nous avons construit :

  • Notre Eco-maison de deux étages avec toilettes sèches
  • Pépinière et ferme de vers de terre
  • Zone de compostage à chaud (4x bacs  pour collecter les matériaux compostables, four à biocharbon, broyeur et machines à découper les feuilles)
  • Design du jardin (3 x rizières, jardins potagers, jardin en mandala , 3 ”banana circles”, 2 étangs, 10 ”biopori”)
  • Forêt vivrière (arbres fruitiers et racines: moringas, bananes, taros, patates douces, maniocs, jacquiers, durians, ramboutans, fruits du serpent, mangues blanches, papayes, cannes à sucre, noix de coco, vanille, poivre et bien d'autres !)
  • Système de management des déchets
  • Accès et stationnement
  • EN COURS : espace d'apprentissage , 2ème toilettes sèches , épicerie, AGO Bamboo house, structures à compost

Image: Avant/Après photos de 1) AGO Eco-house 2) Espace d'apprentissage 3) Compost Area

6.    NOS PROJETS AVEC LA COMMUNAUTE

  • “Compost the World” : Soutenu par le Community Grants Scheme de la fondation Planet Wheeler et AVI- Nous avons une installation de traitement et de recyclage des matières organiques sur site qui récupère les déchets agricoles de notre jardin et de la communauté et les transforme en matériaux de construction et en produits de compost (biocharbons, fibres de coco, paillis, excrétions solides et liquides de verres de terre, et compost chaud)! En collaboration avec la communauté agricole locale, nous visons la transition du quartier ”Petulu Desa”, afin de convertir les rizières en biologique, et en utilisant notre installation de compost, afin de régénérer les sols.

  • “Little Seeds” ateliers pour enfants : Programme d’ateliers  pour enfants ,  auprès des écoles  de Petulu  et à travers Bali.

  • “Petulu & Tabanan Subak Site Tour” : Ateliers pour groupes de touristes internationaux à propos des Subak (système Balinais  concernant l'irrigation des rizières  et classé à l'UNESCO), la permaculture, la gestion des déchets, la construction en bambou et la riziculture durable dans notre village et dans le centre-nord de Bali.

Nous voulons que chaque personne ait la possibilité de “gagner gros”, quelque soit sa contribution ! La tirage au sort aura lieu en direct le samedi de chaque semaine, pendant les 5 semaines de la campagne.

Les récompenses ci-dessus sont notre façon de vous remercier pour avoir soutenu notre projet, elles ne sont pas représentatives de leurs coûts réels.

8. VOTRE IMPACT

Pourquoi faisons-nous  une demande de financement participatif ?

Nous voulons que l'Oasis Ancut Garden soit un catalyseur du changement, pas seulement pour Bali, mais pour VOUS, les personnes qui partagent notre vision. Bien que nous soyons les premiers destinataires, tous ceux qui collaborent avec nous, sauront qu’ils font partie de la solution. Il ne s’agit pas seulement de nous, mais de nous TOUS.

L'Oasis Ancut Garden fournit un exemple de vie intégré avec une communauté, dans laquelle il n'y a pas de concurrence (gagner/perdre), mais uniquement une collaboration (gagnant/gagnant). Kadek est déjà considéré comme un “pionnier” local dans notre communauté grâce à d'autres méthodes de culture du riz et de régénération des sols. Nous vivons une période critique, collaborer avec notre projet plaide votre foi et votre conviction que le monde peut être meilleur.

9.RISQUES ET DEFIS

Depuis près de 3 ans, nous continuons à trouver des solutions innovantes aux problèmes auxquels nous avons été confrontés (l'un des principes de conception en permaculture de Bill Mollison est “le problème est la solution”).

Malgrès des ressources limitées,  la sécheresse, la crise de l’eau à Bali, la saison des pluies torrentielles et les barrières linguistiques, nous continuons à rester passionnés et motivés. Notre seul défi est de maintenir la continuité de ce que nous avons déjà appliqué., raison pour laquelle nous avons choisi le financement participatif pour continuer de faire avancer notre projet. Nous ne pouvons  qu'aller de l'avant !

---------------VERSION EN ESPAÑOL-----------------

 

1. NUESTROS OBJETIVOS

Nuestro primer objetivo es crear un dormitorio común para los voluntarios locales, las visitas internacionales y para quienes participen de nuestros talleres. Además, el dormitorio en particular y nuestro sitio en general pueden ser utilizados como punto de evacuación, y / o zona segura en caso de desastres naturales (desde septiembre del año pasado, Emas Hitam ha estado colaborando con Agung Siaga en sus esfuerzos por asistir a las victimas de las erupciones de Volcan Agung, y los terremotos en Lombok brindando nuestro tiempo con apoyo logístico).

Lo que tu donación hará posible

El primer paso:

• $ 5000: Alojamiento en dormitorio (cimientos, estructura, literas, accesorios interiores, techos y balcón)

Los pasos siguientes:

• + $ 1000: cocina compartida (cimientos, estructura, cocina tradicional balinesa, horno natural, cocina de cohetes, sistema de aguas grises, filtro de agua, plomería, fregadero, utensilios de cocina)

• + $ 500: sistema de almacenamiento de agua de lluvia (plataforma, tanque de agua de lluvia, carcasa de bambú, tuberías, grifos, filtro de malla)

• +1000: baño compartido (cimientos, techos, estructura, baños secos de compost, duchas solares, sistema de aguas grises)

• + $ 2500: bungalow familiar con baño separado (cimientos, estructura, camas, accesorios interiores, techo, balcón, inodoro seco de composta, área de ducha)

Si logramos más de $10,000, decidiremos cómo utilizar el dinero en consenso con nuestra comunidad de donantes. Algunas ideas son construir un espacio compartido o adquirir un medio de transporte para recoger los desechos de la aldea.

2. NUESTRO ‘POR QUE’

¿Por que no?

Porque podemos, porque tenemos que hacerlo, porque queremos! Entendemos que el viejo sistema está muriendo, así como la vieja manera de hacer las cosas. Sabemos cómo encontrar soluciones regenerativas, basadas en la colaboración y de acuerdo con la ética y los principios de la permacultura. Queremos diseñar Ancut Garden Oasis como un sistema vivo donde cada elemento y cada ser humano pueda manifestarse ampliamente, creando una vida comunitaria que pueda ser un ejemplo para los demás.

3.    QUIENES SOMOS

Somos un grupo de amigos con una visión similar respecto de cómo queremos vivir nuestras vidas, a pesar de haber nacido en diferentes culturas. Todos hemos tenido vidas en general exitosas, sin embargo, cada uno de nosotros en algun momento sintió la falta de un significado trascendental. Lo encontramos cuando conectamos con la tierra. Trabajando juntos nos dimos cuenta del impacto que podemos tener compartiendo las herramientas necesarias para que todos puedan cultivar su propia comida y regenerar su tierra. Así fue como, junto con la comunidad local, creamos Ancut Garden Oasis. Creemos que podemos tener un impacto positivo en el mundo, cuidando de las personas, de nuestro planeta y repartiendo nuestro excedente de maera sabia y justa. Queremos ser parte de algo más grande que nosotros mismos, y sabemos que no podemos hacerlo solos.

 

4. NUESTRA HISTORIA

Tras finalizar sus estudios en Navdanya, la Universidad fundada por Vandana Shiv, en 2015, Kadek, junto con Feny y un grupo de jovenes de Indonesia, co-fundaron Emas Hitam Indonesia (EHI). Desde entonces, esta NGO local ha contribuído activamente con proyectos que abogan por la soberanía alimentaria y la sustentabilidad en Bali y en toda Indonesia.

Nuestros programas de entrenamiento incluyen:

• Sekaroh, East Lombok (junio-julio de 2016): EHI capacitó a un grupo de 32 agricultores en crisis, incapaces de cultivar su propia tierra, enseñándoles a regenerar su suelo aplicando los principios de diseño de la permacultura.

• Karangasem, Bali (noviembre de 2017): El equipo de EHI realizó un taller personalizado para 3 aldeas enseñándoles como acumular nitrógeno en el suelo utilizando Sesbania Grandiflora, cómo usar vetiver para prevenir la erosión y cómo crear un negocio sostenible produciendo Moringa Oleífera.

• Malaka, Io Kufeu, Timor Occidental (agosto de 2017): la capacitación de EHI introdujo el concepto de agricultura regenerativa en 3 comunidades agobiadas por el efecto de prácticas agrícolas insostenibles.

En noviembre de 2017, co-creamos el Festival JAGA Indonesia: Celebrando la Agroecología y la soberania alimenticia. Fue un evento gratuito al que asistieron más de 250 agricultores, estudiantes, representantes gubernamentales y activistas de Indonesia. Los profesores de Kadek aterrizaron en Bali con el fin de difundir los conceptos de agroecología, soberanía alimentaria, compost líquido y banco de semillas.

Además, hemos participado en capacitaciones, consultorías y conferencias varias como en el Ubud Food Festival, eventos con Slow Food Bali, Cursos de Introducción a la Permacultura con IDEP y el taller de estudiantes del Día de la Tierra con Udayana University.

5. NUESTRO PROYECTO

Desde diciembre de 2017, hemos estado desarrollando Ancut Garden, nuestro nuevo sitio en Petulu, que es 100% libre de pesticidas, libre de fertilizantes químicos y de cultivos transgénico. En balinés, 'Ancut' significa 'borde': el lugar donde se encuentran dos realidades: ¡la vida tal como la conocemos y la vida que queremos vivir!

Hasta el momento, hemos construido:

• Nuestra AGO Eco-casa de 2 plantas con baño de compostaje seco.

• Vivero y espacio de vermicultura

• Área de compostaje caliente (4x compartimentos de compost, horno de biochar, trituradora y cortadora de hojas)

• Jardín (3x arrozales, huertos, camas mandala elevadas, 3 círculos de banana, 2x estanques, 10x biopori)

• Bosque comestible (Moringa, bananas, taro, batata, mandioca, durián, rambután, snakefruit, mango, papaya, caña de azúcar, coco, vainilla, pimienta y muchos más!)

• Sistema de gestión de residuos

• Acceso y estacionamiento

• En construccion: aula comunitaria, segundo baño de compostaje, despensa, casa AGO Bamboo.

6. NUESTRO TRABAJO CON LA COMUNIDAD

• Compost the World: con la ayuda de AVI (Austalian Volunteers International) y Planet Wheeler Foundation a traves de su Community Grants Scheme creamos una instalación de reciclaje y procesamiento de materiales orgánicos que recupera los residuos agrícolas de nuestro jardín y de la comunidad, y los procesa convirtiéndolos en productos como compost, biochar, cocopeat, mantillo y utilizando dichos productos par generar otros proyectos como vermicultura. Junto con la comunidad agrícola local de Banjar Petulu Desa, la idea es generar una transicion hacia la produccion de arroz de manera organica, utilizando nuestras instalaciones de compost para regenerar su suelo.

• 'Little Seeds': programa de talleres para niños de la aldea Petulu y para jardines de infantes alrededor de Bali.

• Petulu & Tabanan Subak Site Tour: Talleres para grupos de turistas internacionales sobre el sistema Subak (sistema milenario de irrigacion reconocido por la UNESCO como Patrimonio de la Humanidad), permacultura, gestión de residuos, construcción de bambú y plantación sostenible de arroz.

• $ 100: WELCOME TO THE JUNGLE: Mural + participación en el sortero semanal + 1 noche de estadia en nuestro sitio cuando vengas a Bali + Taller de idiomas: Bahasa Bali [3er premio en el sorteo semanal]

• $ 200: LIVIN 'ON THE EDGE: Mural + participación en el sortero semanal + 1 noche de estadia en el dormitorio +  Introducción al Taller de Permacultura [2do Premio en el sorteo semanal]

• $ 350: TOMORROW COMES TODAY: Mural + participación en el sortero semanal + 2 noches de estadía en el dormitorio + Introducción al Taller de Permacultura + Taller de idiomas: Bahasa Bali [1er Premio en el sorteo semanal]

• $ 500: BEAUTIFUL FUTURE: Mural + 2 noches de estadía en nuestra AGO Bamboo House (2 personas) + clase de cocina Slow Food

• $ 750: RAY OF LIGHT: Mural + participación en el sortero semanal + 3 noches de estadia en nuestra AGO Eco-house (4x personas) + Introducción al Diseño de Permacultura

• $ 1000: HEAL THE WORLD: Mural + participación en el sortero semanal + estadia de 1semana en AGO Eco-house (4 pax) o Bamboo House (2 pax) + Subak Site Tour

Aclaración: Podés utilizar tu estadía en cualquier momento a partir de 2019. Si te resulta imposible utilizarla, podés regalársela a un amigo o donarla a un voluntario local. Si no vivís en Bali, podés cursar el taller que hayas ganado participando via Skype. Las recompensas son nuestra forma de decir un gran "gracias" por apoyar nuestro proyecto, no son representativas de los costos reales del artículo.

8. TU IMPACTO

¿Por qué crowdfunding?

Queremos que Ancut Garden Oasis sea un catalizador del cambio, no solo para Bali, sino también para VOS que compartís nuestra visión. Aunque seremos los primeros beneficiarios, todos los que hayan colaborado con nosotros son parte de la solución; se trata de TODOS nosotros. AGO intenta convertirse en un ejemplo de una vida comunitaria en la que no haya competencia (ganar/perder), solo colaboración (ganar-ganar). Kadek ya es considerado por la aldea como un 'pionero' por la maneras alternativas que viene utilizando en la tierra desde 2004 para el cultivo de arroz y la regeneración del suelo. Vivimos un momento crítico. Apoyando nuestro proyecto local es una manifestacion de fe en que el mundo puede ser un lugar mejor.

9. RIESGOS Y DESAFIOS

Desde hace tres años, venimos encontrando soluciones innovadoras a los problemas con los que nos hemos enfrentado - uno de los principios de diseño de permacultura de Bill Mollison es "el problema es la solución". A pesar de las barreras del idioma, la sequía, la crisis del agua en Bali, las temporadas de lluvias torrenciales y el jam karet (tiempo elastico), seguimos motivados. Nuestro desafío es continuar lo que hemos comenzado y es por eso que elegimos crowdfunding para poder seguir desarrollando nuestro sueño.

Estamos en el fondo del pozo. Para nosotros, todo solo puede mejorar. GRACIAS!

-----------VERSI BAHASA INDONESIA-------------

 

1. TUJUAN KAMI

Tujuan pertama kami adalah menciptakan ruang asrama tempat relawan lokal, tamu internasional, dan peserta lokakarya dapat tinggal dan belajar permaculture bersama kami. Asrama dan tempat kami juga akan siap digunakan sebagai titik evakuasi, dapur umum dan / atau zona aman untuk bencana alam di masa depan (sejak September tahun lalu, Emas Hitam telah terlibat dalam upaya bantuan Agung Agung untuk letusan Gunung Agung, dan baru-baru ini gempa bumi di Lombok melalui sukarelawan, penyortiran sumbangan dan dukungan logistik).

Berikut ini adalah tonggak pendanaan kami:

• $ 5000: Asrama Akomodasi (pondasi, struktur, tempat tidur susun, perlengkapan interior, atap, dan balkon)

• + $ 1000: Dapur bersama (pondasi, struktur, dapur tradisional Bali, oven alami, kompor roket, sistem greywater, filter air, pipa ledeng, wastafel, persediaan memasak)

• + $ 500: Sistem penyimpanan air hujan (platform, tangki air hujan, casing bambu, pipa, keran, filter mesh)

• +1000: Kamar mandi bersama (pondasi, atap, struktur, toilet kompos kering, pancuran matahari, sistem greywater)

• + $ 2500: Bungalow keluarga dengan kamar mandi terpisah (pondasi, struktur, tempat tidur, perlengkapan interior, atap, balkon, toilet kompos kering, area shower)

Jika kami mencapai lebih dari $ 10.000, kami akan mengusulkan fasilitas lain - dipilih oleh komunitas donor kami, seperti ruang hidup bersama atau transportasi untuk mengumpulkan limbah desa!

2. KAMI ‘MENGAPA’

Kenapa tidak?

Karena kita bisa, karena kita harus, karena kita mau! Kami memahami bahwa sistem lama sedang sekarat, serta cara lama dalam melakukan sesuatu. Kami tahu bagaimana menemukan solusi regeneratif berdasarkan kolaborasi yang terikat oleh etika dan prinsip permakultur. Kami ingin merancang Ancut Garden Oasis (AGO) sebagai sistem keseluruhan, di mana setiap elemen dan manusia dapat mencapai tujuan tertinggi mereka - saling mempercayai satu sama lain, dan menciptakan kehidupan komunitas yang dapat menjadi contoh bagi orang lain.

3. SIAPA KAMI

Kami adalah sekelompok teman yang berbagi visi yang sama tentang bagaimana kami ingin menjalani hidup kami. Kami semua berasal dari latar belakang yang berbeda dan telah memiliki kehidupan yang sukses sejauh ini, namun masing-masing merasa bahwa ada sesuatu yang hilang. Kami menemukannya ketika kami terhubung dengan tanah. Bekerja bersama, kami menyadari dampak yang dapat kami miliki dengan mengajari orang cara menanam makanan mereka sendiri dan meregenerasi tanah mereka. Bersama dengan komunitas lokal, kami menciptakan Ancut Garden Oasis. Kami percaya kami dapat memiliki dampak positif di dunia kita, dengan merawat orang, Planet kita dan dengan redistribusi yang adil dari surplus kita. Kami ingin menjadi bagian dari sesuatu yang lebih besar dari diri kami sendiri, dan kami tahu bahwa kami tidak dapat melakukannya sendirian.

4. CERITA KAMI

Setelah Kadek lulus dari Universitas Navdanya Vandana Shiva pada tahun 2015, Kadek dan Feny terinspirasi untuk ikut mendirikan Emas Hitam Indonesia (EHI) dengan dukungan pemuda Indonesia lainnya pada bulan Desember 2015.

Sejak saat ini, tim telah secara aktif berkontribusi terhadap kedaulatan pangan dan gerakan keberlanjutan di Bali dan di seluruh Indonesia. Pelatihan kami meliputi:

• Sekaroh, Lombok Timur (Juni-Juli 2016): EHI melatih sekelompok petani 32 orang ,mereka berjuang untuk menumbuhkan satu tanaman jagung hybrida setiap tahun, dengan  mengajarkan  mereka bagaimana meregenerasi tanah mereka menerapkan prinsip-prinsip desain permaculture. Sehingga mereka bisa menanam lebih banyak berbagai jenis tanaman yang mereka butuhkan.

• Karangasem, Bali Timur (Nov 2017): Tim EHI menyampaikan lokakarya yang disesuaikan untuk 3 desa tentang fiksasi nitrogen, penggunaan rumput vetiver sebagai pencegahan erosi, dan cara menciptakan bisnis berkelanjutan yang tumbuh dari moringa oleifera.

• Malaka, Io Kufeu, Timor Barat (Agustus 2017): Pelatihan EHI memperkenalkan konsep pertanian regeneratif ke 3 komunitas yang berhubungan dengan praktek pertanian yang tidak berkelanjutan.

Pada bulan November 2017, kami turut menciptakan Festival JAGA Indonesia: Merayakan Agroekologi dan Kemerdekaan Benih - acara gratis bagi lebih dari 250 petani Indonesia, pelajar, perwakilan pemerintah dan aktivis di Bali dan Jawa. Guru Navdanya University Kadek datang terutama dari India untuk berbagi lokakarya praktis mereka tentang agroekologi, kedaulatan pangan, kompos cair, dan penyimpanan benih.

Selain itu, kami telah terlibat dalam pelatihan, konsultasi dan keterlibatan berbicara termasuk Ubud Food Festival, acara Slow Food Bali, Pengenalan Kursus Permakultur IDEP, dan lokakarya mahasiswa Hari Bumi Universitas Udayana.

5. SITUS KAMI

Sejak Desember 2017, kami telah beroperasi di Ancut Garden, situs baru kami di Petulu, yang 100% bebas pestisida, bebas pupuk kimia dan non-GMO. Dalam bahasa Bali, ‘ancut’ (diucapkan ‘pinggir’), berarti ‘batas’ atau ‘sisi’. Ini adalah tempat di mana dua realitas bertemu-hidup seperti yang kita kenal dan kehidupan yang ingin kita jalani! Sejak pindah ke sini, kami telah membangun:

Gambar: Situs, sebelum-sesudah, lalu peta

• Rumah Kayu Kejutan 2 tingkat kami dengan toilet kompos kering

• Kebun bibit dan peternakan cacing

• Area kompos panas (4x kompos teluk, kiln biochar, mesin pemotong ranting dan pemotong daun)

• Desain taman (3x sawah, kebun dapur, tempat bedengan mandala yang ditinggikan, 3x lingkaran pisang, 2x kolam, 10x biopori)

• Hutan makanan (pohon buah-buahan dan tanaman umbi termasuk kelor, pisang, talas, ubi jalar, singkong, nangka, durian, rambutan, salak, mangga putih, pepaya, tebu, kelapa, vanila, merica dan banyak lagi!)

• Sistem pengelolaan limbah

• Akses dan parkir

• DALAM KEMAJUAN: ruang belajar komunitas, toilet kompos ke-2, rumah bambu AGO
story_txt:
1. OUR GOALSOur first goal is to create a dormitory space where local volunteers, international guests and workshop participants can stay and learn permaculture with us. Our dorm and site will also be ready to be used as an evacuation point, community kitchen and/or safe zone for any future natural disasters (since September last year, Emas Hitam has been involved in Agung Siaga’s relief efforts for Mt Agung’s eruptions, and recently the Lombok earthquakes through volunteering, donation sorting and logistics support).The following are our funding milestones: 

$5000: Dormitory Accommodation (foundation, structure, bunk beds, interior fittings, roofing, and balcony)

+$1000: Shared kitchen (foundation, structure, traditional Balinese kitchen, natural oven, rocket stove, greywater system, water filter, plumbing, sink, cooking supplies)

+$500: Rainwater storage system (platform, rainwater tank, bamboo casing, piping, taps, mesh filter)

+1000: Shared bathroom (foundation, roofing, structure, dry compost toilets, solar showers, greywater system)

+$2500: Family bungalow with separate bathroom (foundation, structure, beds, interior fittings, roofing, balcony, dry compost toilet, shower area)
If we achieve over $10,000, we will propose other facilities- voted on by our donor community, such as a shared living space or transportation to collect village waste! Image: Dorm design
2.            OUR ‘WHY’Why not? Because we can, because we have to, because we want to! We understand that the old system is dying, as well as the old way of doing things. We know how to find regenerative solutions based on collaboration that are bound by the ethics and principles of permaculture. We want to design Ancut Garden Oasis (AGO) as a whole system, where each element and human being can achieve their highest purpose- trusting each other, and creating a community life that can be an example for others.3. WHO WE ARE  We are a group of friends who share a similar vision of how we want to live our lives. We all come from different backgrounds and have had successful lives so far, however each one of felt that there was something missing. We found it when we connected with the land. Working together, we realised the impact that we can have by teaching people how to grow their own food and regenerate their land. So together with the local community, we created Ancut Garden Oasis. We believe we can have a positive impact in our world, by caring for people, our Planet and with the fair redistribution of our surplus. We want to be a part of something bigger than ourselves, and we know that we cannot do it alone.4.   OUR STORYAfter Kadek graduated from Vandana Shiva’s Navdanya University in 2015, Kadek and Feny were inspired to co-found Emas Hitam Indonesia (EHI) with the support of other young Indonesians in December 2015.Since this time, the team have been actively contributing to food sovereignty and sustainability movements in Bali and across Indonesia. Our trainings include:

Sekaroh, East Lombok (June-July 2016): EHI trained a group of 32 farmers struggling to grow a single crop of corn each year, teaching them how to regenerate their soil applying permaculture design principles.

Karangasem, East Bali (Nov 2017): The EHI team delivered a customized workshop for 3 villages on nitrogen-fixation, the use of vetiver grass as erosion prevention, and how to create a sustainable business growing moringa oleifera.

Malaka, Io Kufeu, West Timor (Aug 2017): EHI’s training introduced the concept of regenerative agriculture to 3 communities dealing with unsustainable farming practises. 
In November 2017, we co-created the JAGA Indonesia Festival: Celebrating Agroecology and Seed Freedom- a free event for over 250 Indonesian farmers, students, government representatives and activists in Bali and Java. Kadek’s Navdanya University teachers came especially from India to share their practical workshops on agroecology, food sovereignty, liquid compost, and seed-saving.Additionally, we have been involved in training, consulting and speaking engagements including Ubud Food Festival, Slow Food Bali events, IDEP’s Introduction to Permaculture Course, and Udayana University’s Earth Day student workshop.
5.    OUR SITESince December 2017, we have been operating at Ancut Garden, our new site in Petulu, which is 100% pesticide free, chemical fertilizer-free and non-GMO. In Balinese, ‘ancut’ (pronounced ‘anchoot’), means the ‘border’ or ‘edge’. It is the place where two realities meet- life as we know it and the life that we want to live! Since moving here, we have built:

Our 2-storey timber AGO Eco-house with dry composting toilet (supported by Permafund Australia)

Seedling nursery and worm farm


Hot compost area (4x compost bays, biochar kiln, chipper and leaf cutter machines)

Garden design (3x ricefields, kitchen gardens, raised mandala beds, 3x banana circles, 2x ponds, 10x biopori)

Food forest (fruit trees and root crops including moringa, bananas, taro, sweet potato, cassava, jackfruit, durian, rambutan, snakefruit, white mango, papaya, sugarcane, coconuts, vanilla, pepper and many more!)
Waste management system
Access and parking

IN PROGRESS: community learning space, 2nd composting toilet, grocery space, AGO Bamboo house
Image: Before/After photos of 1) AGO Eco-house 2) Community Space 3) Compost Area
6.    OUR COMMUNITY PROJECTS
Compost the World: Supported by AVI and the Planet Wheeler Foundation’s Community Grants Scheme- we have created an on-site organic materials processing and recycling facility that recovers agricultural waste from our own garden and the community, and processes it into soil-building materials and compost products- including biochar, cocopeat, mulch, worm castings, worm tea, and hot compost! Together with the local farming community, we aim to transition Banjar Petulu Desa to organic rice production, using our compost facility to regenerate the soil.
Little Seeds Children’s Workshops: Education program for the local Petulu kindergarten and schools around Bali.
Petulu & Tabanan Subak Site Tour: Workshops for international tour groups about the Subak (UNESCO-listed Balinese rice irrigation system), permaculture, waste management, bamboo construction, and sustainable rice-planting in our own village and in Central-North Bali.
7.    YOUR REWARDSOur unique rewards are designed to say a big THANK YOU to you- for supporting our project!EVERY DONOR WILL RECEIVE:1) Your name on our educational plant mural in our community space in 2019! The mural will feature botanical illustrations and names of tropical and native Indonesian plants at our site.2) Free entry into a weekly raffle to WIN ACCOMMODATION at Ancut Garden Oasis from 2019. We want each person to have the opportunity to ‘win big’, no matter what they contribute to us! Raffle will be drawn LIVE on Saturday of each week, for the 5 weeks of the campaign.DONOR REWARDS: 

$5 - BE THE CHANGE: Name on our mural + raffle entry + Facebook thank you

$10 - SOW THE SEEDS: Mural + raffle entry + plant an edible flower seed in your name

$25 - HEALING HERBS: Mural + raffle entry + plant a local medicinal plant in your name

$50 - GROWING FORESTS: Mural + raffle entry + plant a fruit tree in your name

$75 - LITTLE GARDENERS: Mural + raffle entry + sponsor local children’s workshop and seedling for their home garden


$100 - WELCOME TO THE JUNGLE: Mural + raffle entry + 1 night dormitory stay at our site when you come to Bali + Balinese Language Workshop [3rd prize in the weekly raffle]


$200 - LIVIN’ ON THE EDGE: Mural + raffle entry + 1 night dormitory stay + Intro to Permaculture Workshop [2nd Prize in the weekly raffle]


$350 - TOMORROW COMES TODAY: Mural + raffle entry + 2 nights dormitory stay + Intro to Permaculture Workshop + Balinese Language Workshop [1st Prize in the weekly raffle]


$500 - BEAUTIFUL FUTURE: Mural + raffle entry + 2 nights in our beautiful AGO Bamboo House (2 pax) + Slow Food cooking class

$750 - RAY OF LIGHT: Mural + raffle entry + 3 night stay  in our timber AGO Eco-house (4 pax) + Intro to Permaculture Design Workshop

$1000 - HEAL THE WORLD: Mural + raffle entry + 1 week stay in AGO Eco-house (4 pax) or Bamboo House (2 pax) + Subak Site Tour

$2500 - WE CAN BE HEROES: Mural + raffle entry + 2 week stay in AGO Eco-house (4x pax) or Bamboo House (2 pax) + Customized Permaculture Experience (1-day Subak Site Tour, 1-day Permaculture Bali Tour, Slow Food cooking class, Balinese Language Worksop, etc…)
Please note: For the accommodation, you can come anytime in the future from 2019. If you cannot make it to our site, you may gift your stay to a friend, or to a local volunteer. If you live in a different part of the world- the workshop rewards can also be taken over Skype! The rewards above are our way of saying "thank you” for supporting our project, they are not representative of the actual item costs.
8.    YOUR IMPACTWhy do we do crowdfunding?We want Ancut Garden Oasis to be a catalyst for change, not just for Bali, but for YOU- the people who share our vision. Although we will be the first recipients, everyone collaborating with us will know that they are part of the solution- it’s not just about us, its about ALL of us. AGO provides an example of an integrated community life in which there is no competition (win/lose), only collaboration (win-win). Kadek is already being seen as a local ‘trailblazer’ in our community through alternative ways of rice farming and soil regeneration. We are living in a critical time- and supporting our locally-owned project is pledging your faith and belief that the world can be a better place.
9.    RISKS AND CHALLENGESFor almost 3 years, we have continued to find innovative solutions to the problems we have been faced with - one of Bill Mollison’s permaculture design principles is “the problem is the solution”.Through limited resources, drought, Bali’s current water crisis, torrential rainy seasons, and language barriers, we continue to stay passionate and motivated. Our only challenge is to maintain the continuity of what we have already applied, which is why we have chosen crowdfunding to move our project forward at this time. We have come too far not to keep going. We are at the grassroots- for us, the only way is up!
10.    WHAT OUR SUPPORTERS SAYSince 2016, we have been opening up our sites to the general public: here’s what they have said: 
"Happy Permaculture Day! I came to learn about agriculture, but what I got was an introduction to a new philosophy! It's truly inspiring that the principles and the practise of permaculture can be applied in all walks of life. I'm hoping to come back to learn more about the agriculture part of it, and hoping to apply the philosophy in my personal and professional life. Thank you for organizing this! I'm grateful to have met this foundation" – Septira (Jakarta, Java, Indonesia)

"So this is the first time I come to this foundation, actually I don't know what will I do here, But I think the people here are very kind, so friendly, Before I knew that this foundation has a good program that to help the people who get suffered because of Agung erupting. So because of I am Balinese, I am so happy to know about that. There are so many people from abroad that really care with us here in Bali. Thank you! So my new friend show me your good activity and I think I will love it. Thank you." – Ari (Plaga, Bali, Indonesia)

"Les agradezco mucho por lo compartido, la experienca y el intercambio. Gracias por sequir trabajando y colaborando a favor de le tierra. Salud y buena vida" – Melisa (Argentina)

“I am now very interested in permaculture after seeing all the amazing things Emas Hitam is doing. I hope Emas Hitam continues to go from strength to strength! Thank you for showing me the power of passionate people through this garden" – Mel (Australia)

 “Vous faites un travail fantastique ici !!! Congratulations pour tout ce que vous apportez à la Terre, notre belle planète que nous partageons tous. Continuez, n’abandonnez jamais, et sachez qu’il y a beaucoup de personnes travaillant avec vous à travers le monde !!! " – Thomas (France)

"Thanks for letting me into your beautiful project and people. It is very inspiring to find people fighting for similar goals far away from home and under different environments” – Daniel (Denmark)

"Om Swastiyastu. Terima kasih untuk pagi yang sangat luar biasa. Hari ini kami belajar banyak hal dan mengingat masa kecil kami melihat Kakek dan Nenek kami bertani. Bless of live for Balinese Farmer" – Surya (Ubud, Bali, Indonesia)

"Saya sangat menyukai kegiatan membudidayakan tanaman organic yg alami. Sehat dan bebas kimia. Sehingga dapat dikonsumsi dengan aman dan membuat tubuh kita terbebas dari sat yang dapat membuat masalah dalam tubuh kita. Hendaknya kita terus kembangkan aktivitas dan budaya konsumsi makanan sehat. Thanks" - Amin (Denpasar, Bali, Indonesia)


11.    ADDITIONAL WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

SHARE our campaign with your friends!

COME and visit our site if you are in Bali!

SUPPORT local produce, farmers, and transition movements in your own community!

READ some of our favourite literature (and suggest your own to us): Who Really Feeds the World? (Vandana Shiva), Drawdown (Paul Hawken), One Straw Revolution (Masanobu Fukouka), The Value of Nothing (Raj Patel), Permaculture: Principles and Pathways Beyond Sustainability (David Holmgren), This Changes Everything (Naomi Klein), Dark Emu (Bruce Pascoe), Sacred Economics (Charles Eisenstein), The Tao of Physics (Fritjof Capra), The Art of Simple Food (Alice Waters).
If you can donate- THANK YOU! Your help is a giant step for us. Every single gesture matters- it is the accumulation of small actions which are the basis for changing the world.THANKS FOR THE SUPPORT   ---------------VERSION FRANÇAISE------------------ 
1.   NOS OBJECTIFS
Notre premier objectif est d’obtenir les fonds suffisants pour acheter les matériaux de construction d’un dortoir pour que les volontaires (locaux ou internationaux) que nous souhaitons héberger puissent participer à nos ateliers de permaculture. Autre avantage : notre site sera prêt à servir de point d'évacuation, de cuisine communautaire et de zone de sécurité en cas de catastrophe naturelle (depuis septembre dernier, suite aux éruptions du Mont Agung et, plus récemment, aux tremblements de terre sur Lombok, le groupement Emas Hitam coopère avec l'association Agung Siaga en apportant bénévolement son soutien sur la logistique et le tri des donations).Voici les étapes de notre financement : 

$5000 : Dortoir (fondation, structure, lits superposés, aménagement intérieur, toiture, et balcon)

+$1000 : Cuisine commune (fondation, structure, cuisine traditionnelle Balinaise, four naturel, rocket stove, système de traitement des eaux grises, filtre à eau, plomberie, évier, matériels de cuisine)

+$500 : Système de stockage d'eau de pluie (plateforme, réservoir d'eau de pluie, enveloppe en bambou, tuyauterie, robinets, filtre en maille)

+1000 : Salle de bain commune (fondation, toiture, structure, toilettes sèches, douche solaire, système de traitement des eaux grises )

+$2500 : Bungalow familial avec salle de bain privée (fondation, structure, lits, aménagement intérieur, toiture, balcon, toilettes sèches, douche)
Si nous dépassons 10,000 $, nous proposerons d'autres installations votées par notre communauté de donateurs, tels qu'un espace de vie partagé, un véhicule pour la collecte des déchets du villages, etc...Image: Dormitory plans (10x10m octagonal design, pitched roof and balcony on terrace)2. NOTRE “POURQUOI”Pourquoi pas ? Parce que nous pouvons, parce que nous devons, parce que nous voulons! Nous comprenons que l'ancien système est en train de mourir, tout comme l'ancienne façon de faire les choses. Nous savons comment trouver des solutions régénératrices basées sur la collaboration, et liées à l'éthique et aux principes de la permaculture. Nous voulons concevoir l'Oasis Ancut Garden comme un système complet, où chaque élément et chaque être humain peuvent atteindre leur objectif le plus élevé: se faire confiance et créer un lieu departage qui peut être un exemple pour les autres.3. QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?Nous sommes un groupe d'amis qui partagent les mêmes choix de vie. Nous provenons tous d'horizons différents et bien que nos parcours furent riches en expériences, chacun de nous avait l’intime conviction qu'il lui manquait quelque chose pour pleinement s’accomplir. Nous avons trouvé la solution lorsque nous nous sommes reconnectés avec la nature. En travaillant ensemble, nous avons réalisé l'impact que nous pouvions avoir en enseignant aux gens comment cultiver leur propre nourriture et régénérer leurs terres, en parfaite autonomie. C’est ainsi qu’avec la communauté locale, nous avons créé l'Oasis Ancut Garden. Nous sommes convaincus de l’influence positive de ce projet sur notre monde, en prenant soin de nous, de notre planète et de la redistribution équitable de nos excédents. Grâce à votre accompagnement, nous pourrons démontrer de façon factuelle qu’il est possible de faire partie de quelque chose de plus grand que nous, de proposer de nouvelles perspectives pour une vie plus saine et harmonieuse avec l'environnement.4. NOTRE HISTOIREAprès avoir obtenu son diplôme  à l’Université Navdanya de Vandana Shiva en 2015, Kadek et Feny ont été inspirés par la co-création d’Emas Hitam Indonesia (EHI) avec le soutien d’autres jeunes Indonésiens en décembre 2015.Depuis ce temps, l’équipe a activement contribué aux mouvements de souveraineté alimentaire et de développement durable à Bali et en Indonésie. Nos formations comprennentnotamment :

Sekaroh, Est de Lombok (Juin-Juillet 2016) : EHI a formé un groupe de 32 agriculteurs qui luttaient chaque année pour cultiver une monoculture de maïs, en leur enseignant comment régénérer leur sol, en appliquant les principes de la conception en permaculture.

Karangasem, Est de Bali (Nov. 2017) : L'équipe EHI a organisé un atelier personnalisé pour 3 villages sur la fixation de l'azote, l'utilisation du vétiver comme moyen de prévention de l'érosion et la création d'une entreprise durable pour le moringa oleifera.

Malaka, Io Kufeu, Timor Occidental (Août 2017) : la formation EHI a introduit le concept d’agriculture régénérative dans 3 communautés qui s’occupent de pratiques agricoles non durables.
En Novembre 2017, nous avons co-créé le festival ”JAGA Indonesia: Celebrating Agroecology and Seed Freedom”, un événement gratuit pour plus de 250 agriculteurs, étudiants, représentants gouvernementaux et activistes indonésiens de Bali et Java. Les professeurs de l’Université Navdanya de Kadek sont venus spécialement d’Inde, pour partager leurs ateliers pratiques sur l’agroécologie, la souveraineté alimentaire, le compost liquide et la conservation des semences.En outre, nous avons participé à des formations, consultations et conférences, notamment au ”Ubud Food Festival”, aux événements ”Slow Food Bali”, au cours ”Introduction à la permaculture” de l’organisation IDEP et à l’atelier des étudiants de l’Université Udayana ”Earth Day”.5. NOTRE SITEDepuis Décembre 2017, nous opérons à Ancut Garden, notre nouveau site à Petulu, 100% sans pesticides, sans engrais chimiques et sans OGM. En balinais, ”ancut” (prononcé anchout) signifie la ”frontière” ou ”bordure”. C'est le lieu où deux réalités se rencontrent, la vie que nous connaissons et la vie que nous voulons vivre! Depuis notre déménagement, nous avons construit :

Notre Eco-maison de deux étages avec toilettes sèches 


Pépinière et ferme de vers de terre


Zone de compostage à chaud (4x bacs  pour collecter les matériaux compostables, four à biocharbon, broyeur et machines à découper les feuilles)

Design du jardin (3 x rizières, jardins potagers, jardin en mandala , 3 ”banana circles”, 2 étangs, 10 ”biopori”)

Forêt vivrière (arbres fruitiers et racines: moringas, bananes, taros, patates douces, maniocs, jacquiers, durians, ramboutans, fruits du serpent, mangues blanches, papayes, cannes à sucre, noix de coco, vanille, poivre et bien d'autres !)
Système de management des déchets 
Accès et stationnement

EN COURS : espace d'apprentissage , 2ème toilettes sèches , épicerie, AGO Bamboo house, structures à compost
Image: Avant/Après photos de 1) AGO Eco-house 2) Espace d'apprentissage 3) Compost Area
6.    NOS PROJETS AVEC LA COMMUNAUTE

“Compost the World” : Soutenu par le Community Grants Scheme de la fondation Planet Wheeler et AVI- Nous avons une installation de traitement et de recyclage des matières organiques sur site qui récupère les déchets agricoles de notre jardin et de la communauté et les transforme en matériaux de construction et en produits de compost (biocharbons, fibres de coco, paillis, excrétions solides et liquides de verres de terre, et compost chaud)! En collaboration avec la communauté agricole locale, nous visons la transition du quartier ”Petulu Desa”, afin de convertir les rizières en biologique, et en utilisant notre installation de compost, afin de régénérer les sols.
“Little Seeds” ateliers pour enfants : Programme d’ateliers  pour enfants ,  auprès des écoles  de Petulu  et à travers Bali.
“Petulu & Tabanan Subak Site Tour” : Ateliers pour groupes de touristes internationaux à propos des Subak (système Balinais  concernant l'irrigation des rizières  et classé à l'UNESCO), la permaculture, la gestion des déchets, la construction en bambou et la riziculture durable dans notre village et dans le centre-nord de Bali.
7.    VOS RECOMPENSES

La peinture murale comprendra les illustrations botaniques et noms des plantes tropicales et indonésiennes de notre site .2) Entrée gratuite dans un tirage au sort hebdomadaire pour GAGNER UN SEJOUR à l'Oasis  Ancut Garden à partir de 2019. Nous voulons que chaque personne ait la possibilité de “gagner gros”, quelque soit sa contribution ! La tirage au sort aura lieu en direct le samedi de chaque semaine, pendant les 5 semaines de la campagne.RECOMPENSES DES DONATEURS :

Veuillez noter : Pour les hébergements, vous pouvez venir à tout moment à partir de 2019. Si vous ne pouvez pas vous rendre sur notre site, vous pouvez offrir votre séjour à un ami ou à un volontaire local. Si vous vivez dans une autre partie du monde, les récompenses sous formes d'ateliers pourront également être effectuées par Skype ! Les récompenses ci-dessus sont notre façon de vous remercier pour avoir soutenu notre projet, elles ne sont pas représentatives de leurs coûts réels.8. VOTRE IMPACTPourquoi faisons-nous  une demande de financement participatif ?Nous voulons que l'Oasis Ancut Garden soit un catalyseur du changement, pas seulement pour Bali, mais pour VOUS, les personnes qui partagent notre vision. Bien que nous soyons les premiers destinataires, tous ceux qui collaborent avec nous, sauront qu’ils font partie de la solution. Il ne s’agit pas seulement de nous, mais de nous TOUS.L'Oasis Ancut Garden fournit un exemple de vie intégré avec une communauté, dans laquelle il n'y a pas de concurrence (gagner/perdre), mais uniquement une collaboration (gagnant/gagnant). Kadek est déjà considéré comme un “pionnier” local dans notre communauté grâce à d'autres méthodes de culture du riz et de régénération des sols. Nous vivons une période critique, collaborer avec notre projet plaide votre foi et votre conviction que le monde peut être meilleur.9.RISQUES ET DEFISDepuis près de 3 ans, nous continuons à trouver des solutions innovantes aux problèmes auxquels nous avons été confrontés (l'un des principes de conception en permaculture de Bill Mollison est “le problème est la solution”).Malgrès des ressources limitées,  la sécheresse, la crise de l’eau à Bali, la saison des pluies torrentielles et les barrières linguistiques, nous continuons à rester passionnés et motivés. Notre seul défi est de maintenir la continuité de ce que nous avons déjà appliqué., raison pour laquelle nous avons choisi le financement participatif pour continuer de faire avancer notre projet. Nous ne pouvons  qu'aller de l'avant !
