MERCI POUR LE SOUTIEN !!!  ---------------VERSION EN ESPAÑOL----------------- 1. NUESTROS OBJETIVOSNuestro primer objetivo es crear un dormitorio común para los voluntarios locales, las visitas internacionales y para quienes participen de nuestros talleres. Además, el dormitorio en particular y nuestro sitio en general pueden ser utilizados como punto de evacuación, y / o zona segura en caso de desastres naturales (desde septiembre del año pasado, Emas Hitam ha estado colaborando con Agung Siaga en sus esfuerzos por asistir a las victimas de las erupciones de Volcan Agung, y los terremotos en Lombok brindando nuestro tiempo con apoyo logístico).Lo que tu donación hará posibleEl primer paso:• $ 5000: Alojamiento en dormitorio (cimientos, estructura, literas, accesorios interiores, techos y balcón)Los pasos siguientes:• + $ 1000: cocina compartida (cimientos, estructura, cocina tradicional balinesa, horno natural, cocina de cohetes, sistema de aguas grises, filtro de agua, plomería, fregadero, utensilios de cocina)• + $ 500: sistema de almacenamiento de agua de lluvia (plataforma, tanque de agua de lluvia, carcasa de bambú, tuberías, grifos, filtro de malla)• +1000: baño compartido (cimientos, techos, estructura, baños secos de compost, duchas solares, sistema de aguas grises)• + $ 2500: bungalow familiar con baño separado (cimientos, estructura, camas, accesorios interiores, techo, balcón, inodoro seco de composta, área de ducha)Si logramos más de $10,000, decidiremos cómo utilizar el dinero en consenso con nuestra comunidad de donantes. Algunas ideas son construir un espacio compartido o adquirir un medio de transporte para recoger los desechos de la aldea.2. NUESTRO ‘POR QUE’¿Por que no? Porque podemos, porque tenemos que hacerlo, porque queremos! Entendemos que el viejo sistema está muriendo, así como la vieja manera de hacer las cosas. Sabemos cómo encontrar soluciones regenerativas, basadas en la colaboración y de acuerdo con la ética y los principios de la permacultura. Queremos diseñar Ancut Garden Oasis como un sistema vivo donde cada elemento y cada ser humano pueda manifestarse ampliamente, creando una vida comunitaria que pueda ser un ejemplo para los demás.
3.    QUIENES SOMOSSomos un grupo de amigos con una visión similar respecto de cómo queremos vivir nuestras vidas, a pesar de haber nacido en diferentes culturas. Todos hemos tenido vidas en general exitosas, sin embargo, cada uno de nosotros en algun momento sintió la falta de un significado trascendental. Lo encontramos cuando conectamos con la tierra. Trabajando juntos nos dimos cuenta del impacto que podemos tener compartiendo las herramientas necesarias para que todos puedan cultivar su propia comida y regenerar su tierra. Así fue como, junto con la comunidad local, creamos Ancut Garden Oasis. Creemos que podemos tener un impacto positivo en el mundo, cuidando de las personas, de nuestro planeta y repartiendo nuestro excedente de maera sabia y justa. Queremos ser parte de algo más grande que nosotros mismos, y sabemos que no podemos hacerlo solos. 4. NUESTRA HISTORIATras finalizar sus estudios en Navdanya, la Universidad fundada por Vandana Shiv, en 2015, Kadek, junto con Feny y un grupo de jovenes de Indonesia, co-fundaron Emas Hitam Indonesia (EHI). Desde entonces, esta NGO local ha contribuído activamente con proyectos que abogan por la soberanía alimentaria y la sustentabilidad en Bali y en toda Indonesia.Nuestros programas de entrenamiento incluyen:• Sekaroh, East Lombok (junio-julio de 2016): EHI capacitó a un grupo de 32 agricultores en crisis, incapaces de cultivar su propia tierra, enseñándoles a regenerar su suelo aplicando los principios de diseño de la permacultura.• Karangasem, Bali (noviembre de 2017): El equipo de EHI realizó un taller personalizado para 3 aldeas enseñándoles como acumular nitrógeno en el suelo utilizando Sesbania Grandiflora, cómo usar vetiver para prevenir la erosión y cómo crear un negocio sostenible produciendo Moringa Oleífera.• Malaka, Io Kufeu, Timor Occidental (agosto de 2017): la capacitación de EHI introdujo el concepto de agricultura regenerativa en 3 comunidades agobiadas por el efecto de prácticas agrícolas insostenibles.En noviembre de 2017, co-creamos el Festival JAGA Indonesia: Celebrando la Agroecología y la soberania alimenticia. Fue un evento gratuito al que asistieron más de 250 agricultores, estudiantes, representantes gubernamentales y activistas de Indonesia. Los profesores de Kadek aterrizaron en Bali con el fin de difundir los conceptos de agroecología, soberanía alimentaria, compost líquido y banco de semillas.Además, hemos participado en capacitaciones, consultorías y conferencias varias como en el Ubud Food Festival, eventos con Slow Food Bali, Cursos de Introducción a la Permacultura con IDEP y el taller de estudiantes del Día de la Tierra con Udayana University.5. NUESTRO PROYECTODesde diciembre de 2017, hemos estado desarrollando Ancut Garden, nuestro nuevo sitio en Petulu, que es 100% libre de pesticidas, libre de fertilizantes químicos y de cultivos transgénico. En balinés, 'Ancut' significa 'borde': el lugar donde se encuentran dos realidades: ¡la vida tal como la conocemos y la vida que queremos vivir!Hasta el momento, hemos construido:• Nuestra AGO Eco-casa de 2 plantas con baño de compostaje seco.• Vivero y espacio de vermicultura• Área de compostaje caliente (4x compartimentos de compost, horno de biochar, trituradora y cortadora de hojas)• Jardín (3x arrozales, huertos, camas mandala elevadas, 3 círculos de banana, 2x estanques, 10x biopori)• Bosque comestible (Moringa, bananas, taro, batata, mandioca, durián, rambután, snakefruit, mango, papaya, caña de azúcar, coco, vainilla, pimienta y muchos más!)• Sistema de gestión de residuos• Acceso y estacionamiento• En construccion: aula comunitaria, segundo baño de compostaje, despensa, casa AGO Bamboo.6. NUESTRO TRABAJO CON LA COMUNIDAD• Compost the World: con la ayuda de AVI (Austalian Volunteers International) y Planet Wheeler Foundation a traves de su Community Grants Scheme creamos una instalación de reciclaje y procesamiento de materiales orgánicos que recupera los residuos agrícolas de nuestro jardín y de la comunidad, y los procesa convirtiéndolos en productos como compost, biochar, cocopeat, mantillo y utilizando dichos productos par generar otros proyectos como vermicultura. Junto con la comunidad agrícola local de Banjar Petulu Desa, la idea es generar una transicion hacia la produccion de arroz de manera organica, utilizando nuestras instalaciones de compost para regenerar su suelo.• 'Little Seeds': programa de talleres para niños de la aldea Petulu y para jardines de infantes alrededor de Bali.• Petulu & Tabanan Subak Site Tour: Talleres para grupos de turistas internacionales sobre el sistema Subak (sistema milenario de irrigacion reconocido por la UNESCO como Patrimonio de la Humanidad), permacultura, gestión de residuos, construcción de bambú y plantación sostenible de arroz.7. TU RECOMPENSANuestras recompensas únicas están diseñadas para darte las GRACIAS por apoyar nuestro proyecto.TODA PERSONA QUE NOS AYUDE A ALCANZAR NUESTROS OBJETIVO RECIBIRÁ:1) Tu nombre en el mural de nuestro espacio comunitario. Permaculture Bali Tour, acceso diario a las: "Subak Sessions" de 2 horas discutiendo sobre Permacultura!)Aclaración: Podés utilizar tu estadía en cualquier momento a partir de 2019. Las recompensas son nuestra forma de decir un gran "gracias" por apoyar nuestro proyecto, no son representativas de los costos reales del artículo.8. TU IMPACTO¿Por qué crowdfunding?Queremos que Ancut Garden Oasis sea un catalizador del cambio, no solo para Bali, sino también para VOS que compartís nuestra visión. Aunque seremos los primeros beneficiarios, todos los que hayan colaborado con nosotros son parte de la solución; se trata de TODOS nosotros. AGO intenta convertirse en un ejemplo de una vida comunitaria en la que no haya competencia (ganar/perder), solo colaboración (ganar-ganar). Kadek ya es considerado por la aldea como un 'pionero' por la maneras alternativas que viene utilizando en la tierra desde 2004 para el cultivo de arroz y la regeneración del suelo. Vivimos un momento crítico. Apoyando nuestro proyecto local es una manifestacion de fe en que el mundo puede ser un lugar mejor.9. RIESGOS Y DESAFIOSDesde hace tres años, venimos encontrando soluciones innovadoras a los problemas con los que nos hemos enfrentado - uno de los principios de diseño de permacultura de Bill Mollison es "el problema es la solución". A pesar de las barreras del idioma, la sequía, la crisis del agua en Bali, las temporadas de lluvias torrenciales y el jam karet (tiempo elastico), seguimos motivados. Nuestro desafío es continuar lo que hemos comenzado y es por eso que elegimos crowdfunding para poder seguir desarrollando nuestro sueño.Estamos en el fondo del pozo. Para nosotros, todo solo puede mejorar. GRACIAS!10. OTRAS MANERAS DE COLABORAR- COMPARTI nuestra campaña con tus amigos!- VENI a visitar nuestro proyecto. - APOYA a los agricultores locales y los movimientos de transición en tu propia comunidad.- LEE algunos de nuestros libros favoritos (y sugerinos los tuyos):¿Quién realmente alimenta el mundo? (Vandana Shiva), Drawdown (Paul Hawken), One Straw Revolution (Masanobu Fukouka), El valor de la nada (Raj Patel), Permacultura: Principios y caminos más allá de la sostenibilidad (David Holmgren), Esto lo cambia todo (Naomi Klein), Dark Emu (Bruce Pascoe), Economía Sagrada (Charles Eisenstein), El Tao de la Física (Fritjof Capra), El Arte de la Comida Simple (Alice Waters).Si podés donar, ¡GRACIAS! Tu ayuda es un paso gigante para nosotros. Cada gesto individual importa: es la acumulación de pequeñas acciones las que son la base para cambiar el mundo.GRACIAS POR EL APOYO  -----------VERSI BAHASA INDONESIA------------- 1. TUJUAN KAMITujuan pertama kami adalah menciptakan ruang asrama tempat relawan lokal, tamu internasional, dan peserta lokakarya dapat tinggal dan belajar permaculture bersama kami. Asrama dan tempat kami juga akan siap digunakan sebagai titik evakuasi, dapur umum dan / atau zona aman untuk bencana alam di masa depan (sejak September tahun lalu, Emas Hitam telah terlibat dalam upaya bantuan Agung Agung untuk letusan Gunung Agung, dan baru-baru ini gempa bumi di Lombok melalui sukarelawan, penyortiran sumbangan dan dukungan logistik).Berikut ini adalah tonggak pendanaan kami:• $ 5000: Asrama Akomodasi (pondasi, struktur, tempat tidur susun, perlengkapan interior, atap, dan balkon)• + $ 1000: Dapur bersama (pondasi, struktur, dapur tradisional Bali, oven alami, kompor roket, sistem greywater, filter air, pipa ledeng, wastafel, persediaan memasak)• + $ 500: Sistem penyimpanan air hujan (platform, tangki air hujan, casing bambu, pipa, keran, filter mesh)• +1000: Kamar mandi bersama (pondasi, atap, struktur, toilet kompos kering, pancuran matahari, sistem greywater)• + $ 2500: Bungalow keluarga dengan kamar mandi terpisah (pondasi, struktur, tempat tidur, perlengkapan interior, atap, balkon, toilet kompos kering, area shower)Jika kami mencapai lebih dari $ 10.000, kami akan mengusulkan fasilitas lain - dipilih oleh komunitas donor kami, seperti ruang hidup bersama atau transportasi untuk mengumpulkan limbah desa!2. KAMI ‘MENGAPA’Kenapa tidak?Karena kita bisa, karena kita harus, karena kita mau! Kami memahami bahwa sistem lama sedang sekarat, serta cara lama dalam melakukan sesuatu. Kami tahu bagaimana menemukan solusi regeneratif berdasarkan kolaborasi yang terikat oleh etika dan prinsip permakultur. Kami ingin merancang Ancut Garden Oasis (AGO) sebagai sistem keseluruhan, di mana setiap elemen dan manusia dapat mencapai tujuan tertinggi mereka - saling mempercayai satu sama lain, dan menciptakan kehidupan komunitas yang dapat menjadi contoh bagi orang lain.3. SIAPA KAMIKami adalah sekelompok teman yang berbagi visi yang sama tentang bagaimana kami ingin menjalani hidup kami. Kami semua berasal dari latar belakang yang berbeda dan telah memiliki kehidupan yang sukses sejauh ini, namun masing-masing merasa bahwa ada sesuatu yang hilang. Kami menemukannya ketika kami terhubung dengan tanah. Bekerja bersama, kami menyadari dampak yang dapat kami miliki dengan mengajari orang cara menanam makanan mereka sendiri dan meregenerasi tanah mereka. Bersama dengan komunitas lokal, kami menciptakan Ancut Garden Oasis. Kami percaya kami dapat memiliki dampak positif di dunia kita, dengan merawat orang, Planet kita dan dengan redistribusi yang adil dari surplus kita. Kami ingin menjadi bagian dari sesuatu yang lebih besar dari diri kami sendiri, dan kami tahu bahwa kami tidak dapat melakukannya sendirian.4. CERITA KAMISetelah Kadek lulus dari Universitas Navdanya Vandana Shiva pada tahun 2015, Kadek dan Feny terinspirasi untuk ikut mendirikan Emas Hitam Indonesia (EHI) dengan dukungan pemuda Indonesia lainnya pada bulan Desember 2015.Sejak saat ini, tim telah secara aktif berkontribusi terhadap kedaulatan pangan dan gerakan keberlanjutan di Bali dan di seluruh Indonesia. Pelatihan kami meliputi:• Sekaroh, Lombok Timur (Juni-Juli 2016): EHI melatih sekelompok petani 32 orang ,mereka berjuang untuk menumbuhkan satu tanaman jagung hybrida setiap tahun, dengan  mengajarkan  mereka bagaimana meregenerasi tanah mereka menerapkan prinsip-prinsip desain permaculture. Sehingga mereka bisa menanam lebih banyak berbagai jenis tanaman yang mereka butuhkan.• Karangasem, Bali Timur (Nov 2017): Tim EHI menyampaikan lokakarya yang disesuaikan untuk 3 desa tentang fiksasi nitrogen, penggunaan rumput vetiver sebagai pencegahan erosi, dan cara menciptakan bisnis berkelanjutan yang tumbuh dari moringa oleifera.• Malaka, Io Kufeu, Timor Barat (Agustus 2017): Pelatihan EHI memperkenalkan konsep pertanian regeneratif ke 3 komunitas yang berhubungan dengan praktek pertanian yang tidak berkelanjutan.Pada bulan November 2017, kami turut menciptakan Festival JAGA Indonesia: Merayakan Agroekologi dan Kemerdekaan Benih - acara gratis bagi lebih dari 250 petani Indonesia, pelajar, perwakilan pemerintah dan aktivis di Bali dan Jawa. Guru Navdanya University Kadek datang terutama dari India untuk berbagi lokakarya praktis mereka tentang agroekologi, kedaulatan pangan, kompos cair, dan penyimpanan benih.Selain itu, kami telah terlibat dalam pelatihan, konsultasi dan keterlibatan berbicara termasuk Ubud Food Festival, acara Slow Food Bali, Pengenalan Kursus Permakultur IDEP, dan lokakarya mahasiswa Hari Bumi Universitas Udayana.5. SITUS KAMISejak Desember 2017, kami telah beroperasi di Ancut Garden, situs baru kami di Petulu, yang 100% bebas pestisida, bebas pupuk kimia dan non-GMO. Dalam bahasa Bali, ‘ancut’ (diucapkan ‘pinggir’), berarti ‘batas’ atau ‘sisi’. Ini adalah tempat di mana dua realitas bertemu-hidup seperti yang kita kenal dan kehidupan yang ingin kita jalani! Sejak pindah ke sini, kami telah membangun:Gambar: Situs, sebelum-sesudah, lalu peta• Rumah Kayu Kejutan 2 tingkat kami dengan toilet kompos kering• Kebun bibit dan peternakan cacing• Area kompos panas (4x kompos teluk, kiln biochar, mesin pemotong ranting dan pemotong daun)• Desain taman (3x sawah, kebun dapur, tempat bedengan mandala yang ditinggikan, 3x lingkaran pisang, 2x kolam, 10x biopori)• Hutan makanan (pohon buah-buahan dan tanaman umbi termasuk kelor, pisang, talas, ubi jalar, singkong, nangka, durian, rambutan, salak, mangga putih, pepaya, tebu, kelapa, vanila, merica dan banyak lagi!)• Sistem pengelolaan limbah• Akses dan parkir• DALAM KEMAJUAN: ruang belajar komunitas, toilet kompos ke-2, rumah bambu AGO

story:
Bonjour,

La nature luxuriante sur l'île d'Itaparica est souillée par des déchets en tous genres.Arrivée en  2008 sur cette île , qui est notre coup de cœur , j'ai décidé d'aider à améliorer cet environnement en faisant mon geste pour la planète. En tant que professeur de biologie , je connais les conséquences des détritus dans la nature et je veux y remédier en faisant de l'alphabétisation écologique.

Pour créer aussi mon centre de tri sélectif il me faudra investir dans un terrain, la construction d'un hangar pour le traitement des déchets afin de pouvoir le envoyer vers des centres locaux de recyclage ( PET, cannettes, papier et carton) ainsi que de recycler les huiles végétales usées en savon, transformer les noix de coco en copeaux et fabriquer du compost à base de déchets végétaux.

 En ce qui concerne les enfants faire de l’alphabétisation écologique  en:

montrant la situation actuelle

expliquant les conséquences des déchets sur le milieu

prouvant que la relation déchets et maladie existe

montrant vers où va le monde si personne ne se sent  responsable des  dégâts causés par la nonchalance  humaine ( film HOME p.ex)

expliquant que chaque action positive personnelle    représente un petit  grain de sable qui  fera la différence ( ex: le colibri de Pierre Rabhi)
 enseignant que les principes
d’organisation de l’écologie  sont pareils  à n’importe quel  éco système naturel ( plantes,  animaux,insectes ,…)

En ce qui concerne l'environnement même:
ILHA LIMPA asbl a  besoin d'un fonds de base afin de pouvoir investir dans la construction de ce site ( terrain, hangar, véhicule, tritureuse , presse hydraulique , balance, big bags,..) . Une fois cet investissement réalisé , le site deviendra auto -suffisant via les fonds récoltés par le recyclage.

Au Brésil, tout  ce qui est importé de l'étranger est sujet à une taxe de 110%, il n'est donc pas du tout recommandé de le faire. Il vaut mieux acheter sur place, parfois un peu plus cher qu'en Europe.

Nous donnerons un reçu pour chaque donation au dessus de 50€,comme attestation fiscale

Si nous n'arrivons pas à collecter la somme requise , nous nous occuperons de l'alphabétisation écologique des enfants et construirons un site à plus petite échelle.

Le but de notre projet n'est pas de punir, verbaliser la population locale. Le seul but est d'améliorer leur condition de vie :

en nettoyant le milieu dans lequel ils vivent

en mettant des personnes au travail qui , sans qualifications n'en trouvent pas

en valorisant le travail de personnes qui aident pour la planète et le futur des enfants

 

Il est clair que chacun de vous ne pourra nous aider financièrement. Mais si vous appréciez le projet de ILHA LIMPA , partagez notre projet avec vos connaissances , via les réseaux sociaux . Vous pouvez nous rejoindre sur Facebook  : Ilha Limpa

Merci à Indiegogo d'être présent sur le web! Consultez les!

story:
Putting the Culture back in AgriCulture

Aloha Mahi'ai Farms is Hawai'i island's premiere AgriCultural Lodge and Learning Organization. A cooperative community built from the ground up as a site to host educational events, focusing on sustainable agriculture, dedicated to inspiring people to live, grow, eat and work in a better way.  Come join us for an experiential educational course, a self-guided farm stay, or even a year long internship, and discover the joy of living simply, sustainably and meaningfully in paradise.

What We Need & What You Get

Here it is in more detail:

  • Raise $30,000.00 in 60 days
  • Funds to finish the last 10% of Phase 1 Construction and open the doors for guest and educational events.
  • Any and all monies raised for this project will be utilized by Aloha Mahi'ai Farms for programs, workshops and events supporting Olohana Foundations mission.
  • Indiegogo contributions go directly to Aloha Mahi'ai or more Sizable Tax Deductable Donations are available through Olohana Foundation.

The Impact

If you are interested in supporting resilience and sustainability for our communities, if you see the future patterns of consumption and resource depletion then you probably know we must re-prioritize, but only if we care about the future condition of our planet for the next foreseeable generations, economically, environmentally and socially.  The good news is proven solutions exist for all these difficulties. Aloha Mahi'ai Farms will:

  • Create models of resiliency for Native, Tribal and Rural communities and strategies for Urban and Sub-Urban capacity
  • Hosting educational events taught by renowned experts in each field to a small group of students in residence
  • Offer courses focused on regenerative permanent agriculture including agroforestry, natural farming, humane livestock management, aquaponics, and sustainable societal adaptation
  • Broadcast courses, podcasts, events and trainings over the internet
  • Offer additional learning focused on human wellness optimization, including farm to table food preparation, yoga, jiu jitsu, meditation, surfing, qui gong, biohacking, lomi lomi, la'au lapa'au, massage, and anything that helps you be the best version of yourself

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to support us yet are challenged to make a donation today, you can help by getting the word out. Share our campaign on Indiegogo, Facebook, Twitter, your blog, podcast, maybe even speak to someone, in person, real life, flesh and blood...

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about Our campaign.
  • If you live on the Big Island, please get in touch, ask us about the next work party and Full Moon Concert Events, BBQ, Campfire, Talk Story kine events, li'dat.
  • If you want to help the project as an intern, farmhand, volunteer or student, just email us your resume and contact information to be considered for one of these exclusive positions.

If Can Can, if No Can...  Aloha...

-Aloha Mahi'ai

story:
--------------

UPDATE 4/8:

We have been busy! Since the time we started this campaign we have run two community planting days with 20-25 volunteers/residents participating in each to pilot our program. In these pilot plantings we ran two educational tree care workshops and have planted over 30 fruit trees and learned a lot about the logistics of running this program. We have also secured a site to start a small nursery for future tree propagation in East Oakland at Castlemont High School. We have started developing plans for future plantings including planting with several houses of a residential drug recovery program in Oakland and Berkeley, and a school teacher and her urban agriculture group in their neighborhood in Fruitvale. We now have two incredibly knowledable teachers, Justin Valone and Anders Vidstrand on board to teach our tree care workshops. And we recently received a generous $5,000 grant from the Rose Foundation!
 
 
Quotes from people who participated in our program so far:
"It really works. I met many neighbors - people I have never talked to before, though I lived on this block for 4 years." - North Oakland tree steward
 
"Thank you for the trees, food, fertilizer and great instruction."
- North Oakland tree steward
 
"Incredible class! I learned so much"
- Volunteer at the Fruitvale planting
 
"We noticed how people have been littering significantly less since we facilitated the sweet planting on our block." - Fruitvale resident and tree steward 
 
We are excited to have such an adaptable program where we can work with schools, hospitals, centers and other organizations that serve the community. We are so grateful for all your support!
 
Please continue to support us to do this important work! 
CONTRIBUTE NOW
SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN ON YOUR FACEBOOK PAGE OR THROUGH EMAIL TO YOUR FRIENDS
 
THANK YOU!
-------------------

What: Helping Oakland residents plant and steward fruit trees for their communities.

Growing Together's mission is to connect people to nature and each other, building resilient communities through food, urban agriculture, and education. We facilitate neighbors joining together to plant community owned trees in the front and back yards of homes in the SF East Bay. We aim to plant in underserved neighborhoods that are experiencing a convergence of health, economic and environmental crises, with the understanding that urban trees provide innumerable community and environmental benefits. We provide the fruit trees and basic tree care education and help with planting and long term maintenance. The residents care for the trees and share the fruit.   

Why?:

  • Food Justice : To build long term food security in Oakland
  • Community: To meet our neighbors and share the harvest
  • Education: To increase local knowledge and share skills for fruit tree cultivation
  • Environment: To green and beautify our neighborhoods

It is evident that low income urban areas substantially lack the tree cover found in more affluent neighborhoods. What is less immediately evident, is the vast health and environmental implications of living in a "concrete jungle". Studies have shown that the presence of trees helps reduce stress, speed healing time, and even decrease rates of domestic violence and child abuse. Furthermore, many residents of urban areas experience a myriad of health problems associated with living in food deserts (areas with out access to healthy food) including diabetes, obesity and other chronic health conditions. Trees clean the air of pollutants, create oxygen, and absorb CO2,  lower heating and cooling costs of nearby buildings, reduce water run-off, increase property values, provide essential habitat for many species and more.  As these are fruit trees they will also provide a source of local fresh fruit for decades and centuries to come.

For all these benefits and more, we believe in the power of planting trees to serve the most vulnerable communities and populations that bear the brunt of environmental burdens.

(For a more complete list of tree benefits and a list of sources see our website growingtogetherproject.org)

How It Works:

1 →  Any interested resident of Oakland contacts us about becoming a fruit tree steward.

Great! We would love to help you plant a fruit tree in your yard.  First we work with this future fruit steward to organize their community. We help that person connect with neighbors and find other fruit tree stewards with planting sites on their street. We aim to plant trees in clusters of 20 or more per block for optimal impact and to promote community building, and grow an abundant shareable harvest. Interested?

2 → Together we organize a tree planting day for the block during which Growing Together volunteers and neighborhood members get together to plant donated trees at the selected sites (the front/back yards of the stewards) for community use.

3 → Tree stewards water and care for the trees as they grow.

Tree stewards attend an educational workshop during the planting day to learn about tree water needs, pruning, and other tree care topics prior to planting. After planting, we can also help with questions, and provide any expert care the tree needs.

4 → When fruit is ready, the neighborhood shares the harvest.
An abundant fruit tree is for sharing.

Goal: To plant 1,000 fruit trees at Oakland homes, gardens, and community centers in the next 16 months!

Our goal is to plant 1,000 fruit trees in people's yards, community centers and schools by May 2014. Accordingly, we will teach between 40-50 tree care workshops and hold 40-50 community planting days with 15-25 households participating in each. We will not hold plantings during the dry summer season and will use that time to focus on signing up more tree stewards and working on propagation. After our first planting cycle, we will evaluate the project and decide on our goal for the next year and how to proceed.

The money raised here will allow us to purchase trees in bulk, transport trees, purchase and propagate groundcovers and perennials to complement our tree plantings, provide soil amendments and staking materials, produce and print flyers and promotional materials, provide educational materials for stewards, host community planting days and cover the costs to coordinate this project.

Our Model

Growing Together is unique in its approach of planting fruit trees on community members' private land for community use and in our focus on planting in neighborhoods of need. As far as we are aware, we are developing a new model, in working with private homeowners to re-green communities, one street at a time. Therefore, the success of this project will not only benefit Oakland residents, but also create a replicable model so that others can implement similar projects in their own communities.

If you like this project, please contribute as you are able and share our website and campaign with your friends. And if you live locally, please consider becoming a GT fruit tree steward as well and help us coordinate a planting on your block!  Thank you so much for your support!

Who we are:

Mallika is a gardener, yogi, healthy food enthusiast and food justice activist.  She asked herself how she could best serve the world and her local community, and planting fruit trees all over the city seemed like the most worthy thing she could do; from that impulse, this project was born. 

Jim is a Consulting Arborist and Forester with a BS in Urban Forestry from the Pennsylvania State University. As the Director of Tree Operations for Urban Releaf, a tree planting nonprofit in Oakland, Jim serves as a technical advisor and educator for both the staff and the community. Jim is working with Growing Together to help develop educational materials, run tree care clases and provide specialist care when needed. He's also an incredible home brewer and chef (check out his offerings in the perks!).

4 → When fruit is ready, the neighborhood shares the harvest. An abundant fruit tree is for sharing.

Goal: To plant 1,000 fruit trees at Oakland homes, gardens, and community centers in the next 16 months!
Our goal is to plant 1,000 fruit trees in people's yards, community centers and schools by May 2014. Accordingly, we will teach between 40-50 tree care workshops and hold 40-50 community planting days with 15-25 households participating in each. We will not hold plantings during the dry summer season and will use that time to focus on signing up more tree stewards and working on propagation. After our first planting cycle, we will evaluate the project and decide on our goal for the next year and how to proceed.
The money raised here will allow us to purchase trees in bulk, transport trees, purchase and propagate groundcovers and perennials to complement our tree plantings, provide soil amendments and staking materials, produce and print flyers and promotional materials, provide educational materials for stewards, host community planting days and cover the costs to coordinate this project.
Our Model
Growing Together is unique in its approach of planting fruit trees on community members' private land for community use and in our focus on planting in neighborhoods of need. As far as we are aware, we are developing a new model, in working with private homeowners to re-green communities, one street at a time. Therefore, the success of this project will not only benefit Oakland residents, but also create a replicable model so that others can implement similar projects in their own communities.
If you like this project, please contribute as you are able and share our website and campaign with your friends. And if you live locally, please consider becoming a GT fruit tree steward as well and help us coordinate a planting on your block!  Thank you so much for your support!
Who we are:
Mallika is a gardener, yogi, healthy food enthusiast and food justice activist.  She asked herself how she could best serve the world and her local community, and planting fruit trees all over the city seemed like the most worthy thing she could do; from that impulse, this project was born. 
Jim is a Consulting Arborist and Forester with a BS in Urban Forestry from the Pennsylvania State University. As the Director of Tree Operations for Urban Releaf, a tree planting nonprofit in Oakland, Jim serves as a technical advisor and educator for both the staff and the community. Jim is working with Growing Together to help develop educational materials, run tree care clases and provide specialist care when needed. He's also an incredible home brewer and chef (check out his offerings in the perks!).

story:
AS THE CAMPAIGN IS TOO SHORT ON INDIEGOGO

It will go on on our website www.perfumefoundation.org until we succeed to raise enough funding to accomplish our mission


               Version Française

               

                   

SHORT SUMMARY

TODAY, CONSUMERS, ENVIRONMENT AND OUR CHILDREN'S HERITAGE  ARE IN DANGER

WE NEED YOU TO BE PART OF THIS AND TO ACT NOW

The Mission of the International PERFUME FOUNDATION is the Preservation of Consumer Health while protecting the World Perfume Heritage.  Preserving the Perfume Heritage is also Protecting the Environment and Preserving Your Art of Living


PERFUMES  

The Perfumes you find in the stores contain no more flowers but mostly unknown chemicals. New regulations made in favour of the chemical industry are making the use of naturals impossible for the last perfumers defending natural perfumery.

CONSUMERS                                              

Consumer organisations are pointing health issues regarding synthetic perfumes and encourage their government to put in place scent free policies. On the other hand, consumers love perfumes and ask for natural perfumes.

ENVIRONMENT                                          

As the chemical industry took over the production of perfumes there are no more flower fields and then no habitats for bees and pollinators.

CHILDREN’S Future                        

Without bees and pollinators, our future generations will know a severe lack of food.

Incense, Oud, Attar… Perfume is part of the culture of many countries in the world. If perfume is forbidden in public places it will be also forbidden in religious cult places. 



                  WE CAN CHANGE THE FUTURE  


         AND YOU CAN BE PART OF THE CHANGE 


IF WE ACT NOW WE CAN PROTECT THE FUTURE OF OUR CHILDREN AND THE NEXT GENERATIONS

WITH YOUR PARTICIPATION WE CAN

-Replant Flower Fields Worldwide

-Give Work to Millions of People around the World 

-Bring Back the Bees and Pollinators their Habitats

-Have Perfumers to Reintroduce Flowers back in   your Perfumes to make them 

            


DONATE FOR THIS CAUSE AND HAVE YOUR NAME FOREVER KNOWN AS PART OF THE PERFUME HISTORY 


WHAT WE NEED

Today we need to raise an additional 250.000 Euro.

Your donations and support will allow us to put in place our campaign at a global level.

With your help, we will finance the organisation of the exhibition, the conference and the event at UNESCO Paris, in order to Classify Perfume in the Unesco World Heritage    

With your support, we will put in place the World Perfume Development Program, our Perfumotherapy DNA research centres and the first flower fields. 

With your support we will educate children, our future generation the importance of "bees" without the bees our food supply will be severely affected.

More of our actions, research

http://perfumefoundation.wix.com/preventcancer


WHAT YOU GET

Donors will be awarded Chevaliers du Parfum, they will receive Gifts, Invitations to Events, Natural Perfumery Curriculum, Eternal Recognition …

Follow us as there will be many new perks during this campaign.

Donors will have (if they desire) their pictures, awards and support messages added, as Chevalier du Parfum in our website World Perfume Heritage.  

Donors will receive an official receipt.

For this campaign at Indiegogo, donors can only pay through Paypal in Euro. For all credit cards payments, donations can come via Perfume Foundation  http://www.perfumefoundation.org/index2.php?EN-home, for cheques, contact us at wph@perfumefoundation.org 



Rola Mahmoud, Middle East Celebrity and  World Perfume Heritage Ambassador 


Lavanya Hiremath, Miss Earth Canada and World Perfume Heritage Ambassador

                             

                           WORLD PERFUME HERITAGE 

The International Perfume Foundation has formally requested the EU to have Perfume TAKEN OUT of the Cosmetic Directive because PERFUME IS NOT A COSMETIC and that Perfume needs its own regulation and guidelines. 

With the support of several countries, we are asking UNESCO to recognise "Perfume as a World Heritage" and classify Perfume within the foundation of UNESCO World Heritage. This initiative will preserve and protect the Art of Perfumery, national  knowledges and national plant heritage. Many countries have beautiful flowers , resins, precious woods, and  healing plants they cannot use anymore because synthetic reproduction are made by the chemical industry and commercialised under the same name. This is a lack of respect for small producers and misleading communication for consumer who believe he is buying   

                   


Perfume is an art of living, used by all countries and all civilisations.

Perfume is an Art Form, like Painting, Music or Dance.

If you are like us, you love the world of perfume and understand the beneficial power of plants, especially flowers, SHOW YOU EXIST AND WANT TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE. DONATE TO OUR CAMPAIGN. 

Perfume has been in use since the beginning of the ages by all civilisations. Perfume used to be known as the "soul" of flowers. In the beginning perfume was so precious, it was only used by men as a gift to their gods, then it was used as a medicinal healing art before becoming part of fashion and lifestyle.

The beneficial power of flowers as well as the importance of our well being, health and the sense of smell have been completely compromised and overlooked by our regulators. It is proposed they are being supported by the chemical industry due to lobbying efforts and financial contributions to accept "their" new molecules and synthetics with less data and knowledge than our very old pharmacopeia. 

Today a great many of the best Perfumers have left Europe as they can find it extremely difficult to use naturals anymore. The European Union (EU) regulations and regulators have sided mainly with the synthetic and chemical industry. 

Today there are concerns in the natural perfumery community that the EU Commission through such industry lobbying, is trying to impose it's unreasonable and inappropriate regulations worldwide. Such a movement or result would put not only the World Perfume Heritage in danger but also Our World Food Program and the future of our children.  Scent free policies are already in place in several part of the world as more and more people are allergic to synthetic perfumes. 



THE IMPACT

The action, initiative and movement YOU CAN CREATE TODAY are very important in preserving the Heritage of Perfume and the Art of Perfumery. They will also encourage and replenish our global floral and natural aromatics farms and distillation industries.  We need to replant flowers worldwide to give the natural, sustainable environment back to bees, and pollinators their habitat.

This action, initiative and movement will also create and GIVE WORK TO MILLION PEOPLE worldwide who will be allowed to cultivate the flower fields for the natural perfumers who will use flowers and naturals in the traditional ways based on their original and historical perfume compositions and formulations.  The International Perfume Foundation is supporting the Perfumery Art School for their worldwide traditional perfumery curriculum. 

                 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot support financially our campaign, be creative, find other ways to support, or just follow us and share our campaign with your social media networks, blogs and contacts. 

Tools will be available in the gallery and in the World Perfume Heritage blog, feel free to share it or send us your picture to be part of the campaign and become  Marketer of the Change.


BACKGROUND                 

The International Perfume Foundation was founded in January 1995, by Creezy Courtoy, after realising that the art of creating and making real perfumes was in danger of disappearing.

Perfume is not only an important industry but also apart of our global heritage and cultural history.  While advocating for almost 20 years to the industry that chemicals could be hazardous if not tested in the right way, Creezy Courtoy collected perfume art pieces to show that perfume was not only an industry but also an important link in the World Perfume Heritage and Culture.

The Perfume Foundation is a Belgian non-profit organisation created in 1995, known internationally and recognised by institutions, the perfume and cosmetic industry and NGO’s.

The Perfume Foundation is a consumer organisation totally independent from the perfume industry. The Perfume Foundation’s mission is to be the leading authority on environmental and health issues related to fragrances and scents, while contributing to the cultural heritage of perfume.

The name “Perfume Foundation” is a reference to its ultimate goal to come back to the basic foundation of Perfumery, which are products that are good for health, safe for the environment and made with real flowers and plants.  

In 1999, the International Perfume Foundation organized an exhibition at UNESCO called LES ROUTES DU PARFUM to illustrate the World Perfume Heritage and as a result the International Perfume Foundation received UNESCO High Patronage Designation and Recognition.

                            

 UNESCO High Patronage Designation and Recognition.

 LES ROUTES DU PARFUM at UNESCO 

IPF Young Generation Website - Prevent Cancer

 World Perfume Heritage 

 

PARTNERS OF THE CAMPAIGN

       

              



CONTACTS

-Global  

Creezy CourtoyPaul K Holmes 

-North America: 

Canada Ashie Hirji Cynthia Pace Brad Mitchell

Boston Sara Miller  Teresa Vazquez

Las Vegas Terry Johnson

Los Angeles John Lambert

Washington Christina Cox

-Middle East: Rola Mahmoud SabineBalve Alwyn Stephen

-Indian Ocean Islands and Southern Africa: Isabelle Gellé 

- Europe

France:   Cannes: Elisabeth Vanduffel  Paris:Lila Besnaci 

Suisse:  Genève: Nazy Sheikhan   Zurich:Silvana Zabel 

Scandinavia: Maj Scherer

                 http://www.perfumefoundation.org

                 http://perfumefoundation.blogspot.com

                 http://lesroutesduparfum.blogspot.com

                 http://powerfulflower.blogspot.com

                 http://worldperfumeheritage.blogspot.com

                 http://newluxurycode.blogspot.com

                 http://www.facebook.com/perfumefoundation

                 http://www.facebook.com/worldperfumeheritage

                  http://www.twitter.com/Perfumotherapy

                 http://www.scoop.it/t/help-us-to-protect-your-perfume-heritage

story:
Short Summary

The St. Maarten Nature Foundation is a conservation NGO based on the Caribbean Island of St. Maarten. We are actively involved in managing the environment on the island, including the Man of War Shoal Marine Protected Area.

Although much work is being done to conserve the island's natural environment there is a lack of awareness among the general population regarding nature around the. Therefore we have made a short promotional video and are hoping to show it both on local television and in the island's only cinema theater, thus hoping to create awareness among residents as to the importance of conserving nature.

St. Maarten is a Caribbean island faced with many challanges related to overdevelopment and lack of environmental awareness. Showcasing the natural world in a short, professionally made clip would do much in ensuring that islanders are aware of the natural beauty around them and the need to conserve and protect it. 

The Nature Foundation needs five thousand US Dollars to pay for air time on both the local cable television and in the local movie theater (3500 for one month in all of the screens in the movie theater and 1500 to show on cable television)

Those that donate will be contributing to conservation awareness building on a lovely caribbean island! For resident donars we offer free introduction to SCUBA classes and Environmental Trips in our Mangrove Lagoon. If you are visiting St. Maarten you can count on the same! 

If the entire goal is not met the funds will go entirely towards the Nature Foundation afterschool activities program for children eight to thirteen.

Conservation on a small island is often challanging and we also lack crucial income to ensure that awareness is built how it is supposed to be built among the local population. Therefore a highly visual, mini documentary if you will will greatly increase awareness of the population in conservation.

If you are unable to contribute spread the word about this campaign!

story:
Short Summary

Verónica Juzgado is going to the UN to save the world. You can help her get there.

This December, diplomats from across the world will meet in Lima to negotiate a new plan to save the climate. It's all leading up to next year's big meeting in Paris, where world leaders will meet to sign a new deal to save the climate. This is the last major meeting before then - so we need to make it count.

Verónica is the secretary of the Global Greens - a growing network of volunteers with a huge global reach through more than 90 Green parties.

Verónica needs to get to Lima to carry the voice of the hundreds of millions of people worldwide who have voted Green for a greener, safer world. She'll take that call to governments - but also play a vital role in connecting Greens from around the world to one another, to make our global network stronger as we head into the Big Year: 2015.

Verónica is ready to go - but we need to cover the costs to get her to the UN meeting in December. Will you help Verónica get to Lima?

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise the funds for Verónica's travel to Lima.

  • 2500 euros is the cost for Verónica to travel to Lima, stay in budget accommodation, get to the Conference each day (and eat).
  • If we don't reach our target any funds that you donate will still help cover the cost of getting Verónica to Lima.
  • If we exceed our target, the additional funds will go towards continuing the Global Greens climate campaign into next year: pulling together a global analysis of Green climate policies, producing campaign materials, pressuring governments and more.
  • We've got great gifts to thank you for your generosity: a DVD of the inspiring first Global Greens Congress (guaranteed to make you cry), a (signed!) book of speeches from the Congress, personal shout-outs from Lima and more.

The Impact

It's so important for Greens to be heard at the UN Climate Conferences. We're the major political family calling worldwide for fast, fair cuts to the pollution that's driving global warming. We're building a better world, all the way from action in our streets to the halls of the UN.

Great Greens are going to Lima to represent their countries - Sweden's Green Deputy Prime Minister will be there as her country's Climate Minister, and so will Green MPs from Europe, the Americas and Australia.

But it's so important to have someone in Lima from a Global Green perspective:

  • Verónica can be a voice for people working for a greener world who can't send someone to Lima, especially in less wealthy countries.
  • Verónica's work won't just happen during the Conference. She's already preparing, and she'll be keeping those links between Greens alive long after the Lima conference tables have been packed away.
  • Even before the Global Greens' first Congress in 2001, we were working cooperatively to build a greener, fairer world. Since then, our network has connected Green political parties and movements to one another, helped each other campaign and created global direction on clean renewable energy, re-energising democracy and more.
  • This year, we've paid our first campaign organisers to mobilise Greens around climate change. They've had a big impact, giving an audience to powerful Green stories from Africa, Asia, Europe and the Americas.
  • We want to continue that work into next year, when cooperation between Greens worldwide - and huge campaigns to get people voting Green - will be more important than ever for our climate.

We'd love to have your help to send Verónica to Lima and to continue her vital work. Please donate to fund our campaign today.

Other Ways You Can Help 

Remember, any support will help Verónica and help the Greens build a global voice.

Others ways to get involved!

  • Keep informed joining our GG news. Green news around the world every month!
  • Became a FROGG (Friend Of Global Greens)
  • Get the word out about  the importance of this UN Climate Summit in Lima and next year's in Paris
  • And of course, be part of changing the world. Our everyday choices can change the planet permanently for the better. 

If you can't donate at all today, please share our campaign with your friends. It's an exciting time to be Green - and nothing is better than getting others involved :)

Follow us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/globalgreens

You can find out all about us at http://globalgreens.org

#ActúaCOP20
story_txt:
Short Summary Verónica Juzgado is going to the UN to save the world. You can help her get there.
This December, diplomats from across the world will meet in Lima to negotiate a new plan to save the climate. It's all leading up to next year's big meeting in Paris, where world 
leaders will meet to sign a new deal to save the climate. This is the 
last major meeting before then - so we need to make it count.
Verónica is the secretary of the Global Greens - a growing network of volunteers with a huge global reach through more than 90 Green parties.
Verónica needs to get to Lima to carry the voice of the hundreds of millions of people worldwide who have voted Green for a greener, safer world. She'll take that call to governments - but also play a vital role in connecting Greens from around the world to one another, to make our global network stronger as we head into the Big Year: 2015.Verónica is ready to go - but we need to cover the costs to get her to the UN meeting in December. Will you help Verónica get to Lima?



What We Need & What You Get
 We need to raise the funds for Verónica's travel to Lima.  2500 euros is the cost for Verónica to travel to Lima, stay in budget accommodation, get to the Conference each day (and eat).

If we don't reach our target any funds that you donate will still help cover the cost of getting Verónica to Lima. 

If we exceed our target, the additional funds will go towards continuing the Global Greens climate campaign into next year: pulling together a global analysis of Green climate policies, producing campaign materials, pressuring governments and more.
We've got great gifts to thank you for your generosity: a DVD of the inspiring first Global Greens Congress (guaranteed to make you cry), a (signed!) book of speeches from the Congress, personal shout-outs from Lima and more.
   The Impact It's so important for Greens to be heard at the UN Climate Conferences. We're the major political family calling worldwide for fast, fair cuts to the pollution that's driving global warming. We're building a better world, all the way from action in our streets to the halls of the UN.
Great Greens are going to Lima to represent their countries - Sweden's Green Deputy Prime Minister will be there as her country's Climate Minister, and so will Green MPs from Europe, the Americas and Australia.
But it's so important to have someone in Lima from a Global Green perspective:  Verónica can be a voice for people working for a greener world who can't send someone to Lima, especially in less wealthy countries.
Verónica's work won't just happen during the Conference. She's already preparing, and she'll be keeping those links between Greens alive long after the Lima conference tables have been packed away.
 Even before the Global Greens' first Congress in 2001, we were working cooperatively to build a greener, fairer world. Since then, our network has connected Green political parties and movements to one another, helped each other campaign and created global direction on clean renewable energy, re-energising democracy and more.
 This year, we've paid our first campaign organisers to mobilise Greens around climate change. They've had a big impact, giving an audience to powerful Green stories from Africa, Asia, Europe and the Americas. 

We want to continue that work into next year, when cooperation between Greens worldwide - and huge campaigns to get people voting Green - will be more important than ever for our climate.

We'd love to have your help to send Verónica to Lima and to continue her vital work. Please donate to fund our campaign today.


Other Ways You Can Help 
 
Remember, any support will help Verónica and help the Greens build a global voice.
Others ways to get involved!


Keep informed joining our GG news. Green news around the world every month!


Became a FROGG (Friend Of Global Greens)


Get the word out about  the importance of this UN Climate Summit in Lima and next year's in Paris


And of course, be part of changing the world. Our everyday choices can change the planet permanently for the better. 




If you can't donate at all today, please share our campaign with your friends. It's an exciting time to be Green - and nothing is better than getting others involved :)
Follow us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/globalgreens

You can find out all about us at http://globalgreens.org

#ActúaCOP20

story:
I volunteered one month in January-February 2013 in a small NGO in The Philippines in LapuLapu-City. During this time I met an amazing couple, Dan and Armeda, and their four children. They were incredibly kind to me, invited me to their home and looked  after me when I was sick. Despite their own hardships, they help to run a feeding program their community and always help those in need the best they can.

Unfortunately The Philippines has been devastated by Super Typhoon Hayian. Thousands of people have tragically and suddenly died and their families homes have been left in ruins. Among the people suffering from damages are my friends Armeda, Dan and their four children, the youngest of them is only 3 years old (pictured above). Part of Dan's and Armeda's house collapsed during the earthquake on 4th of November and before they could recover from this the super typhoon has done even more damage.  Armeda's family in Iloilo has completely lost their house and a fishing boat.

We can help them rebuild their home and their lives! Only a small amount is needed to help with their home and any additional money will go directly to the surrounding community for the things they need most as they work together to repair the damages. 

Even the smallest contribution can help empower these people to rebuild their homes and get on with their lives as stronger and more united people. You don't need to 'dig deep', a small amount such as an hour of your salary is enough to provide a friend food for a week or purchase building supplies to get things going.

story:
An opportunity to be part of an historic battle against big oil and gas corporations that have for too long been poisoning the air and water and violating indigenous soverienty.

For the past two years, grassroots members of the Wet'suwe'ten First Nation have been building a land reclamation project in the path of seven proposed oil and gas pipelines; an action that has been inspiring people all around the world. They've already refused access to pipeline workers, surveyors (see video above), and forest crews with plans to start work on the Pacific Trails Pipeline (which would bring gas from the fracking fields of the Horn River Basin). The intruders have been warned about trespassing on Unis'tot'en.

The Pacific Trails Pipeline is the first of seven proposed pipelines that would run through Unist'ot'en territory to the coast (including the Enbridge pipeline), and the Unist'ot'en are committed to stopping all of them.

We've just learned that the oil and gas companies are changing the pipeline route to get around the cabins we helped build last year. Toghestiy, a hereditary chief of the Likhts’amisyu Clan says their plan won't succeed because the Unis'tot'en and other clan leaders will block the new route as well.

The Unist'ot'en camp is planning to build traditional pit houses along the Wedzin Kwah (Morice River) on the new pipeline right-of-way, about a kilometer from the existing camp cabin.

Unist'ot'en led resistance to these pipelines is not being supported by big ENGOs and grantmakers. Their on-the-ground work has been wholely supported by individuals like you, and small groups like us, Forest Action Network.

In August 2012, Forest Action Network sponsored the first caravan to the Unis'tot'en Camp. We brought close to 100 volunteers and a couple tonnes of food and supplies to help build the cabins and outbuildings.

The Unist'ot'en camp has issued a call-out for volunteers to help construct pithouses and install interconnected permaculture gardens in their territory at their Spring Camp. The Spring Camp is for 3 weeks and the dates are May 6-24, 2013.

Forest Action Network is pledging shovels, saws, and food for the camp. We're also recruiting volunteers and permaculture experts.

We are raising funds for a caravan of volunteers and supplies, from Victoria, BC (occupied Coast Salish territories), up to the Unis'ot'en camp.

For more info and to volunteer: http://wildcoast.ca/caravan

story:
UPDATE: Monday, July 21st, 2014

PLEASE DO NOT CONTRIBUTE TO THIS CAMPAIGN!

Hey, it’s Uncle Dave and I know it may see a bit crazy to ask you NOT to contribute to my campaign… but let me tell you why.

Being in compliance with all state and local regulations is important to the long term success of not only this product, but my company as well.

About a week ago, I was contacted by the agriculture division of one of the states I want to ship my product to and informed that I need to register my product with their state.

This process is lengthy and does carry a cost that I was not anticipating. Similar registration will likely apply to all 50 states. So, I have a little work to do!

For those of you who have already contributed to the campaign, I will personally refund your money for now… and I’ll contact you when we’re ready to come back to indiegogo.

Thanks for believing in this product… I will be back!

Keep Growing,
Uncle Dave




Uncle Dave's Organics

Botanical Soil Activator

Uncle Dave’s Organics - Botanical Soil Activator contains 100% organic ingredients and stimulates the microbial activity in your soil… and active soil = happy soil!

Soil is the lifeblood of your yard and garden.  Everything you grow in soil that is treated with our Botanical Soil Activator becomes healthier.  Your plants will have a more robust root system and brighter foliage.  The increased microbial activity will allow them to more efficiently use the nutrients and water you give them.  That means you use LESS fertilizer and LESS water for BETTER results!

Our goal is to provide you with an organic* and sustainable* product to help you nurture your own little piece of paradise… no matter how big or small.  We want to make it EASY for you to grow healthy-organic plants, gardens and beautiful yards  that you can be proud of... knowing you’re contributing to growing healthy families, communities and a healthier planet.


We can confidently tell you that with healthy soil, you will see more vibrant plants with more uniform ripening times, bigger fruits and vegetables and plant yield increases between 10 and 30% (depending on the plants you use it on). 

If you have a passion for:

  • Growing your own organic food
  • Healthy Living
  • Helping Create a Healthy Planet

Please consider supporting our campaign and telling your friends.

According to the USDA, over 21 Million tons of fertilizers were used in 2011… in the US alone.  The chemicals from these fertilizers create runoff that finds its way into our creeks and streams and eventually ends up polluting our rivers, lakes and oceans.  

A 2012 UC Berkeley study proved — with 100% certainty — that the excess use of fertilizers over the last fifty years is DIRECTLY responsible for increased levels of atmospheric nitrous oxide… a major greenhouse gas contributing to global climate change.

Obviously pollution and greenhouse gases are BIG issues… but they’re not insurmountable.  You and I CAN make a difference.

Individual actions taken in our own yards and gardens directly affect the quality of our water, soil, and ecosystems… and those of the people living ‘downstream’ from us.  So, the fact is that it's actually pretty easy to contribute to the reduction of greenhouse gases... and grow something at the same time.

When you apply Uncle Dave's Organics - Botanical Soil Activator to your yard and garden, you'll end up using less water and less fertilizers. Not only does it help restore the productive capacity of your soil but it’s also totally ORGANIC.  It does not pollute the earth’s soil or water systems.  

As individuals, we make choices every day. They may seem like small choices but they shape the course of our lives… and the lives of our families, our communities and our planet as a whole.

Let’s work together to create a better world for ourselves and future generations.

Uncle Dave’s Organics - Botanical Soil Activator contains no artificial chemicals or preservatives.  It is completely non-toxic and safe to use around kids and pets.

One 6 oz. bottle can be diluted with 30 gallons of water to drench the soil around your shrubs, plants and trees.  OR when applied with a hose-end sprayer, it can cover up to 1000 square feet of your yard or garden.

Remember, it works by increasing the activity of the micro-organisms in the soil, allowing your plants to more effectively use water and nutrients.  This not only helps the soil grow healthier plants but it also reduces the amount of water and fertilizer you need to use.  That means less harmful environmental run-off.

So, now you know that by using Uncle Dave’s, not only are your plants healthier and happier... but you're also helping to decrease water pollution and greenhouse gas emissions that contribute to global warming.

Here are some other ways you can help

  1. Get our branded tote!  Everyone has stuff they need to tote around, like: books, groceries, or fruits and veggies from the local farmers market.  Do it in STYLE!
  2. Get a campaign perk as a gift for your garden-loving, organic-minded, planet-saving friends... they'll thank you for it :)
  3. Tell your friends and family.  This one is HUGE!  We need your help spreading the word about Uncle Dave's Organic Soil Activator!  There are lots of yards, gardens, farms, trees, and plants that need healthier soil... even if they're not yours.  Make some happy dirt!
  4. Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, g+, reddit, Tumblr, etc.  Again, your friends can help, too! 



About Uncle Dave's Organics

Uncle Dave’s Organics is a company on a mission!  We want to help make it simple to live a healthy life while creating a healthier world.  By sharing our research and our passion for living green… we’re committed to providing the inspiration and the products to make that possible.

We believe that there is a fundamental essence in each of us to grow.  And for most of us it’s not only about growing ourselves and realizing our own potential... it's about growing something else... a family, a business, a garden, a gift for tomorrow!



We Support: 

At Uncle Dave's Organics we share the idea that business is about selling things that change lives and that business profits can help change the world. With that in mind we've chosen to divide 5% of our Net Profits from this campaign between the following two organizations.



We chose these two organizations because they represent effective application of donation dollars and both have initiatives that will help reduce the harmful effects of current agricultural practices.

By supporting our campaign you're helping too!

What Is Uncle Dave's Organic Botanical Soil Activator?

The primary ingredients in our Botanical Soil Activator are a proprietary blend of plant extracts from succulent plants native to the deserts of the South-Western US and Northern Mexico.  All ingredients are plant based and 100% organic.

When will you ship product to supporters?

We have already run a small production batch for test garden use. Our full production efforts will begin shortly after our campaign ends...likely September or early October. We expect to begin shipping in November 2014.


What makes it work?

All soil contains active bacteria (micro-organisms).  In fact just a handful of healthy soil contains ten’s of millions of these tiny micro-organisms.  A plant’s ability to thrive is directly related to the presence of this living population.  These micro-organisms convert nutrients in the soil into plant-available form.  Without a healthy micro-organism population in the soil, many of the nutrients remain unused by the plants and can be washed away with heavy watering or heavy rains…which is what creates toxic runoff.

Our Botanical Soil Activator feeds, stimulates the growth, and increases the population of the micro-organisms in your soil.  This improves the quality of your soil and helps your plants develop a more advanced root system that can more efficiently consume soil nutrients.  Healthier roots with a more advanced root structure consume water and nutrients more efficiently which reduces the amount of nutrients we need to add to our soils. It also increases the vibrancy and yields of your plants.


Is Uncle Dave’s Organic botanical soil activator safe?

YES!  Our botanical soil activator is 100% organic. It contains no pesticides, no animal waste and no man-made chemicals of any kind.  It is 100% water-soluble and is completely non-hazardous and non-toxic.  No special protection is required for use, and no first aid is required if it comes in contact with your skin.  It is completely safe to use around your kids and pets!


What Can I expect for results?

Your lawn will become greener, your plants will become healthier, and you will get bigger yields from your fruit and vegetable garden.  If you are growing your own food, that means bigger healthier fruits and veggies. Yum!

You can use less water and fertilizer! 

AND Uncle Dave’s Organic - Botanical Soil Activator contains saponins (plant based surfactants with antifungal and antibacterial properties) that will also help your plants resist  disease and pests.


What Can Uncle Dave’s be used on?

Uncle Dave’s Organic Botanical Soil Activator can be used on any soil types and with anything you grow, including: lawns, house plants, fruit or nut trees, shrubs, flowers, vines, vegetables, berries, melons, and root or bulb crops.


When Should I apply it?

  • For lawns, you can apply anytime using a hose-end sprayer.  For best results, we suggest monthly applications.  If you want better results… use more often.

  • For existing shrubs, trees and plants, we recommend applying monthly.

  • For seedlings and new gardens, we recommend applications at planting.  After planting we suggest applications once every 7-14 days.

Application Information:  

Shipping Info:  

Currently we  can only ship within the United States due to agricultural rules that vary by country. Each perk on the right includes shipping costs.

As we reach our future goals, we plan to partner with like-minded businesses around the world to license our product in their home countries. 

Definitions.

* ORGANIC:

  • of, relating to, or derived from living matter.
  • (of food or farming methods) produced or involving production without the use of chemical fertilizers, pesticides, or other artificial agents.

* SUSTAINABLE:

  • conserving an ecological balance by avoiding depletion of natural resources.

story:
DESERTEC

On a global basis and through all parts of society it is meanwhile undoubtedly accepted by a majority of opinion leaders that a fast and complete transition to renewable energy is a mandatory step for mankind to secure sustainable living conditions for our children and grandchildren. Not only because of energy and climate security but also with regard to a reliable supply with drinking water, food, with regard to education, local value creation and socioeconomic development and last but not least with regard to collaboration between nations and cultures we have to find a way towards a renewables-based economy. 

To realize this type of economy not just the technical and financial framework has to be settled, the energy transition will have to take place in people’s minds first. This is the basis for sound decisions in politics, industry, academia and civil society. Participation will be the key for this biggest revolution mankind is approaching currently.

In order to make that happen DESERTEC Foundation is currently developing regional empowerment academies in Africa, South America, EUMENA and many other regions for tapping the deserts’ sunshine for energy supply: “Within 6 hours the deserts of the world receive more energy than mankind consumes within one year.” 

The funds support development of said academies and the global network of DESERTEC Foundation as a whole, which is mainly driven by voluntary work but also needs some financial support to cover basic costs.

DESERTEC - Become part of the solution!

To realize this type of economy not just the
technical and financial framework has to be settled, the energy transition will
have to take place in people’s minds first. This is the basis for sound
decisions in politics, industry, academia and civil society.
Participation will be the key for this biggest revolution mankind is
approaching currently. 
In order to make that happen DESERTEC Foundation is currently developing regional empowerment academies in Africa, South America, EUMENA and many other regions for tapping the
deserts’ sunshine for energy supply: “Within 6 hours the deserts of the world receive more energy than mankind consumes within one
year.” 
The funds support development of said academies and the global network of DESERTEC Foundation as a whole, which is mainly driven by voluntary work but also needs some financial support to cover basic costs.
DESERTEC - Become part of the solution!

story:
The Picture Above Isn't A Landfill Site….

It's an ordinary street in Arusha, Tanzania. 

Every day, tons of plastic waste in the form of bottles, bags and packaging are dumped in roadside drains or burned on landfill sites and vacant land. The impact of plastic waste on communities and the environment is significant and far reaching. Plastic waste clogging drains and waterways can lead to damaging floods during the rainy season and the pooling of stagnant water which reduces water quality and provides a breeding ground for malaria-carrying mosquitos. In addition, the burning of plastic waste at dump sites occurs at a low temperature which releases plumes of toxic smoke and creates hazardous ash which contaminates the surrounding soil.

Unfortunately, due to the lack of safe water sources in urban areas, the requirement to transport clean water to communities without public water supply and the increasing demand for packaged goods, plastic waste is here to stay. 

The Challenge Is: How Do We Reduce It's Impact?

Meaning "again" in the local KiSwahilli language, TENA Recycling is focussed on tackling the problem of plastic waste in Tanzania's urban areas and at the same time, empowering local people to recognise the value in discarded plastic items and build their own business unit around it.

In co-operation with international experts, the TENA team has developed an innovative solution that will allow us to effectively collect, sort and recycle plastic waste while generating economic opportunities for those people whose communities are most affected by it. 

Here's How:

TENA will provide a cash rebate for small scale collectors of waste plastics items who deliver to one of our drop points. This will encourage local people to collect plastic that is currently lying on the streets, clogging drains and being dumped and burned in landfill.

We are providing people with real rewards for bringing us plastic items. For individuals with limited economic opportunities it's the simplest business proposition in the world: collect something for free - sell it for money.

But that's not all…...

More Than Just Money:

Together with our partners, we have developed a software system that will allow us to do so much more than just give people cash for plastic. Each collector will have a personalised account, which can be accessed at the drop point. Upon depositing and weighing of materials, a computer system will pay them directly to their mobile phone via the hugely popular MPESA or Mobile Money system. Aside from allowing TENA staff to keep track of the performance of various drop points and providing information specific to the material being collected, these metrics will allow the easy identification of high performing collectors who can be provided with bonuses or even additional resources to help them expand their business. Similarly, collectors who are under-performing or whose volume and quality of material has dropped off can be provided with further training and support to maximise their chances of success. 

We Need Your Help To Continue:

TENA already have our first collection point open and are collecting plastic right now! But, we need your help to continue the good work.

The money we hope to raise from this campaign will go towards:

-Full installation of the software system and the required hardware at our pilot location in Arusha,

-Employment of 5 additional full-time staff to handle, sort and process collected plastic,

-Paying rebates to local collectors for up to 50 tons of recyclable plastic!

The money we raise from this campaign will allow us to continue our mission to clean up Tanzania's towns and cities and bring economic opportunity to hundreds of thousands of people.

A Focussed And Experienced Team.

The TENA team consists of individuals with real experience, living and working in East Africa. We are focused on cleaning up the city and the country we call home and improving the lives of millions both directly through our rewards program and indirectly by making their communities cleaner and more liveable.

Who are we:

Morgan Potter - CEO and Founder

Lyanga Shanaligigwa - Operations Manager


Other Ways You Can Help:

Spread The Word!

story:
Imker brauchen Deine Hilfe,

damit sie Bienen helfen können. In den vergangenen Jahren haben immer mehr Menschen begonnen, Bienen zu halten. Viele von ihnen möchten die Bienen beobachten und etwas Honig ernten, aber keine komplette Imkerei aufbauen. Denn dafür sind hohe Investitionen nötig. Besonders kostspielig ist der Kauf einer Honigschleuder und des Zubehörs.

Für eine hygienische Honigernte ist ein Schleuderraum optimal. Diesen kann man bisher in Frankfurt/Main nicht mieten. Das soll sich ändern.

Ein Schleuderraum für Frankfurter Imker entsteht.

Freundliche Menschen haben bereits einen geeigneten Raum zur Verfügung gestellt. Dieser wird in Eigenarbeit renoviert, um den Anforderungen der Lebensmittelverarbeitung zu genügen. Es fehlen jedoch noch die Geräte, um darin schleudern zu können. Die Honigschleuder und die weiteren Geräte sind teuer, da es sich um Spezialanfertigungen für eine kleine Nutzergruppe handelt.

Honig hingegen ist leider billig. Hinter einem Glas Honig aus einer Hobbyimkerei in Deutschland steckt Arbeit im Wert von 20 Euro – doch wer würde das bezahlen? Daher rentiert es sich für einen Hobbyimker nicht, die Geräte selbst anzuschaffen. Viele Anfänger der Imkerei ernten ihren Honig unter improvisierten Bedingungen. Das muss nicht sein. Mit 1.980 Euro lässt sich der vorhandene Raum in einen Schleuderraum umwandeln, den Frankfurter Imker gemeinsam nutzen können.

Was wird benötigt?

Honigsieb (30 €), Refraktometer zum Bestimmen des Wassergehalts im Honig (90 €), Entdeckelungsgeschirr (150 €), Entdeckelungsmesser (140 €), Siebkübel (170 €), Honigschleuder (1.400 €) = 1.980 Euro

Mehr Bienen, mehr Honig, mehr Bestäubung.

Wenn es eine günstige Schleudermöglichkeit gibt, entscheiden sich vielleicht noch mehr Frankfurter dazu, eigene Bienen zu halten. Jungimker können die Zahl ihrer Völker erhöhen, ohne eine teure eigene Schleuder zu kaufen.

Wir brauchen Bienen, nicht nur, um leckeren Honig zu ernten, sondern auch für die Bestäubung unserer Gemüse- und Obstpflanzen. Mehr Bienen für Frankfurt bedeutet mehr Ertrag in den Obstgärten und Gemüsepflanzungen – ein Nutzen, der allen zugute kommt.
