short-term 25% of the vulnerable population, to achieve medium and long-term 50%, as it is known to spread to vulnerable communities.Amir Salama Eng, M.Sc,ABT Ph.DOzomax inc                                                                                                                            600 Robitaille -QC-Shefford                                                                                                 Canada  J2M 1X2                                                                                                                    Tel: 450-378-6825                                                                                  Website: http://www.ozomax.com                                                                                          E-mail: engineering@ozomax.com                                                               http://www.ozomax.com/Municipal-water-treatment/municipal-water-treatment.htm                 -FRENCH VERSION-NOTRE VISIONNous sommes convaincus que l’éradication du Cholera passe obligatoirement par l’accessibilité de la population a une EAU traitte contre toute bacterie.NOTRE OBJECTIFIntroduire en Haiti la nouvelle technologie de traitement d'eau par l'ozone en vue de rendre l'eau traitée accessible a la population a un prix modique et parvenir a l'eradication du cholera.QUI SOMMES-NOUS?Nous sommes un groupe d'entrepreneurs sociaux de nationalité
Suisse, Américaine, Haïtienne. Nous avons monté en Haiti une compagnie de référence en traitement bactériologique de l'eau dans le but d'apporter une solution à la problématique de l'eau en Haiti et par voie de conséquence, l’éradication du cholera. L’Unité de traitement bactériologique (UTB)  vise  à  attaquer les 3 principaux vecteurs du vibro cholerea que sont: l'eau, les fruits et les légumes, à partir de 2 ressources naturelles: l'air et l’énergie solaire d'où la réaction chimique: (0 + 02 + E= 03) créant l'Ozone.                                   Pour atteindre cet objectif, nous avons mis en oeuvre le projet pilote émanant du programme d' éradication du cholera approuvé par le Ministère de la Sante Publique.La 1ere Unité de traitement bactériologique (UTB) sera installée à port-au-prince mais l’objectif final est d'avoir une UTB dans une trentaine de collectivités territoriales en commençant par les plus vulnérables et en impliquant les organisations et les autorités locales.Ce que nous avons,ce que nous recherchonsToute la structure physique existe déjà pour
l'installation de la 1ere UTB en Haiti. .Le coût total du projet est de $400.000; cependant, les membres fondateurs ont déjà contribué  à hauteur de $200.000; il ne manque que la structure technique  dont le coût des Equipements est évalué  à  $200.000.Votre contribution peut être en espèce ou en machinerie &  Equipements. N'hesitez pas à contacter notre fabricant et specialiste à l'adresse suivante:.:.Amir Salama Eng, M.Sc,ABT Ph.DOzomax inc                                                                                                                            600 Robitaille -QC-Shefford                                                                                                 Canada  J2M 1X2                                                                                                                    Tel: 450-378-6825                                                                                  Website: http://www.ozomax.com                                                                                          E-mail: engineering@ozomax.com                                                                http://www.ozomax.com/Municipal-water-treatment/municipal-water-treatment.htmAu cas ou l'on n'atteindrait pas le montant de $200.000, nous serions prêts  à solliciter un financement .auprès d' une institution de micro finance ou bancaire. Cependant, si le montant visé est supérieur, la différence sera orientée vers la mise en oeuvre de la 2eme Unité de traitement bactériologique (UTB)  à Petite Rivière de l'Artibonite, zone vulnérable qui a vu naître le virus du cholera et ainsi de suite.A tous ceux qui nous auront fait confiance et aidés à  l’Installation de la 1ere UTB en Haiti, nous  leur réservons des plaques d'honneur avec mention: {Plaque d'Honneur décernée   à Monsieur X ou Mme X pour sa contribution  à l'installation de la 1ere UTB en Haiti et son implication dans la lutte contre le fléau du cholera. Les philanthropes, les entrepreneurs sociaux, qui auront contribue de façon substantielle  à la mise en oeuvre de  l'UTB, pourront être les invités d'honneur à l'inauguration de la 1ere UTB en Haiti.L'IMPACT- L'installation de la 1ere Unité de Traitement Bactériologique aura un impact sur le bien être de la population vulnérable et permettra une diminution de 25% du taux de cholera dans l'aire Metropolitaine.Pour une appréciation de l'envergure et de l'importance de la 1ere UTB en Haiti , nous tenons a préciser: -SMG Global Haiti a remporté le Concours du meilleur "Business Plan 2013" organisé par USAID (document disponible) donc le ROI est garanti aussi bien que  l'aspect social car un pourcentage du profit sera utilise pour l'installation de la seconde UTB-Le Président du Conseil de SMG Global Haiti, de nationalité Suisse, a déjà expérimenté ces nouvelles technologies en Suisse et au Mexique. Il  à son actif une vingtaine             d'années d’expérience dans le domaine de l'eau dont une douzaine dans le traitement bactériologique de l'eau au Mexique, confronté lui aussi à la problématique de l'eau dans les années 2000.-L'UTB permettra à la population vulnérable d'avoir accès à l'eau traitée au moindre coût, tout en protégeant le marche et sa stabilité. Il n'existe en Haiti aucune structure offrant  le service spécifique de traitement des fruits et légumes considérés comme 2 principaux vecteurs du virio cholere après l'eau; ce qui fait de  l'UTB un projet  innovant et rentable.Une trentaine de  Municipalités en commençant par les plus vulnérables sont visées à  moyen et à long terme par le projet, d'ou son titre: Pilote; cependant, elles dépendent toutes de la 1ere UTB  celle qui va conscientiser les acteurs des secteurs  Eau, Environnement, Santé. SMG compte faire de la première UTB un "Succès AIDER DIFFEREMMENTLes personnes dotées d'une certaine sensibilité sociale qui appuient le projet mais qui sont dans l’incapacité  de contribuer financièrement son invitées  à le promouvoir dans des cercles d'amis .en utilisant les outils de partage Indiegogo.Merci d'avoir pris connaissance de notre noble projet qui aura un impact à court terme sur 25% de la population vulnérable, pour atteindre à  moyen et long terme  50%, car il est appelé à s’étendre aux collectivités vulnérables. Blessings!Visit the Manufacturer Website to see the Ozone Water Treatment system http://www.ozomax.com/what-is-ozone.html                                         http://www.ozomax.com/Industrial-products/industrial-products-overview.htmlPlease
direct your questions to: mblherisson@smgglobalhaiti.com and the technical should be addressed to the manufacturer and supplier: engineering@ozomax.com                                                    CETTE PÉTITIONEST UN MOYEN D'ACTION, UN LEVIER ET UNE ESPÉRANCE        PETITION                                       

        



Alain Boinet, Directeur Général et Fondateur deSOLIDARITÉS INTERNATIONAL
Enfin reconnaître l'eau insalubre comme première cause de mortalité dans le monde(1).3,6 millions de personnes meurent chaque année de causes liées à l'eau insalubre (diarrhée, choléra, typhoïde, hépatite...). Il est urgent de lutter contre ce fléau plus efficacement.Revoir sérieusement les chiffres de référence cités par les Nations Unies.Les Nations Unies font indéniablement progresser l'accès à l'eau dans le monde. Mais leur évaluation selon laquelle 783 millions d'êtres humains n'auraient pas accès à l'eau potable n'est pas juste. Selon des études sérieuses, ils sont en fait près de 3,5 milliards à boire chaque jour de l'eau dangereuse ou de qualité douteuse. L'ONU doit revoir ses modes de calcul et sa communication à ce sujet.Faire de l'accès à l'eau, à l'hygiène et à l'assainissement une priorité à part entière des Objectifs de Développement du Millénaire (OMD) des Nations Unies pour la période 2015-2030.Ils ne constituent aujourd'hui qu'une cible secondaire (cible C) de l'objectif 7 dédié à l'environnement, alors qu'il s'agit d'une question de vie ou de mort pour des millions d'êtres humains. C'est donc une priorité majeure qui doit à l'avenir constituer un objectif à part entière.Augmenter significativement les fonds de l'Aide Publique au Développement (APD) affectés à l'accès à l'eau potable, à l'assainissement et à l'hygiène.Ces fonds doivent plus que doubler. L'effort de la communauté internationale a été de 7,4 milliards de dollars en 2008, dont 3,5 en prêts et 3,9 en dons, là où il en faudrait au moins 18 selon l'Organisation Mondiale de la Santé (OMS). 5ème contributeur dans le monde, la France a fortement augmenté sa contribution ces dernières années, avec un montant de 600 millions d'euros. Mais 95 % de ce budget est affecté sous forme de prêts à des pays émergents solvables. Nous proposons de consacrer au moins 15 % de ces 600 millions d'euros à des dons pour des situations d'urgence humanitaire pour sauver des vies.Accroître les fonds dédiés aux crises humanitairesApporter rapidement l'eau potable et l'assainissement aux populations menacées par les maladies liées à l'eau (diarrhée, choléra, typhoïde...) est une priorité absolue en cas de conflit, de catastrophe naturelle et de déplacement de populations.Coordonner effectivement les institutions responsables pour organiser efficacement la transition des phases d'urgence vers les phases de reconstruction puis de développement.Dans les situations de crise, nous pouvons témoigner que le lien entre les phases d'urgence, de reconstruction et de développement fait défaut parmi les institutions financières responsables qui doivent se coordonner pour mieux secourir les populations en danger avec leurs partenaires (ONG, agences…).Créer un mécanisme international d'information fiable et à jour.Cet outil devrait indiquer l'état et la répartition des besoins, les engagements internationaux pris et les actions réalisées, et présenter le suivi des objectifs à atteindre dans un rapport public régulier sur internet.Faire que le droit humain à l'eau potable voté par les Nations Unies devienne une réalité.Les propositions de notre pétition ont pour objectif d'accélérer la réalisation effective du droit humain à l'eau voté par les Nations Unies le 28 juillet 2010.(1) Les maladies cardio-vasculaires, qui provoquent plus de victimes, sont liées à l'âge. Les maladies hydriques affectent une majorité d'enfants de par le monde               


2013 ANNÉE INTERNATIONALE DE LA COOPÉRATION DANS LE DOMAINE DE L'EAU2005 SOLIDARITÉS INTERNATIONALdécide de porter soncombat contre la 1° causede mortalité au mondeauprès des institutionsinternationales et dugrand public.2008 SOLIDARITÉS INTERNATIONALremet sa pétition lancéeen 2007 et signée par50 000 personnes, àBernard Kouchner, ministredes Affaires étrangèreseuropéennes.2010 LesNationsUniesreconnaissentl'accès à l'eau potableet à l'assainissementcomme un droit del'Homme.2012 SOLIDARITÉSINTERNATIONALremet sa pétition auministre de la CoopérationHenri de Raincourt, en ouverturedu Forum Mondial de l'Eau enmars 2012, devant 142 délégationsministérielles du monde entier.103 888 personnes sontengagées à noscôtés.2013-2015  Parce que les objectifs du développement du millénaire (OMD) relatifs à l'eau sont bien loin.

story:
Kai's Story

In 2009, at the age of 15, I stood on the roof of Africa, with freezing toes and very little air in my lungs. I had caught the climbing bug. Summiting Mt. Kilimanjaro was a huge milestone for me. It had been years in the making and after being diagnosed with Slumber Epilepsy at 9 years old, was a giant breakthrough for my self-esteem. I had low motivation and low self-confidence, and needed a goal to work towards. Inspired by a book about Kilimanjaro I realised that to conquer that mountain was to conquer my personal mountains. 

Having epilepsy really made me grow up quickly. I became a lot more conscious of the world around me and environmental awareness was something I just fell into. It began by simply helping with beach and trail clean ups but has now morphed into something much bigger than that. Now I am focusing on showing youth about Making Mountains Metaphors in their own lives. I will also be targeting necessary environmental awareness issues through interactions with the youth of Africa. I have managed to turn my obstacles into true potential and have been able to use this as a tool to inspire those who feel inadequate due to their own perceived disability, whatever it may be.

So, I decide that I need to act with these principals in mind. So, I developed Kape2Kenya, an Eco-empowerment project which combines my love for mountains and my desire to share my awareness about environmental sustainability with others.

 

The Trip

Setting-off on the 15th of April, 2012, a 4 month expedition from Cape Town, South Africa to Africa's second highest peak at the top of Mt. Kenya, will begin. Spanning nearly 14,000 kilometres and across 6 nations (and back), and doing it all by PUBLIC transport and other sustainable means.

Along the way, we will stop off at local schools to share our knowledge of sustainable living and empower the youth of Africa to shape the future of our global environment. We will work together to develop new ways of thinking about sustainability in Africa and spread awareness of key environmental issues. The program will cover 2-3 days at each school. Being, as interactive with the students as possible.

Finally, the team will end up at the base of Mt. Kenya, preparing for the summit at 5199m above sea level! The climb is sponsored by Capestorm and will raise awareness and funds for Epilepsy South Africa.

 

The Impact

Sustainable Transport

K2K is dedicated to the environment. We want to make a difference in our world by promoting and spreading awareness for sustainable transport. Because of this, the entire expedition will be undertaken using only sustainable modes of transport. My climbing partner, Jonathan Joseph and I will travel overland to Kenya, using only buses, trains and taxis, and where necessary by bicycle or by foot.

School Visits

It is my hope to share some great ideas about sustainability and environmental awareness with other young people in Africa. So, well be stopping at schools to share our experiences and ideas with students there. The ultimate goal is to create awareness and understanding as well as finding solutions for issues in and around the schools and communities. Read more 

Climbing Mt. Kenya

I am hoping to use this expedition as a platform for my long-term goal to be one of the only, if not the first, person to climb all of the Seven 2nd Summits. Ironically the second highest peak on each continent is generally more technical and challenging, and more overlooked than its slightly bigger brother or sister. This is just another instance of Making Mountains Metaphors.

By the end of the expedition, we hope to inspire, share and empower the youth of Africa to take the health of our planet into their own hands. It is up to us, the next generation, to be the makers of our planet's future. We have the technologies and we have the need. Now, we just need to work together to re-shape our environment, take care of our oceans, mountains, wild spaces, wildlife and each other.

Read More About Our Mission 

 

What We Need From You 

We have already secured endorsements and sponsorships from several companies and organisations including: CAPESTORM technical apparel and Goal 0 (including solar chargers for 50% retail cost).  

However, we still need to raise additional funds to support the team on the road. Costs will include food, travel (including any visas and permits) and accommodation. As we are travelling using only sustanable transport, we don't need much. We are only looking to raise $5000 so that we can support 2 - 4 team members while still catering to the needs of the schools and students that we will be visiting with. 

Remember that you can support our awesome partners at Greenpop while supporting us. Donate $50 and claim the perk above and Greenpop will plant a tree in your name on their upcoming mission to plant 5 - 10,000 trees in Southern Zambia, Africa's hardest hit region when it comes to deforestation. http://www.greenpop.org/projects/trees-for-zambia/  

Please contribute what you can here, or contact us through our website www.kape2kenya.com for ways that we can partner in Making Mountains Metaphors!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow us as we go and spread the word of our expedition to others through facebook, twitter, or any other means available. We need all the support that we can get. 

 

THANK YOU!!!

story:
HELP SAVE SHARKS IN CANADA

The UC community helped make history in Toronto by passing a ban on the sale and possession of shark fin in Canada's largest city! Councillors voted 38-4 in favor of the ban and spoke passionately about the need to take shark conservation efforts to the federal level. 

AND THAT IS JUST WHAT WE WILL DO!

We are working with Members of Parliament to help raise awareness, and once the bill is introduced we will be launching Fin Free Canada - with a federal petition to support the ban as well as tools and resources to take action in your own community! 


YOU CAN HELP SAVE SHARKS NOW!
#1 - Educate yourself, watch Sharkwater, read up on shark conservation issues worldwide 
#2 - Join the UC Mailing list for updates on campaigns as they happen!
#3 - Donate to UC now and support the campaign to make Canada Fin Free

Help take the Fin Free movement across Canada! Your contribution helps provide the tools and resources we need to empower communities across Canada to initiate their own local campaigns. 


NEW PERKS!

$5 helps spread the message of conservation! UC will send a tweet, post or email to support pending shark fin legislation in Canada. 


$15 donates a DVD to a school in Canada to help educate kids about sharks! Help us raise awareness and engage students in conservation. 


 

The Fin Free movement has ignited faster and bigger than we could have hoped for. The passion and commitment of this community of conservationists is helping to make REAL CHANGE HAPPEN to protect sharks in Canada. With your help, we can bring the Fin Free campaign globally!

 


Join UC today! Help save the ecosystems we depend on

 

United Conservationists (UC) is a revolutionary new NGO nine years and 30 countries in the making. What started out as a mission to save sharks hurdled our tiny team into the biggest battle ever fought – saving humanity from the converging environmental crises of the 21st century.

 

In 2007 we released Sharkwater, which changed government policy, spawned conservation groups, and united a movement to protect sharks. For nine years we’ve been saving sharks with the help of supporters and volunteers, working out of a garage in downtown Toronto. But now the problem is much bigger than sharks and we need the resources to affect change on a greater scale.

 

By mid-century scientists predict the end of fisheries, coral reefs and rainforests, and half the world’s population will lack sufficient food and water. This is the biggest issue we’ve ever faced, and we need your help to tackle it.

 

To change the world in the most profound way possible, we’ve united a dream team of conservationists to launch the most revolutionary and powerful NGO imaginable. UC has a proven strategy – educate the public about the issues and give them the blueprint for change. It’s worked for sharks and it can work again, if we work together.

 

UC is seeking funding to build the movement to save the ecosystems we depend on for survival, and ultimately humanity. This issue is too big to tackle from a garage…. We need your help.

 

In 2011, United Conservationists are:

 

-        Working with Ecovision Asia to distribute 10,000 Sharkwater DVDs to schools in China

-        Releasing Sharkwater on public TV in China (targeting 220 million people)

-        Spearheading the Fin Free Toronto campaign to ban shark fins in Toronto, Ontario and across Canada

-        Releasing "Revolution", Rob Stewart’s new feature film about saving humanity from our environmental crisis. The release features accompanying study guides, the book “How-to Guide to Save Humanity”, free online distribution of the film, and school curriculum inserts.

-        Releasing “Revolution Mobile” – a mobile application that puts democracy in your hand, counting down the votes necessary to influence government policy susceptible to public opinion – changing the world in real time.

 

Your contributions are vital to taking our organization to the next level, and creating the resources to unite everyone as a conservationist. We aren’t just fundraising, we are building a community! UC has achieved a great amount of good with very little so far. Now we need to change the world in a huge way, and we need your financial support to do so. Our kids and our future depend on it.

 

Join United Conservationists and be a part of a revolutionary movement for conservation. 

 


WHAT YOU GET!

Not only will you receive our heart-felt gratitude and some amazing perks, you get to be a part of something bigger than all of us – a change in humanity. You’ll be a founder of an innovative conservation movement to unite everyone as a force for change.

 

Contributions of $50 or more reward you with a UC membership, giving you access to exclusive limited edition UC swag, screenings, and UC events worldwide. Reward your school with a membership to Team UC for access to special screenings, outreach tool kits and exclusive Team UC gear.

 

Take advantage of our one-of-a-kind perks including dinner with Rob Stewart, Revolution red carpet premiere passes, a wilderness canoe trip or exotic diving adventure! Join us, as we use the power of film, media and social innovation to rally together, save ecosystems and create solutions for the future.



HOW YOU CAN HELP

*  Give what you can. Become a founding member of UC.

*  Give UC memberships or donations to loved ones

*  Donate your birthday! Tell your friends and family that instead of presents this year 

   you’d like support for UC on your behalf. Your future matters.

*  Get noisy. Send this campaign to your friends and networks. 

   Post it, tweet it, blog about it.

*  Inspire others. Hold your own personal fundraising drive.

   Invite them to be a founding member of UC, just like you!


Visit www.UnitedConservationists.org and learn more about our campaigns and how you can protect ecosystems. We are growing fast and changing quickly - so be sure to check in frequently. 


Join us, be a United Conservationist!



THE SMALL PRINT: The film "Revolution' will be distributed to supporters once it has been released commercially on DVD or digital download. For perks that include your name in the film credits, names must be submitted by NOVEMBER 15th, 2011 to ensure inclusion in the film (names submitted after that date are not guaranteed at this time). The "Win a day with Rob" draw for Team UC membership perk requires 100 entries to cover all expenses for the trip. If less than 100 entries are received, the event may be amended to a video conference depending on the winning Team's location. Dinner prizes will be rewarded within 1 year of campaign finish. 

ALL UC MEMBERSHIP PACKAGES AND WEBSITE UPDATES WILL BE FULFILLED AFTER THE CAMPAIGN IS FINISHED. As a start-up organization we need to know how many stickers, badges etc to produce as to not waste resources or risk being short on fulfillment. Thank you for your support and patience! If you have any questions please email us at info[at]unitedconservationists.org
story_txt:
HELP SAVE SHARKS IN CANADA

The UC community helped make history in Toronto by passing a ban on the sale and possession of shark fin in Canada's largest city! Councillors voted 38-4 in favor of the ban and spoke passionately about the need to take shark conservation efforts to the federal level. 

AND THAT IS JUST WHAT WE WILL DO!

We are working with Members of Parliament to help raise awareness, and once the bill is introduced we will be launching Fin Free Canada - with a federal petition to support the ban as well as tools and resources to take action in your own community! 


YOU CAN HELP SAVE SHARKS NOW!
#1 - Educate yourself, watch Sharkwater, read up on shark conservation issues worldwide 
#2 - Join the UC Mailing list for updates on campaigns as they happen!
#3 - Donate to UC now and support the campaign to make Canada Fin Free

Help take the Fin Free movement across Canada! Your contribution helps provide the tools and resources we need to empower communities across Canada to initiate their own local campaigns. 


NEW PERKS!
$5 helps spread the message of conservation! UC will send a tweet, post or email to support pending shark fin legislation in Canada. 

$15 donates a DVD to a school in Canada to help educate kids about sharks! Help us raise awareness and engage students in conservation. 

 
The Fin Free movement has ignited faster and bigger than we could have hoped for. The passion and commitment of this community of conservationists is helping to make REAL CHANGE HAPPEN to protect sharks in Canada. With your help, we can bring the Fin Free campaign globally!
 

Join UC today! Help save the ecosystems we depend on
 
United Conservationists (UC) is a revolutionary new NGO nine years and 30 countries in the making. What
started out as a mission to save sharks hurdled our tiny team into the biggest
battle ever fought – saving humanity from the converging environmental crises
of the 21st century. 
 
In 2007 we released Sharkwater, which
changed government policy, spawned conservation groups, and united a movement
to protect sharks. For nine years we’ve been saving sharks with the help of supporters
and volunteers, working out of a garage in downtown Toronto. But now the
problem is much bigger than sharks and we need the resources to affect change
on a greater scale.
 
By mid-century
scientists predict the end of fisheries, coral reefs and rainforests, and half
the world’s population will lack sufficient food and water. This is the biggest
issue we’ve ever faced, and we need your help to tackle it. 
 
To change the world
in the most profound way possible, we’ve united a dream team of
conservationists to launch the most revolutionary and powerful NGO imaginable.
UC has a proven strategy – educate the public about the issues and give them
the blueprint for change. It’s worked for sharks and it can
work again, if we work together. 
 
UC is seeking funding
to build the movement to save the ecosystems we depend on for survival, and
ultimately humanity. This issue is too big to tackle from a garage…. We need
your help. 
 
In 2011, United Conservationists
are:
 
-       
Working
with Ecovision Asia to distribute 10,000 Sharkwater DVDs to schools in China
-       
Releasing Sharkwater on public TV in China (targeting
220 million people)
-       
Spearheading
the Fin Free Toronto campaign to ban shark fins in Toronto, Ontario and across
Canada
-       
Releasing "Revolution", Rob Stewart’s new
feature film about saving humanity from our environmental crisis. The release
features accompanying study guides, the book “How-to Guide to Save Humanity”,
free online distribution of the film, and school curriculum inserts. 
-       
Releasing
“Revolution Mobile” – a mobile application that puts democracy in your hand, counting
down the votes necessary to influence government policy susceptible to public
opinion – changing the world in real time.
 
Your
contributions are vital to taking our organization to the next level, and
creating the resources to unite everyone as a conservationist. We aren’t just
fundraising, we are building a community! UC has achieved a great amount of
good with very little so far. Now we need to change the world in a huge way, and
we need your financial support to do so. Our kids and our future depend on it. 
 
Join United Conservationists and be a part of a revolutionary movement for conservation. 
 



WHAT YOU GET!



Not only will you
receive our heart-felt gratitude and some amazing perks, you get to be a part
of something bigger than all of us – a change in humanity. You’ll be a founder
of an innovative conservation movement to unite everyone as a force for change.

 
Contributions of $50
or more reward you with a UC membership, giving you access to exclusive limited
edition UC swag, screenings, and UC events worldwide. Reward your school with a
membership to Team UC for access to
special screenings, outreach tool kits and exclusive Team UC gear.
 
Take advantage of our one-of-a-kind
perks including dinner with Rob Stewart, Revolution
red carpet premiere passes, a wilderness canoe trip or exotic diving
adventure! Join us, as we use the power of film, media and social innovation
to rally together, save ecosystems and create solutions for the future.






HOW YOU CAN HELP

*  Give what you can. Become
a founding member of UC.
* 
Give UC memberships or donations to loved ones
* 
Donate your birthday! Tell your friends and family that instead of
presents this year 
   you’d like support for UC on your behalf. Your future
matters.
*  Get noisy. Send this
campaign to your friends and networks. 
   Post it, tweet it, blog
about it.
*  Inspire others. Hold your
own personal fundraising drive.
   Invite them to be a
founding member of UC, just like you!




Visit www.UnitedConservationists.org and learn
more about our campaigns and how you can protect ecosystems. We are growing
fast and changing quickly - so be sure to check in frequently. Join us, be
a United Conservationist!





THE SMALL PRINT: The film "Revolution' will be distributed to supporters once it has been released commercially on DVD or digital download. For perks that include your name in the film credits, names must be submitted by NOVEMBER 15th, 2011 to ensure inclusion in the film (names submitted after that date are not guaranteed at this time). The "Win a day with Rob" draw for Team UC membership perk requires 100 entries to cover all expenses for the trip. If less than 100 entries are received, the event may be amended to a video conference depending on the winning Team's location. Dinner prizes will be rewarded within 1 year of campaign finish. 


ALL UC MEMBERSHIP PACKAGES AND WEBSITE UPDATES WILL BE FULFILLED AFTER THE CAMPAIGN IS FINISHED. As a start-up organization we need to know how many stickers, badges etc to produce as to not waste resources or risk being short on fulfillment. Thank you for your support and patience! If you have any questions please email us at info[at]unitedconservationists.org

story:
Support Houston Honeybees! 

Hi! Thank you for visiting our Indiegogo campaign. We're launching Bee2Bee Honey Collective this spring and need your help. 

Bee2Bee Honey Collective's mission: to provide a healthy, sustainable habitat for honeybees and promote urban beekeeping and education. We are doing this two ways: 

  • Launching beekeeping services in Houston. A beekeeping service is where a beekeeper installs and maintains the beehives on your property, whether that is residential, commercial or farm property. Similar to a landscaper or swimming pool service, the beekeeper visits the beehives regularly and inspects and treats the hive accordingly. Most larger cities have businesses providing beekeeping services; Houston does not. Let's start one! 
  • Launching a website wherein Houston beekeepers (including those receiving the beekeeping service) can sell their honey online. Buying local honey is a great way to support  honeybees! 


Our goal is to place beehives in backyards, rooftops and on businesses throughout Houston metro area.


Who We Are & Why We Will Be Successful 

My name is Nicole Buergers. I was a seasoned yet burnt-out B2B internet marketer, who decided to leave my agency job and do something completely different with my life. I want to make a difference. I launched Bee2Bee to encourage "newbee" wannabeekeepers as well as provide online retail and marketing services for the established hobbyist beekeeper.



I have also been a cheesemonger at the Houston Dairymaids for the past five years (and will continue to be!). I have learned a lot about the wholesale and retail food business and have established a vast network of local restaurants and patrons.
Finally, I have a passion for the environment and for Houston. I grew up in Kingwood, live in Montrose and love this city. I'd like to make Houston an even better place and help our local honeybee population thrive.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for $20,000 to get this business buzzing! Your contributions will go toward: 

  • Beehives: the hive boxes, beeyard materials and more
  • Bee packages: we are purchasing bees from a nearby apiary
  • Supplies: beesuits, gloves, smokers, jars, labels, wholesale honey, etc
  • Operational costs: website, videographer, insurance, legal, etc

Perks!
We have curated some awesome perks for your help! Local honey, bee merchandise, experiences and more. Plus, you can get early-adopter discounted pricing on beekeeping services! 
We have partnered on perks with:
  • Houston Makerspace
  • Avenue Screen Printing
  • Sown & Grown
  • Houston Dairymaids
  • Lomi Coffee
Tee-shirts and tanks reppin' Houston honey:

The image in the back says:


You can wear the taste of Houston around your neck with this vial of honey on a 18' sterling silver chain (perk: Bee2Bee Jewelry)

Seedlings from Farmer Becca of Sown & Grown:


Cool *new* perk: Bee Art by Amber Chiozza
These are 10"x10" hand colored, limited edition etchings printed on paper. These lovely pieces are framed and ready to hang. 


The Impact

You would not only be making an impact toward Houston bees you would also:

  • Growing Houston's urban agriculture and improving neighborhoods
  • Increasing honeybee awareness and education
  • Basically saving humanity


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to help financially but understand that bees are essential to both our economy and survival:

  • Please tell everyone you've ever met about this campaign
  • SHARE SHARE SHARE - there are great tools via Indiegogo
  • Plant bee-friendly flowers, herbs and trees
  • Talk to us - we would love to discuss your questions! 

Thank you!
Nicole Buergers
Bee2Bee Honey Collective, LLC

story:
Earthship Biotecture plans to build an off-grid, self-sustained home for a family living on Six Nations of the Grand River Territory, in the summer of 2016.   I have been organizing this project for almost 3 years, and we have finally set a building date.  We will break ground July 18th 2016, and I have personally pledged to raise $5000.  Please help me meet this goal.

The Haudenosaunee family faces a housing crisis, and the countless obstacles which make getting a housing loan next to impossible for people who live far below the poverty line.

The family is in desperate need of a healthier and more cost effective shelter, as they have been living in a condemned trailer for years. The trailer has several holes where you can see straight through to the outside, a rodent infestation, mold, old brass pipes that get clogged constantly, next to no insulation, and a leaking roof. The owner does not think it will make it through the winter. She supports her daughter, who is a single mother, and 5 grandchildren, aged 1, 5, 9, 12 and 16. 

She will be welcoming all peoples to watch, participate and learn from this building process. She looks forward to being a part of showing that it takes grassroots people power to address the housing and energy crisis.

The new off grid home will be built using Architect, Michael Reynold's, Earthship design.  The Earthship Home features:

?- Thermal & Solar Heating and Cooling?- Solar & Wind Electricity

?- Contained Sewage Treatment?- Building with Natural & Recycled Materials?

- Water Harvesting

?- Internal Food Production?? 

During the building process, we will host a free Sustainable Building Workshop for members of Six Nations interested in construction skill development. Our hope is to provide members of the community - especially youth-  with the skills needed to replicate the building, and an opportunity to develop a local sustainable building crew.?? Through fundraising and public outreach, it is our hope that we will generate enough interest and financial support during this project, that we may continue to build and teach in other Indigenous communities throughout Canada.?? 

Primary Goals:??

- to prove that sustainable and affordable methods of housing exist.??

- to prove that with organization and skill development, communities can provide this housing for themselves with locally sourced labour and materials, through hands-on education and training.??

- to engage a community in an environmentally conscious project, to enhance community knowledge and understanding of sustainability concepts.??

- to provide a family with economic independence from fluctuating energy and water costs.??

- to offer a positive, and practical solution to a country wide housing and environmental crisis.

We need to raise $20,000 more for this project through donations and sponsorships.  Please consider making any contribution you can.

http://www.biotectureplanetearth.com/projects/6nations-canada

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this story with your contacts and through social media
  • Visit our website for updates and volunteer opportunities 
http://www.biotectureplanetearth.com/projects/6...
Check out the article in The Globe and Mail
http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/national/ec...

story:
The Whaleman Foundation, aka "Whaleman" (www.whaleman.org), is an internationally recognized oceanic non-profit research, conservation, and production organization dedicated to protecting dolphins, whales, and our oceans. We are accomplishing this through our films, research, PSAs, campaigns, and media outreach.

Whaleman was founded in 1995 by whale researcher and international award-winning marine life filmmaker and photographer Jeff Pantukhoff. Joining us on our quest are some of the world's leading image-makers including actors Pierce Brosnan, Hayden Panettiere, and Isabel Lucas.

Since its inception, Whaleman has presented films to the United Nations, Congress, and the International Whaling Commission. In addition, our film footage and photographs have been featured worldwide in hundreds of news stories worldwide airing on CNN, ABC, CBS, NBC, PBS, the BBC, Reuters, and others.

For the last 20 years, our 1981 twin engine research and conservation vessel Cetacean has served us well and provided a platform for our dolphin and whale research and conservation projects and helped us to produce our award-winning conservation films including "Deadly Sounds in the Silent World", "Orcas in Crisis", and the "Makah Indian Gray Whale Hunt".

But unfortunately over the last several years it has become increasingly difficult to keep Cetacean running due to a succession of costly repairs and now she is over 33 years old and her engines and out-drives have been discontinued and they need to be replaced.

To replace both engines and drives would cost over $50,000 USD and it does not make sense to invest that kind of money into a 33 year old boat so we need to replace Cetacean with a later model used twin engine boat so that we can continue with our ongoing research, conservation, and production projects. 

To replace Cetacean  it will cost around $40,000 - $50,000 and we already have about half of that and we've found our replacement boat so we are launching this crowd funding campaign with Indiegogo to raise the rest. Our goal is $25,000 USD.

Given the international appeal of our work and our proven track record over the past 20 years, our goal seems attainable and our newer Cetacean should serve us well over the next 20 years!

We deeply appreciate any and all support that comes our way and hope the perks we've offered for your generosity bring you some pleasure in return. Please write to us at whaleman@maui.net if you would like to join our campaign team or have any questions and please keep in mind, whether you can contribute or not, we hope you will pass news of our campaign on to your circle of contacts via social media, email, or the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Haga click AQUí para versión en Español (Disponible abajo)

Weaving Regenerative Solutions:

The most influential Permaculture event in the continent needs your support , help us by donating and sharing this cross-cultural educational initiative. With your help , we will grant 68 full scholarships to outstanding designers of sustainable habitats from 34 countries throughout Latin America and the Caribbean. 

This convergence is a key sociocultural effort to rise the collective awareness of regenerative solutions. Join us to build up community while moving towards a more sustainable lifestyle, that encourages wellbeing practices in all diferent daily life aspects: economic, social , environmental and cultural.

What is permaculture ?

Permaculture is a design system that aims to create sustainable, environmentally sound and economically viable human habitats. Habitats capable of producing enough to meet their needs, without exploiting resources or polluting. and rather regenerating for the long term. 

Approach

As a growing community we dream to have a representation of two people from each country through Latin America and the Caribbean. The main goal is to bring the voice of diversity among the participants' local movement to weave council around these life styles and their practical tools, methods and techniques of regenerative design.

This is a huge chance to approach the diversity of the continent and strengthen national networks that will replicate the innovations and developments shared at the Convergence.

What we need and what you get

  • The money raised will be used to cover 100 % of the registration fees of 64  Latin Americans  of 32 countries that already have manifested their intention to travel to Colombia and participate in the Latin American Permaculture Convergence.
  • In case of having surplus we will support the transportation to the people who have lesser opportunities.
  • CASA network  ( Council of sustainable settlements of the Americas) offers as a reward the possibility to come and spend time learning permacultural tools and techniques at several countries of the continent ! Learn and join us in this beautiful work!

The impact

The risk is not being resilient, learning to change and live better through understanding that we are a human family that breathes with Mother Earth.Our challenge is to see change, in our daily lives, in the enjoyable time of being here and now, doing something that helps us to live in peace-happiness with the Earth, its cycles, the people, and ourselves.Make a donation so those who work tirelessly for the welfare of all beings on the planet, continue their example in different countries and communities, processes which promote:

  • care for free seeds, and clean ecological agriculture
  • conscious and healthy food from the territory, seasonal, organic and obtained through fair trade
  • the use of tools for the development of the full human potential
  • the use of alternative energy and construction methods that reduce the negative impact of our footprint in the world.
  • experimenting new forms of dynamic government in our communities and cities
  • children's education and adult re-education in the principles of abundance, confidence, transparent communication and the ability to be co-creators of the world
  • rediscovering the value of ancestral methods of exchanging goods and services, in which value is more important than the price
  • the establishment of collaborative networks to share knowledge

Meet the Latin American Permaculture Convergence, CLAP 2015

It is a space for weaving the network of people, organizations and networks of permaculture in Latin America. A platform to create synergies, to strengthen the initiatives either private, communitary ,local, national and continental. A space for the expansion of permaculture at a continental level and a preparation of the progress made as a Latin America delegation at the International Permaculture Convergence in the UK - UK CPI in September 2015. 
We are also inviting to participate people who want to link in with the movement. CLAP aims to congregate people linked with permaculture, that have embraced this tool for the design of their stainability in their territories and projects.
CLAP 2015 is organized by:

         

Complementary event ECCO

For further networking strengthening, we will carry out the Continental Meeting of CASA (Council of Sustainable Settlements of the Americas ) in Aldeafeliz ecovillage at San Francisco, Cundinamarca, Colombia. ECCO will echo through the wills in action intended to take part politically by offering the knowledge recovered  across permaculture networks and in intentional communities seeking sustainability and harmonious coexistence of humanity at their territories.


Español

El evento de Permacultura más grande del continente necesita tu apoyo, ayúdanos con tu donación a lograr que cada vez más personas aprendan y multipliquen, por toda américa latina y el caribe, soluciones alternativas para avanzar hacia un estilo de vida más sostenible, regenerativo y satisfactorio, en todos los aspectos económicos, sociales, ambientales y culturales.
Con tu ayuda, vamos a otorgar 68 becas completas para este evento a destacad@s diseñadores de hábitats sustentables de 34 países del continente americano. Queremos tener como mínimo dos personas provenientes de cada país de Latinoamérica y el Caribe, que traiga la voz del movimiento local en torno a  estas formas de vida y sus herramientas llevándose consigo la cosecha de este maravilloso encuentro!!

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

  • El dinero recaudado se usará para cubrir el 100% de los gastos de inscripción de los latinoamericanos que se desplacen a Colombia para participar en la Convergencia Latinoamericana de Permacultura. 32 Países han manifestado su intención de hacerse presentes! 64 personas que encierran la diversidad de este continente y fortalecerán las redes nacionales replicando las innovaciones y desarrollos compartidos en la Convergencia. 
  • En caso de contar con excedentes aportaremos a los medios de transporte de las mismas personas que cuenten con menos posibilidades.
  • La Red de C.A.S.A te ofrece como recompensa la posibilidad de que vengas a compartir tiempo de aprendizaje en técnicas y herramientas de la Permacultura en varios países del Continente! Aprende y acompáñanos en esta hermosa labor! 

El impacto

El riesgo es no ser resilientes, aprender a cambiar, aprendiendo a vivir mejor comprendiendo que somos una familia humana que respira con la Tierra.

Nuestro desafío es ver el cambio, en nuestra cotidianidad, en el tiempo disfrutable de estar aquí y ahora haciendo algo que nos ayuda a vivir en alegre-paz con la Tierra, sus ciclos, sus seres, y nosotros mismos.

Haz tu donación para que aquellos que trabajan incansablemente por el bienestar de todos los seres del planeta, sigan liderando en sus diferentes países y comunidades procesos que promuevan:

  • el cuidado de las semillas libres, la agricultura ecologica y limpia.
  • la alimentación consciente y saludable, de lo que da el territorio, de temporada, orgánico y obtenido en comercio justo.
  • el uso de herramientas para el desarrollo del pleno potencial humano
  • el uso de energías alternativas y formas de construcción que reducen el impacto negativo de nuestro habitar en el mundo.
  • la experimentación nuevas formas de gobierno dinámico en nuestras comunidades y ciudades
  • la educación de los niños y la re-educación de los adultos en los principios de la abundancia, la confianza, la comunicación transparente y la capacidad de ser co-creadores del mundo
  • el redescubrimiento del valor de las formas ancestrales de intercambio de productos y servicios, en los que importa el valor y más que el precio
  • el establecimiento de redes colaborativas para compartir conocimiento
 

Conoce la Convergencia Latinoamericana de Permacultura, CLAP 2.015

Es un espacio para el tejido en red de personas, organizaciones y redes de permacultura de América latina. Una plataforma para la creación de sinergias, para el fortalecimiento de las iniciativas privadas, comunitarias, locales, nacionales y continentales. Un espacio para la expansión de la permacultura a nivel continental y para preparar los avances que como América Latina llevaremos a la Convergencia Internacional de Permacultura en el Reino Unido IPC- UK en septiembre del 2015. https://www.permaculture.org.uk/IPCUK.

Tambien están invitados a participar personas que desean vincularse con el movimiento. El CLAP busca congregar a las personas ya vinculadas con la permacultura y que han acogido esta herramienta para el diseño de la sustentabilidad en sus territorios y proyectos.

Organizadores de la CLAP 2015:

         

                 

Evento complementario ECCO

Para fortalecer aún más el trabajo en Red, realizaremos el Encuentro Continental de C.A.S.A. (Consejo de Asentamientos Sustentables de las Américas) en la EcoAldea Aldeafeliz en San Francisco, Cundinamarca. El ECCO hará resonar las voluntades de acción que pretenden hacer incidencia política al ofrecer los conocimientos recuperados en las redes de Permaculturas y en las comunidades intencionales que buscan la sustentabilidad y la convivencia armónica de la humanidad en sus territorios.


¿Qué es la permacultura?

La Permacultura es un sistema de diseño que busca la creación de asentamientos humanos sostenibles, ecológicamente sanos y viables en materia económica. Asentamientos capaces de producir para satisfacer sus necesidades, sin explotar recursos o contaminar, es decir, sostenibles a largo plazo.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

  •  Genera  ECCO !!! Ayúdanos a dar esta campaña a conocer, compártela!

Comparte tu talento, SUMA tu aporte!!!... Cuál es tu CLAP?
story_txt:
Haga click AQUí para versión en Español (Disponible abajo)



Weaving Regenerative Solutions:



The most influential Permaculture event  in the continent needs your support , help us by donating and sharing this cross-cultural educational initiative. With your help , we will grant 68 full scholarships to outstanding designers of sustainable habitats from 34 countries throughout Latin America and the Caribbean. 
This convergence is a key sociocultural effort to rise the collective awareness of regenerative solutions. Join us to build up community while moving towards a more sustainable lifestyle, that encourages wellbeing practices in all diferent daily life aspects: economic, social , environmental and cultural.



What is permaculture ?


Permaculture is a design system that aims to create sustainable, environmentally sound and economically viable human habitats. Habitats capable of producing enough to meet their needs, without exploiting resources or polluting. and rather regenerating for the long term. 
Approach
As a growing community we dream to have a representation of two people from each country through Latin America and the Caribbean. The main goal is to bring the voice of diversity among the participants' local movement to weave council around these life styles and their practical tools, methods and techniques of regenerative design.
This is a huge chance to approach the diversity of the continent and strengthen national networks that will replicate the innovations and developments shared at the Convergence.
What we need and what you get

The money raised will be used to cover 100 % of the registration fees of 64  Latin Americans  of 32 countries that already have manifested their intention to travel to Colombia and participate in the Latin American Permaculture Convergence.
In case of having surplus we will support the transportation to the people who have lesser opportunities.
CASA network  ( Council of sustainable settlements of the Americas) offers as a reward the possibility to come and spend time learning permacultural tools and techniques at several countries of the continent ! Learn and join us in this beautiful work!


The impact
The risk is not being resilient, learning to change and live better through understanding that we are a human family that breathes with Mother Earth.Our challenge is to see change, in our daily lives, in the enjoyable time of being here and now, doing something that helps us to live in peace-happiness with the Earth, its cycles, the people, and ourselves.Make a donation so those who work tirelessly for the welfare of all beings on the planet, continue their example in different countries and communities, processes which promote:

care for free seeds, and clean ecological agriculture
conscious and healthy food from the territory, seasonal, organic and obtained through fair trade
the use of tools for the development of the full human potential
the use of alternative energy and construction methods that reduce the negative impact of our footprint in the world.
experimenting new forms of dynamic government in our communities and cities
children's education and adult re-education in the principles of abundance, confidence, transparent communication and the ability to be co-creators of the world
rediscovering the value of ancestral methods of exchanging goods and services, in which value is more important than the price
the establishment of collaborative networks to share knowledge

Meet the Latin American Permaculture Convergence, CLAP 2015It is a space for weaving the network of people, organizations and networks of permaculture in Latin America. A platform to create synergies, to strengthen the initiatives either private, communitary ,local, national and continental. A space for the expansion of permaculture at a continental level and a preparation of the progress made as a Latin America delegation at the International Permaculture Convergence in the UK - UK CPI in September 2015. We are also inviting to participate people who want to link in with the movement. CLAP aims to congregate people linked with permaculture, that have embraced this tool for the design of their stainability in their territories and projects.


CLAP 2015 is organized by:         

Complementary event ECCO
For further networking strengthening, we will carry out the Continental Meeting of CASA (Council of Sustainable Settlements of the Americas ) in Aldeafeliz ecovillage at San Francisco, Cundinamarca, Colombia. ECCO will echo through the wills in action intended to take part politically by offering the knowledge recovered  across permaculture networks and in intentional communities seeking sustainability and harmonious coexistence of humanity at their territories.



  Español



El evento de Permacultura más grande del continente necesita tu apoyo, ayúdanos con tu donación a lograr que cada vez más personas aprendan y multipliquen, por toda américa latina y el caribe, soluciones alternativas para avanzar hacia un estilo de vida más sostenible, regenerativo y satisfactorio, en todos los aspectos económicos, sociales, ambientales y culturales.Con tu ayuda, vamos a otorgar 68 becas completas para este evento a destacad@s diseñadores de hábitats sustentables de 34 países del continente americano. Queremos tener como mínimo dos personas provenientes de cada país 
de Latinoamérica y el Caribe, que traiga la voz del movimiento local en

cosecha de este maravilloso encuentro!!

 compartir tiempo de aprendizaje en técnicas y herramientas de la

story:
My Story     

    Hello my name is Dianna Turner. I live in the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains outside Asheville NC. I am a NC native, however I did relocate to Montana for about 4 years. I am a mother of 5. I have owned my own business since I was 17. I still have the first major contract that I started with 34 years ago. I own an Inventory Service Company and still take seasonal physical inventory counts for Hallmark Cards and several other retail chains.  However a few years ago I found myself in a position no one should ever have to deal with. I gave up my business accounts to move to Montana in support of my husbands new job opportunity. After we lived there the 4 years we decided to move back to NC. He wanted to leave ahead of me and the children to get us a home secured. He had been gone for about 2 months before the children and I followed. We left with a U-haul , his F250 truck and a mini van loaded down and headed across country. We arrived back in Asheville late one evening in June to find that not only did we have no home to live in, but my husband had left. He showed up to announce to us that he had spent our money, and had not secured us a home. When asked why, he said he had met someone new and fallen in love with her. He had spend the last month and a half with her and her son. I had to borrow money  to get myself and children in a furnished rental home. Where we stayed for 2 months with everything we owned in a storage unit. We had no money for food. We had to go to food banks and rely on the kindness of others to sustain us until we could get jobs and permanent housing. He refused to help us with anything.  I made up my mind then that if there was ever a way I could pay it forward and help out others, men, women or children I would. He still rarely helps us but my children and I came out of it a much stronger family.   
                                                       The Turning Point
    The children and I spent several winters gathering wood and papers from dumpsters for our fireplace for warmth. We could not afford fuel for the furnace. I realized at that point how much paper products and cardboard that Amercians waste. I had also tried to start a candle company and had boxes of soy wax left. I would use the soy flakes to start our fires. Hence, the Deadbeat  Dad Logs were born! I came up with the idea for deadbeat dad logs because it is a fantastic way to recycle cardboard, leaves, twigs, and sawdust. And it is also a great fire starter. Plus, the deadbeat dad logs would help to provide jobs for the community  and raise money for a very worthy cause.  
     

                                                     In the Mix
    The ingredients I use, are as I stated, recycled and organic. Soy is a very clean virtually soot free wax, and is 100% organic and grown by farmers in the U.S. To make the logs I used paper tubes from carpet stores left over and thrown away. I combined a mixture of the soy wax (which is a food grade wax and is actually eatable, although we don't recommend that!), leaves, sawdust, and twigs all chipped and melted together. I packed the tubes with this mixture. These logs are 100% biodegradable. Our logs are scented with your choice of one of our signature essential oil based scents: Apple Cinnamon, Pumpkin Pie, and Evergreen. We also offer custom scents per request. We have 180 different scents to chose from, even citronella for summer! They also can be ordered with no scent. They also have several starter wicks. We offer 3 different sizes: standard (large) sized fire logs, medium, and small. The medium and small sizes are ideal for camping, outdoor fire pits, or they make a great way to start a fire for your wood burning grill. We recommend the non scented logs for grilling. These are great for year round use. They also make charming one of a kind gifts! Or simply leave one out and use as a decorative potpourri! Your family and friends are sure to be delighted and intrigued by our handmade Deadbeat Logs! 


                                                     What We Need
   We need donations to help jump start our company to produce DBDLs. We have an overwhelming amount of interest from chain store retailers. We've sent out prototypes and have been given so much positive encouragement about our logs that we feel that we will be great a success. We are hoping, with your help, to make our dream come true so we can make brighter futures for those in need a reality. The funds we receive will be distributed in these areas: 1. A larger manufacturing space (unfortunately our garage isn't big enough) 2. Expand our employment (yay jobs!) 3. Buy supplies in greater volume... Soy wax in bulk, truck loads of sawdust, a large outdoor bin for kind folks to drop off their paper product trash so that we can recycle it into logs. 4. A wood chipper & large commercial paper shredders. 5. Commercial sized sized melting vat. 6. Safety equipment, such as safety glasses, gloves, and mask. 6. Web design etc. We also are using part of the funds to stage our product at the Atlanta Gift Mart.  
                                                     
                                                  The Facts & Plan 
    Statics show out of 11 million divorced fathers 7.2 million do not support their children. Although we are calling them dead beat dads does not negate the fact that dead beat moms exist as well. Therefore, we will help anyone we can with 100% of all our profits after taxes. Our dream is to finish opening our non profit charity and help families in need, not only financially but by networking within the community to help in all facets of their personal situation. We plan to help in every way to make it possible for families in need to get back on track. Check out urban.org for more info on family statics, and please visit cajuncandle.com and read about Eco-Soya. 
Please bare in mind that winter is around the corner and many will be without heat.
     My grandmother had a saying that I grew up hearing and never understood what it truly meant until late in my adult life. " You only keep what you give away." I've learned whether it is kindness, love, money, a smile...what you give away is all you keep in this life. So I am asking you now to help us give kindness, love, money and smiles to those in need. Kindness is magic. Kindness can change the world.  
We would like to thank the following companies for their support: 


 With your donations we can stoke the flames of kindness and light up lives! 
* If you believe in creating jobs in communities, donate. 
* If you believe that kindness can change the world, donate! 
* Donate if you have a deadbeat dad!  
* Donate if you have a deadbeat mom! 
* Donate if you don't have deadbeat parents! 
* Donate if your not a deadbeat ! 
* By all means donate if your are a deadbeat!!!
* Even if you cannot donate, then please share :D
Follow us on Facebook Deadbeat Dad Logs
All donations are tax deductible.
Log into Facebook an search Deadbeat Dad Logs to view pictures of the perks. Also like us on Facebook!  
U

story:
A huge THANK YOU to everyone who gave to our Save Blue Creek campaign. With your support, we successfully raised a grand total of $1,037,118 through Indiegogo and direct contributions to WRC during the campaign. All of this will go toward acquiring and adding the final 10,000 acres of land to the 47,000-acre Blue Creek Salmon Sanctuary and Yurok Tribal Community Forest. 

Although our Indiegogo campaign is over, we still need to raise over $12 million to save Blue Creek. To donate or learn more about this effort, visit savebluecreek.com


Sometimes to save a river, you have to buy it. 

Help Western Rivers Conservancy purchase the final 10,000 acres of land to save Blue Creek, a cold-water lifeline for some of the greatest salmon and steelhead runs on the West Coast. By contributing, you're helping create a sanctuary in the heart of the California redwoods for these magnificent fish and the region's increasingly imperiled wildlife.

One by one we can Save Blue Creek. Forever.


In 2008, WRC began an effort to create a sanctuary at Blue Creek. We've raised funds to do this through individual donations, private grants, public funding and elsewhere, and we've already purchased over 37,000 acres. 

To finish off the 47,000-acre project, WRC needs your help to buy the remaining 10,000 acres.  Our overall goal for this is $12.8 million, and we're asking individual donors on Indiegogo for $5M of that. We'll make announcements throughout the campaign  to keep you informed on how close we are getting to our goal. 

Individual donations are important because each goes to saving a place that is valuable not just to the Klamath River, but to the world around it. The Klamath-Siskiyou ecoregion is one of the most biologically diverse regions on the entire planet, and Blue Creek is a vital part of it. You’ll help save fish, wildlife, redwoods and a river that matters to this rare and wild place.


The Lifeline to the Klamath River 

The Klamath River was once the third largest producer of salmon on the entire West Coast. Today, its runs are imperiled. Yet the Klamath remains the most recoverable salmon stream in the West, and the key to saving it is Blue Creek. 


Blue Creek flows into the Klamath River 16 miles from the ocean, injecting it with a massive, life-saving dose of cold water. Because the Klamath is getting warmer every year, this first cold-water refuge that fish encounter on their journey inland from the sea is a lifeline. Without the cool-down period that Blue Creek provides, the Klamath’s fish would never make it to the upper river, where they spawn, die, return nutrients to the forest and begin the cycle of life anew. 

The Perfect Stewards 

Our partner in this historic effort is California’s Yurok Tribe. The Yurok will become the owner and conservation steward of the lands. The Yurok have lived in the lower Klamath River Basin since time immemorial, and caring for the river and its fish is their top priority. 

Once Western Rivers Conservancy purchases the Blue Creek lands and conveys them to the Yurok, the Tribe will regain sacred ancestral homelands that they'll manage for the sake of fish, wildlife and forest habitat, and once again call Blue Creek home.

“Not only our family, but all families in the Yurok community are connected through Blue Creek. It is the lifeline to the whole entire river system.” Per-gish Carlson, member of the Yurok Tribe


About Western Rivers Conservancy

Western Rivers Conservancy focuses on one thing: saving rivers. We do this by buying land along the West's greatest streams, rivers like the Klamath, Yampa, Snake, John Day, Madison, Salmon, Gunnison, Hoh, Eel and others. We do it for the sake of fish, for the benefit of wildlife and to improve public access along our most treasured waters. Most of all, we do it for the river. 

We count on support from people like you, folks who know the value of clean, cold water, healthy watersheds and public access. The great thing about our approach is that it’s effective, immediate, tangible and forever. It works, and that's why our motto is, “Sometimes to save a river, you have to buy it.”


Perks

We were able to capture the beauty of Blue Creek through photography, video, and sound. Through this content we're able to give you your piece of Blue Creek. 

We want to make sure every contributor gets something. Besides getting a "conservation deed" showing that you've helped purchase land to create a sanctuary, there are a variety of perks to choose from that include exclusive phone wallpapers (picture below), desktop wallpapers, screensavers, and even the sounds of Blue Creek. 

There are also chances to learn from our rivers experts. We're offering group Google hangout sessions to learn from Tim Palmer, one of the West’s most celebrated river gurus, or Peter Moyle, a UC Davis Distinguished Professor Emeritus in fish biology. These will give you an opportunity to ask questions, get some help planning future river trips, or even learn more about Blue Creek. 

Blue Creek is incredibly difficult to access, and few will ever get to see it. However, we're offering contributors at the $10,000 level a chance to see Blue Creek for themselves, to snorkel with us, tour the watershed and witness a cold-water salmon sanctuary in action. 

And at $25,000, you can float, fish, and hike with us on one of the other rivers we've helped protect like the Klamath, John Day or Gunnison.

Beyond Contributions

Spreading the word about this campaign is important. Please share and follow our campaign here, on our Facebook page, and on Instagram. 


FAQs

Is my contribution tax-deductible?

Yes. Western Rivers Conservancy is a non-profit.

How will the funds be used?

What has Western Rivers Conservancy done in the past?

Western Rivers Conservancy saves rivers by buying land along them. We have worked on rivers throughout the West including the Madison, Hoh,Yampa, John Day, Hood, Sandy, Skagit, Chetco, Bear, Salmon and many others. Most recently, we created Oregon's second largest state park by purchasing a former ranch and conserving 16 miles of the John Day. We also just opened access to a prime stretch of trout water on the upper Yampa in Colorado. We created conservation and recreation corridors along more than a dozen miles of Washington's Hoh and Oregon's Sandy Rivers. In all, we've protected hundreds of thousands of acres of riverlands on more than 50 rivers across the West. 

Who will own the land?
After WRC acquires the lands, it will convey them to the Yurok Tribe, which will then own and manage them for the sake of fish and wildlife, salmon recovery and long-term forest health.

How much has been raised for the overall project to date?

The total cost of saving Blue Creek is $60M. All but $12.8M of this has already been raised. We are now looking to you to help bring this project to the finish line. We are hoping raise $5M of the final $12.8M through crowdfunding, and the rest of it through private fundraising and foundation giving. Given the cost of this project, it is critical that we receive support from all fronts.

Are the Yurok good land stewards?

Yes. Our partnership with the Yurok is the only way we could see that Blue Creek would be fully and unconditionally protected  as a sanctuary for salmon and steelhead. The Yurok and WRC are creating a management plan that has as its centerpiece creating an old-growth forest and salmon sanctuary in the entire Blue Creek watershed.  The surrounding lands outside the Blue Creek watershed will become part of a sustainable community forest. The Yurok also have one of the largest fisheries departments in California, and they are committed to the recovery and enhancement of salmon and steelhead (it’s actually written in their constitution).  

Is there any connection between this project and the Klamath Basin Restoration Agreement?

On the river, everything is connected. But the Blue Creek Salmon Sanctuary is a freestanding effort and is a safety net for fish that will help guarantee their survival regardless of what happens elsewhere on the Klamath. This is especially true if the dams were to never come out on the upper river.

How many river miles will this effort protect?

The effort will conserve 9 miles of Blue Creek, 25 miles of the main-stem Klamath River and 50 miles of cold-water tributary streams that flow into Blue Creek and the Klamath. In terms of Blue Creek specifically, the project will protect the entire lower Blue Creek watershed. The upper Blue Creek watershed is already protected within the Siskiyou Wilderness.

Is my gift a tax-deductible charitable contribution?

Yes, your gift is a tax-deductible charitable donation made to Western Rivers Conservancy, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit. If a perk is claimed at the $10,000 level or higher, the tax deductible portion of the gift would be reduced by the value of the service provided to the donor.

What payments are accepted?

Payment by credit/debit card accepted.
story_txt:
A huge THANK YOU to everyone who gave to our Save Blue Creek campaign.
With your support, we successfully raised a grand total of $1,037,118 through Indiegogo and
direct contributions to WRC during the campaign. All of this will go toward
acquiring and adding the final 10,000 acres of land to the 47,000-acre Blue
Creek Salmon Sanctuary and Yurok Tribal Community Forest. Although our
Indiegogo campaign is over, we still need to raise over $12 million to save Blue Creek. To donate or learn more about this
effort, visit savebluecreek.com


Sometimes to save a river, you have to buy it. 




Help Western Rivers Conservancy purchase the final 10,000 acres of land to save Blue Creek, a cold-water lifeline for some of the greatest salmon and steelhead runs on the West Coast. By contributing, you're helping create a sanctuary in the heart of the California redwoods for these magnificent fish and the region's increasingly imperiled wildlife.One by one we can Save Blue Creek. Forever.In 2008, WRC began an effort to create a sanctuary at Blue Creek. We've raised funds to do this through individual donations, private grants, public funding and elsewhere, and we've already purchased over 37,000 acres. 
To finish off the 47,000-acre project, WRC needs your help to buy the remaining 10,000 acres.  Our overall goal for this is $12.8 million, and we're asking individual donors on Indiegogo for $5M of that. We'll make announcements throughout the campaign  to keep you informed on how close we are getting to our goal. Individual donations are important because each goes to saving a place that is valuable not just to the Klamath River, but to the world around it. The Klamath-Siskiyou ecoregion is one of the most biologically diverse regions on the entire planet, and Blue Creek is a vital part of it. You’ll help save fish, wildlife, redwoods and a river that matters to this rare and wild place.

The Lifeline to the Klamath River 




The Klamath River was once the third largest producer of salmon on the entire West Coast. Today, its runs are imperiled. Yet the Klamath remains the most recoverable salmon stream in the West, and the key to saving it is Blue Creek. 



Blue Creek flows into the Klamath River 16 miles from the ocean, injecting it with a massive, life-saving dose of cold water. Because the Klamath is getting warmer every year, this first cold-water refuge that fish encounter on their journey inland from the sea is a lifeline. Without the cool-down period that Blue Creek provides, the Klamath’s fish would never make it to the upper river, where they spawn, die, return nutrients to the forest and begin the cycle of life anew. 

The Perfect Stewards 


Our partner in this historic effort is California’s Yurok Tribe. The Yurok will become the owner and conservation steward of the lands. The Yurok have lived in the lower Klamath River Basin since time immemorial, and caring for the river and its fish is their top priority. Once Western Rivers Conservancy purchases the Blue Creek lands and conveys them to the Yurok, the Tribe will regain sacred ancestral homelands that they'll manage for the sake of fish, wildlife and forest habitat, and once again call Blue Creek home.“Not only our family, but all families in the Yurok community are connected through Blue Creek. It is the lifeline to the whole entire river system.” Per-gish Carlson, member of the Yurok Tribe



About Western Rivers Conservancy



Western Rivers Conservancy focuses on one thing: saving rivers. We do this by buying land along the West's greatest streams, rivers like the Klamath, Yampa, Snake, John Day, Madison, Salmon, Gunnison, Hoh, Eel and others. Most of all, we do it for the river. We count on support from people like you, folks who know the value of clean, cold water, healthy watersheds and public access. The great thing about our approach is that it’s effective, immediate, tangible and forever. It works, and that's why our motto is, “Sometimes to save a river, you have to buy it.”






Perks


We were able to capture the beauty of Blue Creek through photography, video, and sound. Through this content we're able to give you your piece of Blue Creek. 



We want to make sure every contributor gets something. Besides getting a "conservation deed" showing that you've helped purchase land to create a sanctuary, there are a variety of perks to choose from that include exclusive phone wallpapers (picture below), desktop wallpapers, screensavers, and even the sounds of Blue Creek. 


There are also chances to learn from our rivers experts. We're offering group Google hangout sessions to learn from Tim Palmer, one of the West’s most celebrated river gurus, or Peter Moyle, a UC Davis Distinguished Professor Emeritus in fish biology. These will give you an opportunity to ask questions, get some help planning future river trips, or even learn more about Blue Creek. 

Blue Creek is incredibly difficult to access, and few will ever get to see it. However, we're offering contributors at the $10,000 level a chance to see Blue Creek for themselves, to snorkel with us, tour the watershed and witness a cold-water salmon sanctuary in action. 
And at $25,000, you can float, fish, and hike with us on one of the other rivers we've helped protect like the Klamath, John Day or Gunnison.

Beyond Contributions





Spreading the word about this campaign is important. Please share and follow our campaign here, on our Facebook page, and on Instagram.

Yes. Western Rivers Conservancy is a non-profit.
How will the funds be used?

We also just opened access to a prime stretch of trout water on the upper Yampa in Colorado. We created conservation and recreation corridors along more than a dozen miles of Washington's Hoh and Oregon's Sandy Rivers. In all, we've protected hundreds of thousands of acres of riverlands on more than 50 rivers across the West.

will convey them to the Yurok Tribe, which
will then own and manage them for the sake of fish and wildlife, salmon
recovery and long-term forest health.
