story:
A bid for some bird boxes...

I love owls. I always have. I think Harry Potter made the world go ga-ga for these awesome birds, but from a young age, I've been inspired by their beauty. On one of our group wildflower sowing trips, I was lucky enough to spot a lone barn owl silently surfing across the fields at dusk. It sparked the idea to get up as many nest boxes as we can to encourage birds of prey into the area; hence this campaign was born.

If you help us, you won't only be buying a nesting box; you'll actually be giving life to new owlets. Now, that's cool!  Even £2, the price of an ice cream on a hot day or a single morning coffee, will help immensely.

It all started last year when I crowdfunded the Wildflower Meadow Campaign. You see, I have these 40-ish acres of prime Suffolk farmland that have been left fairly vacant since my granddad died in the late 90s. So what did I decide to do? Use it as conservation space!

Help us get more boxes

March and April are prime-time for putting up owl boxes. Jackdaws have already made their nests, leaving the remaining boxes free for birds of prey. I've bought one which will go up in the next few weeks, but at £120 a pop, I can't afford any more for now. 


So...what do I need your help with? Buying more boxes.


Having talked with various owl sanctuaries, I've been advised I can put up two boxes per 5 - 7 acres. That's around 11 owl boxes in total - not to mention more boxes for kestrels and other wildlife. £500 will buy four boxes (I'm using these ECO Barn Owl Nest Boxes), and as long as I make the target, I can keep funding the campaign indefinitely, using further money to add all manner of homes for birds, bats and critters.

If I don't make the target...well, I'll just buy as many boxes as possible.

(One species we know are already present; barn owls. Image © Chris Parker) 

Perks

We've got various perks available, including thank you postcards and shout-outs on social media, but perhaps the most exciting will be updates on the boxes AND (fingers crossed) their inhabitants. You're not donating to have something made, you're making new life possible! Quite simply, one thing holding owl populations back is a lack of somewhere to breed. By funding new homes, you can offer life to little, cute, fluffy owlets (well, maybe not soo cute when they cannibalise each other - lets hope that doesn't happen).

I'll post pictures, videos and blogs on the boxes around Brimwood Farm and show you just how your pledge has helped the owls find somewhere to raise a family. The first visitors I expect are barn owls, but I hope to eventually encourage Britain's five owl species: 

  • Barn Owl
  • Tawny Owl
  • Little Owl
  • Short-eared Owl
  • Long-eared Owl

And, of course, the future is likely to include kestrels and other birds of prey too (when we were scything the wildflower meadow last year, a buzzard circled quietly above us).

(A short-eared owl; another species I hope to encourage. Image © gbrazzill)
*It's important to note that I won't be interfering with the boxes once they're up. I'll work with a local and licensed trust who can legally inspect and ring any young birds. Most likely I'll be laying on my belly with a pair of binoculars for hours on end!

Please Help in Any Way You Can

I'm extremely lucky in that I have this land in my family. However, I'm self-employed and earn a meagre existence...I could fund everything myself but it would take YEARS. And for all of those years, I feel that an opportunity to do something fantastic has slipped by. By funding this together, I can put in the time and effort, put your donations to good use and ensure that a little patch of Suffolk farmland becomes a safe haven for creatures large and small...well, perhaps not the owl's prey...it might not be as safe for them after all...but you get the idea...

I more than understand if you can't offer financial support but there are LOADS of other ways you can help:

  • Social Media - Tweet the campaign, Facebook the campaign, just simply spread the word.
  • Word-of-mouth - This is still big business. If you can't donate, maybe someone you know can. Maybe your great aunt Gertrude is mad keen on owls and would love to help buy a nesting box!
  • Keep Checking In - Just because you can't hit that pledge button is no excuse not to keep coming back. I'll have lots of updates over the coming weeks, months and even years so you can still see how this project (and the plethora of other ideas we have for the farm) develop. 
  • Get in touch - Reach out and say hi! If you've got no cash, you might have a marketing idea. Maybe you actually live near and are interested in being in one of the work parties. Perhaps you're just a nutty old owl geek and want to make some new friends. I'm here - message me!! (Actually, my husband is EVEN MORE owl nutty than me!)

So, come-on, help me out in some way, any way - think of those fluffy, bone-scoffing, pellet vomiting bundles of owlet.

Get in touch - Reach out and say hi! If you've got no cash, you might have a marketing idea. Maybe you actually live near and are interested in being in one of the work parties. Perhaps you're just a nutty old owl geek and want to make some new friends. I'm here - message me!! (Actually, my husband is EVEN MORE owl nutty than me!)


So, come-on, help me out in some way, any way - think of those fluffy, bone-scoffing, pellet vomiting bundles of owlet.

story:
------English version below-----

Árboles para el Rio Pamplonita.

Compense sus impactos ambientales! Cuéntele a sus hijos y nietos que usted hizo su parte.

Un problema gigantesco

Cada persona en el mundo en promedio está emitiendo 4.9 toneladas de CO2 (dióxido de carbono) cada año. Esto básicamente está acabando con el medio ambiente. Cada vez que usamos el carro, viajamos en avión, usamos electricidad o comemos carne estamos directa o indirectamente enviando CO2 y otros gases de efecto invernadero hacia la atmósfera. Cada producto que compramos deja una huella de carbono.

La contaminación que generamos todos acelera el cambio climático, agravando eventos de sequías e inundaciones. En Colombia lo vivimos claramente con el fenómeno de la Niña en 2010-2011 o el fenómeno del Niño 2015-2016. Mientras tanto, en todo el mundo miles de hectáreas de bosques vienen siendo taladas y  la calidad del aire y el agua viene disminuyendo. El calentamiento global se ha convertido en una amenaza social y económica latente, y aun así, pareciera que nos importara muy poco, no hacemos nada al respecto.

Si ya estamos nosotros sintiendo el cambio climático y viendo sus terribles consecuencias, qué le va a tocar a las futuras generaciones? A nuestros hijos?

Una solución básica

Si bien el escenario parece aterrador, tenemos una herramienta muy eficiente para compensar la contaminación y combatir el calentamiento global, los ÁRBOLES.

Los árboles absorben CO2 de la atmósfera y liberan oxígeno, con lo que ayudan a regular la temperatura de la tierra y mejoran la calidad del aire que respiramos. De igual forma, los árboles son un componente fundamental de un rio saludable, reduciendo la erosión, regulando el caudal y actuando como filtro.

Se estima que durante toda su vida, 1 árbol en una región tropical, donde pueden “trabajar” durante todo el año, pueden absorber alrededor de 700 Kgs (0.7 toneladas) de CO2.

Esta es una invitación para que compense sus impactos ambientales mientras protege el Rio Pamplonita.

Empiece a ser parte de la solución. Patrocinando el establecimiento de árboles nuevos, usted le está devolviendo al medio ambiente.

Para absorber el CO2 que emite una persona promedio en el mundo cada año, se necesitan 7 árboles.

Nuestro Proyecto

Estamos plantando árboles en la parte media de la Cuenca del Rio Pamplonita, en el nororiente de Colombia. Nuestra meta inicial es sembrar 1.000 nuevos árboles este año. Con su ayuda, vamos a poder plantar y proteger hasta 10.000 Chiminangos, un árbol nativo que se acopla perfectamente al suelo, el clima y la fauna de la zona. Cómo sabemos eso? Porque en los últimos 17 años hemos plantado más de 15.000 árboles. Después de probar más de una docena de especies en la ribera del rio, sabemos que el Chiminango es el que mejor desempeño presenta.

El Rio Pamplonita provee agua a alrededor de medio millón de personas en 10 municipios de Norte de Santander y es vital para la agricultura de la zona. En los últimos días prácticamente se secó, trayendo tensiones sociales, incrementando la toma de conciencia sobre el cambio climático y clamando por acciones concretas para mitigarlo. Plantar árboles en su ribera es sin duda uno de los caminos a tomar.

Su contribución a este Proyecto permitirá:

-  Comprar semillas.

-  Establecer los semilleros.

-  Transportar y transplantar el semillero hacia la ribera del Pamplonita.

-  Regar, fertilizar y proteger los árboles durante 9 meses. Sabemos que después de 9 meses los árboles se pueden defender por si solos.

-  Generar empleo en el caserío de Los Vados. Personas mayores y con experiencia en el manejo de árboles estarán plantando y cuidando los nuevos chiminangos.

Desde tan solo 7 dólares, 1 árbol plantado en su nombre combatirá silenciosamente el calentamiento global y protegerá el rio por décadas.

Sea parte de la solución!

Cada árbol cuenta. 

-------------------------------------------------------------

Trees for the Pamplonita River.

 Offset your environmental impacts!

Tell your kids you did your part! 

A huge problem

The average person in the world is producing 4.9 tons of CO2 every year and that is, basically, damaging the environment. Every time we drive, fly, use electricity or eat meat we are directly or indirectly burning fossil fuels, sending CO2 and other greenhouse gases to the atmosphere. Every product we buy has a carbon footprint behind.

Pollution is accelerating climate change, worsening extreme weather events such as floods and droughts. In the meantime, forests are being destroyed and the quality of air and water is suffering. Global warming became an actual social and economic threat… And most of us are not doing anything to fight it!

A basic solution

While this scenario looks scary, there’s a simple and efficient tool to offset pollution and fight global warming, TREES.

Trees absorb CO2 from the atmosphere and release oxygen, regulating the Earth’s temperature and improving the air we breathe. At the same time, trees are a significant part of a healthy river and a significant factor in creating resilience in the ecosystem to droughts, floods and pollution.

It is estimated that during its lifetime, 1 tree in a tropical region like Colombia can absorb around 700 Kgs (0.7 tons) of CO2.

This is an open invitation for you to offset your carbon print while protecting the Pamplonita River.

Start being part of the solution. By supporting the establishment of new trees, you are compensating the environment.  To offset the pollution created by 1 average person in 1 year, 7 trees need to be grown.

Our project

We are planting trees by the Pamplonita river, in the northeast of Colombia (South America). Our initial goal for 2016 is 1.000 trees. With your support, this year we will be planting and growing up to 10.000 units of Chiminango, a local tree that fits perfectly the soil, weather and wildlife of the zone. How do we know this? We have planted and taken care of about 15.000 trees since 1999 in this zone. After testing about a dozen species, Chiminango turned out to be the best performer in the river’s bank.

The Pamplonita River, which provides fresh water for around half a million inhabitants in 10 towns and supports agriculture in the zone,  recently ran dry, rising social tensions over scarcity, increasing awareness of climate change and urging for concrete actions to deal with it. Planting trees by its banks is certainly one of them. Dozens of rivers and cities are going through the same situation. We can wait for Governments and multinational companies to come and save the planet (will they?) or we can start doing our bit.

With your contribution, we will:

- Buy seeds.

- Establish the seedlings.

- Transport and transplant the seedlings into the Pamplonita river bank.

- Water the trees, fertilize them and protect them for 9 months. After 9 months, we know the trees can take care of themselves.

- Create jobs in the underprivileged village of Los Vados. Unemployed older workers, who have extensive experience dealing with trees, will be planting and taking care of the new chiminangos.

For as little as 7 US Dollars (4.9 British Pounds, 6.3 Euros, 46 Renmimbi) a tree planted on your behalf will be silently fighting global warming and protecting a river for decades.

The more trees you support, the more thankful the Earth will be.

Be part of the solution! Every tree counts.
story_txt:
------English version below-----Árboles para el Rio Pamplonita.
Compense sus impactos
ambientales! Cuéntele a sus hijos y nietos que usted hizo su parte.
Un problema gigantesco
Cada persona en el mundo
en promedio está emitiendo 4.9 toneladas de CO2 (dióxido de carbono) cada año. Esto
básicamente está acabando con el medio ambiente. Cada vez que usamos el carro, viajamos
en avión, usamos electricidad o comemos carne estamos directa o indirectamente enviando
CO2 y otros gases de efecto invernadero hacia la atmósfera. Cada producto que
compramos deja una huella de carbono.
La contaminación que
generamos todos acelera el cambio climático, agravando eventos de sequías e
inundaciones. En Colombia lo vivimos claramente con el fenómeno de la Niña en
2010-2011 o el fenómeno del Niño 2015-2016. Mientras tanto, en todo el mundo miles
de hectáreas de bosques vienen siendo taladas y  la calidad del aire y el agua viene disminuyendo.
El calentamiento global se ha convertido en una amenaza social y económica
latente, y aun así, pareciera que nos importara muy poco, no hacemos nada al
respecto. 
Si ya estamos nosotros
sintiendo el cambio climático y viendo sus terribles consecuencias, qué le va a
tocar a las futuras generaciones? A nuestros hijos?
Una solución básica
Si bien
el escenario parece aterrador, tenemos una herramienta muy eficiente para
compensar la contaminación y combatir el calentamiento global, los ÁRBOLES. 
Los árboles
absorben CO2 de la atmósfera y liberan oxígeno, con lo que ayudan a regular la temperatura
de la tierra y mejoran la calidad del aire que respiramos. De igual forma, los
árboles son un componente fundamental de un rio saludable, reduciendo la erosión,
regulando el caudal y actuando como filtro. 
Se estima que durante
toda su vida, 1 árbol en una región tropical, donde pueden “trabajar” durante
todo el año, pueden absorber alrededor de 700 Kgs (0.7 toneladas) de CO2.
Esta es una invitación
para que compense sus impactos ambientales mientras protege el Rio Pamplonita.
Empiece a ser parte de la
solución. Patrocinando el establecimiento de árboles nuevos, usted le está
devolviendo al medio ambiente. 
Para absorber el CO2 que
emite una persona promedio en el mundo cada año, se necesitan 7 árboles.
Nuestro Proyecto
Estamos plantando árboles
en la parte media de la Cuenca del Rio Pamplonita, en el nororiente de Colombia.
Nuestra meta inicial es sembrar 1.000 nuevos árboles este año. Con su ayuda, vamos a poder plantar y proteger hasta 10.000
Chiminangos, un árbol nativo que se acopla perfectamente al suelo, el clima y
la fauna de la zona. Cómo sabemos eso? Porque en los últimos 17 años hemos
plantado más de 15.000 árboles. Después de probar más de una docena de especies
en la ribera del rio, sabemos que el Chiminango es el que mejor desempeño
presenta.
El Rio Pamplonita provee agua
a alrededor de medio millón de personas en 10 municipios de Norte de Santander
y es vital para la agricultura de la zona. En los últimos días prácticamente se
secó, trayendo tensiones sociales, incrementando la toma de conciencia sobre el
cambio climático y clamando por acciones concretas para mitigarlo. Plantar
árboles en su ribera es sin duda uno de los caminos a tomar.
Su contribución a este Proyecto
permitirá:
- 
Comprar
semillas.
- 
Establecer
los semilleros.
- 
Transportar y transplantar el semillero hacia
la ribera del Pamplonita.
- 
Regar, fertilizar y proteger los árboles
durante 9 meses. Sabemos que después de 9 meses los árboles se pueden defender
por si solos. 
- 
Generar empleo en el caserío de Los Vados. Personas
mayores y con experiencia en el manejo de árboles estarán plantando y cuidando
los nuevos chiminangos.
Desde tan solo 7 dólares,
1 árbol plantado en su nombre combatirá silenciosamente el calentamiento global
y protegerá el rio por décadas.
Sea parte de la solución!

Cada
árbol cuenta. -------------------------------------------------------------Trees for the Pamplonita River. Offset your environmental impacts!Tell your kids you did your part! A huge problemThe average person in the world is producing 4.9 tons of CO2 every year and that is, basically, damaging the environment. Every time we drive, fly, use electricity or eat meat we are directly or indirectly burning fossil fuels, sending CO2 and other greenhouse gases to the atmosphere. Every product we buy has a carbon footprint behind.Pollution is accelerating climate change, worsening extreme weather events such as floods and droughts. In the meantime, forests are being destroyed and the quality of air and water is suffering. Global warming became an actual social and economic threat… And most of us are not doing anything to fight it!A basic solutionWhile this scenario looks scary, there’s a simple and efficient tool to offset pollution and fight global warming, TREES.Trees absorb CO2 from the atmosphere and release oxygen, regulating the Earth’s temperature and improving the air we breathe. At the same time, trees are a significant part of a healthy river and a significant factor in creating resilience in the ecosystem to droughts, floods and pollution.It is estimated that during its lifetime, 1 tree in a tropical region like Colombia can absorb around 700 Kgs (0.7 tons) of CO2.This is an open invitation for you to offset your carbon print while protecting the Pamplonita River.Start being part of the solution. By supporting the establishment of new trees, you are compensating the environment.  To offset the pollution created by 1 average person in 1 year, 7 trees need to be grown.Our projectWe are planting trees by the Pamplonita river, in the northeast of Colombia (South America). Our initial goal for 2016 is 1.000 trees. With your support, this year we will be planting and growing up to 10.000 units of Chiminango, a local tree that fits perfectly the soil, weather and wildlife of the zone. How do we know this? We have planted and taken care of about 15.000 trees since 1999 in this zone. After testing about a dozen species, Chiminango turned out to be the best performer in the river’s bank.The Pamplonita River, which provides fresh water for around half a million inhabitants in 10 towns and supports agriculture in the zone,  recently ran dry, rising social tensions over scarcity, increasing awareness of climate change and urging for concrete actions to deal with it. Planting trees by its banks is certainly one of them. Dozens of rivers and cities are going through the same situation. We can wait for Governments and multinational companies to come and save the planet (will they?) or we can start doing our bit.With your contribution, we will:- Buy seeds.- Establish the seedlings.- Transport and transplant the seedlings into the Pamplonita river bank.- Water the trees, fertilize them and protect them for 9 months. After 9 months, we know the trees can take care of themselves.- Create jobs in the underprivileged village of Los Vados. Unemployed older workers, who have extensive experience dealing with trees, will be planting and taking care of the new chiminangos.For as little as 7 US Dollars (4.9 British Pounds, 6.3 Euros, 46 Renmimbi) a tree planted on your behalf will be silently fighting global warming and protecting a river for decades.The more trees you support, the more thankful the Earth will be.Be part of the solution! Every tree counts.

story:
Short Summary

We are a dedicated group of scientists, filmmakers, marketers and ocean loyalists who wish to preserve our precious oceans for future generations.
We believe we can make a huge impact on ocean conservation by developing a "Ted-Talks" style channel (www.wildinblue.com) that uses film and video to promote ocean preservation, education and restoration.

What We Need & What You Get

We require this level of funding to build a fully-professional, large video-based website.
The technical requirements and attention to detail will be massive as we plan to be able to stream thousands, upon thousands of videos.
We fully plan to have a similar global reach like "TED", but exclusively "ocean".
If we don't receive full funding, our goal then will be to start with a smaller site to
attract larger donor interest and bulid from there.
 
We have lots of Wild In Blue Bling for those who help us reach our goal.
DVD's, CD's, T-Shirts, V.I.P. Film Festival Passes...and even (drum roll)
Executive Producer status!

The Impact

No question; the ecological clock is ticking.
To quote Sylvia Earle..."Why should I care about the ocean? Because the ocean is the cornerstone of earths life support system. It holds most of life on earth. 97% of earth's water is there". Wild In Blue will be a major motivator in keeping the all-important, ongoing conversation about our oceans alive.
 
Here's the thing. We have aligned ourselves with scientists (non-muzzled) who want to tell the honest truth. The scientific community is usually several steps ahead of the media, so Wild In Blue will also become the default, "go to" ocean news channel.
 
Wild In Blue is a legacy project that will go on for many decades (if not several lifetimes) and will get everyone talking, caring, and working together to help protect this valuable treasure.
Become a Wild In Blue ambassador and help us change the world!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word. The more who know - the more we can impact magnificent change! You may know of ocean documentary filmmakers (worldwide) who wish to have a major platform to promote their message and films? Perhaps you may have promotional or film idea for an ocean-related topic? As you can probably tell, we wish to build a fabulous "ocean love" community!

story:
FUTURE FORCE-young environmental heroes

Way too many kids today feel frightened or powerless in the face of climate change and environmental problems, giving them bad dreams and a feeling of a future with no or little hope. This must end and we have an alternative!

By letting the kids meet real life superheroes, and become a part of their elite environmental superhero group, FUTURE FORCE, we will teach them how they can easily change many small things to create a more sustainable way of life for themselves, their families and their local communities.

At the same time, the kids will have fun, exploring their super-alter-ego, both online and in the real world, collaborating with others to truly change the world, while gathering FUTURE FORCE experience points for each heroic action they perform.

Who are we?

We are a group of professional physical actors and performing artists based in Copenhagen, Denmark. With over 10 years of experience working with interaction and action packed theatre for all ages, using both traditional theatre methods as well as multimedia and online presence, we have more than just the ideas to make this happen. We have the know how, the skills, the networks and most important of all, WE NEED TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN to empower kids to create the future they want to live in.

3 X 3 months hard work have led us here

During the past year, we, the 3 people who have instigated the project, have already done the equivalence of 3 months of full time voluntary work each, just to plan, meet the right people, write grant proposals and create the artistic background and ideas for FUTURE FORCE. 

Why we need your support

We currently have EURO 65.000,- funding as well as support through scientific advice from the Danish Environmental Protection Agency, making it possible for us to produce most of the performance, including set and props, but we do not have the funding for a key factor in this project: our online platform. This is where you come in. Thanks to your help, we will be able to hire 2 top notch programmers to work full-time for 3 months, creating the secret home-page, community and game that our young superheroes will use, both during our performance and into the future.

This is not possible without additional funding, since even artists and computer programmers need to pay their rent and feed their families :-). We are doing what we can to get support from other sources, but this is proving harder than we thought, so we hope that all the wonderful people out their in the virtual world might lend us a hand.

Through this project, everyone involved will truly have the possibility to make a huge difference for the future of us all.

Not For Profit

The project is run on a Not For Profit basis, so all funds go to cover production costs for the different aspects of the project. More about the project as a whole and how it's all going to work can be read at the end of this column.

We need programmers

Basically, to pay 2 people's wages for 3 months, while keeping in mind that they have to pay taxes in Denmark and pay Danish prices for food and livelihood, we find that the lowest acceptable wage per month is EURO 3.000,-, so we are asking for 

2 people for 3 months at EURO 3.000,-/month, giving a total of EURO 18.000,-

Of course, we could do more with more, but our research has led us to the fact that the above can get us where we need to go.

You get

First of all, you get the chance to contribute to something that can actually make a real difference, from the ground up. After all, our children are our future. But we have some perks that we hope you'll like.

  • 1 EURO - Green Gratitude. Every cent counts!
  • 10 EURO - Green Growth Gratitude. Every Euro counts!
  • 25 EURO - Budding Hero. We'll send you a FUTURE FORCE logo badge and a hand written thank you letter, signed by the 5 superheroes. Each badge is different, made from recycled materials.
  • 100 EURO - Future Superhero. We'll send you the same as in the 25 EURO perk, as well as a hand made superhero mask, made from recycled materials and make up a unique FUTURE FORCE superhero alter-ego for you.
  • 500 EURO -  FUTURE FORCER. Within the online platform are a number of small games that teach about solar-power, the circulation of water on the planet and other important issues. You'll receive the perks from both the 25 and 100 EURO levels, as well as a download of all mini-games from the FUTURE FORCE platform.
  • 1000 EURO - Super Green Supporter. You get all of the above perks, as well as a hand painted, specially designed FUTURE FORCE T-shirt, made just for you. The T-shirt will be organic and/or recycled and decorated with environmentally friendly colours.
  • 10000 EURO - The Future is Green! You get all other perks, as well as an invitation to come to Denmark to visit us and see the general rehearsal for the performance. You get to couch-surf at one of the superheroes home and get a sumptuous, organic, home-cooked meal together with all the superheroes. This perk only applies to people within Europe, and we will pay your return train-trip from any European country. 

What if...

We don't reach the amount of funding we are aiming at?

In that case, we'll do the best we can with whatever we have. But if we do get just half way, we hope to be able to use this crowd-funding as leverage to get a sponsor or private grant to cover the rest of the expenses. One thing is for certain: we will work SUPER-HARD to make it happen.

We get more funding than we ask for?

This option would be fantastic. In that case, we will be able to put extra work-hours into the online platform, making it all the more SUPER-FANTASTIC. Also, we can make the whole experience even cooler, from the costumes, through the video production and the props. At the current moment, we have calculated with a budget that allows us very little, if any, slack, so any extra funding can only make things better.

The Entire Concept. How FUTURE FORCE will work and develop in Denmark... 

One day, the kids arrive at school and when they enter their home classroom they find a mystical box standing in the middle of the room.

On the box are clues and riddles which, when solved, lead their way to a Youtube video protected by a password. The video leads to more riddles and clues which all serve to prepare the kids for the day when 5 superheroes visit their school.

These 5, called FUTURE FORCE, turn the classroom into a temporary superhero-base for a couple of hours. This base is the center of an interactive experience with both physical performance, stunts, games and small environmental science workshops. in the course of theses hours, the base/classroom will be attacked by a super-villain and only the kids participation will ward of the danger.

At the end, they find out that the villain has escaped and will continue her attacks and that they are amongst the few who can stop her. Therefore, the 5 adult heroes make the whole class swear an oath to protect the planet against the villain and thus they all become new superheroes, the future of FUTURE FORCE. They all receive a password for an online forum, where they can track the villain and simultaneously work on one of 100 quests. The quests are divided into 10 levels and every time one quest is completed, the young heroes get closer to leveling up. The quests are both personal and group orientated and have to be completed either at home, in public space, alone, with others, with the family, in real life or online. Needless to say, everything is focused on learning how to live a more climate- and environmentally-friendly life. 

Every performance is site-specific at a new school, letting us interact with kids in a place they know and feel at home in. Both the classroom and the school itself will be part of the experience, letting us move both indoors and outdoors, playing with and for the kids.

Our focus is on physical language, keeping spoken words at a simple level, whereby everyone can participate, regardless of their age, language and reading/writing skills.

and beyond...

We start by presenting the project in Danish schools in September - November 2014. The next step is an extended tour to even more Danish schools, while creating a complete documentation of the entire process, turning this into a Build Your Own Future Force "kit".

Open Source interactive theatre-gaming-superhero-fun

The "kit" will be available online for anyone to download, so that they can replicate or create like-minded projects. This includes the entire source-code for the online forum as well as the games and everything else we have created and come up with during the project. We will do our utmost to have it translated to as many languages as possible. We hope to make this possible some time during the first three months of 2015.

Spread the word

Share, share, share. It's all about sharing. Let people know about our campaign through any media you can imagine. Facebook, Twitter, e-mail, snail mail, telephone, SMS, MMS, Spoken Word, Dance, Show and Tell, any way you want!!!

IF YOU ARE A PROGRAMMER AND HAVE THE TIME AND THE WILL TO CONTRIBUTE BY HELPING US DO SOME OF THE CODING FOR US FOR FREE; THAT WOULD BE THE BEST CONTRIBUTION OF ALL!

story:
Million Pounds Project

It’s a simple idea: as citizens interested in lowering carbon emissions, WE ourselves prevent the release of a million pounds of carbon from passenger cars to the atmosphere. How? By helping drivers eliminate mechanical conditions that reduce the fuel efficiency of their cars.

We won’t just contribute to better understanding of why cars on our roads aren't achieving the fuel efficiency designed for.  We will also show what public action can do to reduce carbon emissions!

Carbon Emission from Poorly Maintained Cars

According to recent estimates by the EPA, passenger cars in good condition emit on average more than 10,000 pounds of Carbon Dioxide yearly.  Several abnormal conditions reduce the design fuel efficiency of the cars being used, especially after a few years.  This reduction can be as high as 60%, so emissions of a poorly maintained car could be up to 60% higher than that of a car in good conditions, or up to additional 6,000 pounds of carbon per poorly maintained car.  The most common conditions and the associated losses are the following:



Drivers may be unaware of what they can do to help reduce pollution or they may not be able to afford the fix.  Either way, without intervention the additional emissions keep going into the atmosphere and accelerating climate change for us all. We can do something about that by making the simple and inexpensive repairs happen. Let’s get started!

Project Activities

The Project Team will organize the following activities:

·  Public announcement and call for the participation of drivers interested in the fuel efficiency of their cars at designated garages.

·  Campaign to measure, fix and verify improvement of fuel mileage on each participating car at a designated garage.  Repairs will be financed through the project.

·  Processing of mileage and repairs information to confirm achieving the goal for amount of carbon prevented from release to the atmosphere

·  Writing of report on results and the experience

·  Publishing of report in popular magazines and entering data in several public fuel economy databases in recognized web sites

Immediate Benefit in Pounds of Carbon

Repairing cars to increase their fuel efficiency by a conservative estimate of 10% means that each car will reduce carbon emissions by 1,000 pounds per year. We can fix 1,000 cars and produce a yearly reduction of at least ONE MILLION POUNDS.

Benefits in Understanding Causes of Emission

Data on actual MPG measurements, repairs, and emission reductions will be collected from thousands of cars of different makes and models.  This data will be publically available to consumers, car manufacturers and regulating agencies, helping to make better decisions about cars, driving and the environmental impact.

Benefits in Motivating Public Action

A thousand drivers, acting to stop carbon emissions and demonstrating their personal and common benefits, will influence many more thousands of drivers to follow their example.

Required Investment

Repairing the abnormal conditions varies from $0 (correctly inflating tires) to $200 (replacing a damaged catalytic converter).  A target of $100 average per repair is very conservative.  So initial estimate of $100,000 to fix at least 1,000 cars in order to stop at least a million pounds of carbon is a perfectly achievable goal.  Let’s do it! 

The Project Team

Three garages are on board already.  Gustavo and Alex in Wilmington, DE, Luis and Luis in Orlando, FL, and Danny and Sonia in Pittsburg, Pa are ready to start measuring mileage and fixing cars.  Others will join later.


    Gustavo and Alex in Wilmington, DE


Luis and the other Luis in Orlando, FL

story:
Between the money that came in through the Indiegogo, and checks and donations made offline, 

133 people and organizations chipped in and WE FUNDED THE AD!  Be sure to call the Governors office TODAY at 503-378-4582. 


Help Stop Oregon from Becoming a Fossil Fuel Export Hub 

Out-of-state fossil fuel companies want to make Oregon a hub for fracked gas exports. Two LNG export proposals – the Oregon LNG project and the Jordan Cove LNG project – threaten our climate, rivers and salmon, existing jobs, private property owners, and the health and safety of rural communities. We need Governor Kate Brown to stand up for Oregon and say NO to LNG Exports, and we need her to do it now. A diverse coalition of community organizations, environmental groups, landowners, and more are going to run a full-page ad in the Oregonian on October 4 to publicize a statewide call-in day to the Governor's office on October 5.  

We need to raise $10,585.86 by Oct. 3 to run the ad below in the Oregonian on Sunday Oct. 5.

In addition to the amount listed the the right, we have an additional $1,350 that has come in through the mail! Thanks for all the support. 



Why the urgency? 

The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) will release its Final Environmental Impact Statement for the Jordan Cove LNG Export project on Sept. 30th, most likely rubberstamping the project, while the Oregon LNG project has entered their public comment period.  Shutting down these proposals now lies in the hands of our state environmental agencies – the Department of Environmental Quality and the Department of State Lands.  These agencies are getting pressure from project proponents to speed up the permitting process. The Governor needs to make sure that the state considers the devastating impacts that the federal government has ignored which should prevent the LNG projects from going forward.  

Help make the ad have a big impact:  

  • Share the Indiegogo campaign all over social media, and invite your friends and family to donate whatever they can. It all helps, from $1 to $1000. 
  • Join the call-in day on Monday Oct. 5 by calling Governor Brown at 503-378-4582 to ask her to say no to LNG exports through Oregon.

Why a paid ad? 

Generally, we think big paid political ad's are not the best use of money. But this is a special situation. We have held rallies, we have published hundreds of letters to the editor, we have collected thousands of petitions, we have met with our elected officials, we have organized call-in days…but Governor Kate Brown isn't listening. We all urgently need to ramp up our outreach to people in Portland, Salem, and the rest of the state.  This full-page ad in the Oregonians will reach thousands of new people. This ad is part of an intensified statewide campaign to make it clear that Kate Brown has a choice to make. Will Gov. Brown stand up for climate action, clean energy jobs, property rights, and Oregon communities? Or will she stand with big corporate special interests? 

Who is sponsoring this campaign? 

  • Stand Up For Oregon!: No LNG. No Pipeline is a diverse coalition of community organizations, individuals, landowners, business owners and more who are working hard to stop our state from becoming a fossil fuel export hub for fracked natural gas.
  • Find out more about the campaign at NoLNGExports.org
  • Find out more about the proposed Jordan Cove LNG Export Project at http://www.36inchesmovie.com/
  • Find out more about the Oregon LNG Project at http://columbiariverkeeper.org/our-work/lng/
